First, in most industrialized countries, there is a number of companies that holds heavy factories in their constitutions. The waste products and harmful gases produced by these factories cause a significant amount of air pollution. While these companies make a huge amount of money from their businesses, most of them are not considering to take precautions to reduce the amount of air pollution. If these companies were obliged to pay to clean up the air pollution, they would at least make an effort to reduce the amount of air pollution they cause.Second, private individuals cause air pollution in several ways such as inessential use of cars and house heating. As house heating is a major need in the winter time, some households do not consider to use filters to reduce the amount of pollution that the heating causes. Instead of this, some expensive vehicles cause a huge amount of pollution. In my opinion, by charging private individuals for causing air pollution, that will at least contribute to reduce the amount of the pollution. On the other hand, I believe that governments should restrict the use of products that cause air pollution for both individuals and companies. Governments also should use an amount of money from their budgets to clean up the air, instead of putting all the responsibility to companies and private individuals. In conclusion, due to the fact that governments are responsible to provide a healthy environment for their inhabitants and they should be responsible from cleaning up the air pollution, both companies and private individuals should take the main part to clean up the air pollution.
llm: Air pollution poses a significant threat to the environment, contributing to ozone depletion and exacerbating global warming. To mitigate this issue, I argue that private individuals and companies should bear more responsibility for cleaning up air pollution. One potential solution is to impose a financial burden on those who contribute to pollution, incentivizing them to reduce their environmental impact.In many industrialized countries, large corporations operate factories that generate substantial amounts of waste and harmful emissions, significantly contributing to air pollution. Despite reaping substantial profits, many of these companies neglect to implement measures to minimize their pollution output. By obliging them to pay for the cleanup of air pollution, they would be motivated to reduce their emissions and adopt more sustainable practices.Private individuals also play a role in air pollution through unnecessary activities such as excessive car use and inefficient house heating. During winter, many households rely on heating, but some fail to use filters to reduce pollution from heating systems. Additionally, certain vehicles emit high levels of pollutants. In my opinion, charging private individuals for their contribution to air pollution would encourage them to adopt more environmentally friendly habits, ultimately reducing overall pollution levels.However, governments also have a critical role to play in addressing air pollution. They should restrict the use of products that cause pollution, both for individuals and companies. Furthermore, governments should allocate a portion of their budget to clean up the air, rather than placing the entire burden on companies and private individuals.In conclusion, while governments are ultimately responsible for providing a healthy environment for their citizens, private individuals and companies must take the lead in cleaning up air pollution. By sharing the responsibility and implementing measures such as financial incentives and restrictions on polluting products, we can work towards reducing air pollution and mitigating its harmful effects on the environment.

question: High sales of a product are mainly due to good advertisment strategies. To what extend to you agree or disagree?
human: Everyday, companies offer a huge number of different products to consumers. The most effective way to convince consumers to purchase a product is through advertising. However, it is not sufficient in itself. The product also should satisfy the needs of the consumers. In my opinion, advertising is the major reason for high sales of a product for several reasons. We are mainly introduced to products through advertisements. Therefore, advertisers push the limits of creativity to dispose the consumers to purchase the product. When the consumers are impressed by the way a product is advertised, they can be convinced to consider that the product is a need in some cases. Recently, there is a very creative advertisements of a soft drink product on TV. The story delivers a desired call to drink that soft drink that people tend to drink when the weather is too hot. As a result of this, the number of that product being sold will increases. Also, the more an advertisement of a product takes place in mass media, the more popular the product becomes. Advertisement is the most effective way to create a well-known product. Consumers tend to purchase the most known product when it comes to picking one out of two different brands of the same product. When a product is commonly used, it becomes trustworthy for the society, no matter what quality it is. However, it also has to be affordable for the consumer. Considering this fact, advertisements have undeniable affects on the society about the product being advertised. They make the product preferable. In conclusion, as I believe that consumers should consider major needs when they purchase goods, high sales are obviously a reflection of the powerful advertisements.
llm: In today's market, companies offer a vast array of products to consumers. While advertising is a crucial factor in convincing consumers to make a purchase, it is not enough on its own. The product must also meet the needs and expectations of the consumer. In my opinion, advertising plays a significant role in driving high sales figures, and there are several reasons why this is the case.We are often first introduced to products through advertisements, which is why advertisers strive to be creative and persuasive in their messaging. When consumers are impressed by an advertisement, they may become convinced that the product is a necessity. For example, a recent TV advertisement for a soft drink featured a compelling storyline that encouraged viewers to reach for the product on hot days. As a result, sales of the product are likely to increase.Furthermore, the more frequently an advertisement appears in mass media, the more recognizable and popular the product becomes. Advertising is the most effective way to create a well-known brand, and consumers often opt for the most familiar product when choosing between two similar brands. When a product is widely used, it tends to become trusted by society, regardless of its quality. However, affordability is also an essential factor for consumers. Considering these points, advertisements have a profound impact on society, making the advertised product more desirable and preferable.In conclusion, I believe that consumers should prioritize their major needs when making purchasing decisions. High sales figures are often a reflection of effective advertising, which can influence consumer behavior and drive demand for a product.

question: Some people believe a country will benefit greatly by a high percentage of young people go to university. Others argue that it only leads to unemployment. Discuss both and give your own opinion.
human: Persistent deliberation is happening as to whether it is desirable for the youth to go to university. In regard to the development of the country, some people believe that it is essential for young students to get high quality of education in universities, while others think that it is only one of causes to increase the rate of unemployment. In this essay, I will analyze both views first in order to come up with a fool-proof decision.To begin with, those who advocate the impracticability of university have several reasons. From their point of view, the fact is that there are numerous job opportunities for those who do not have the certification of university graduation, such as mechanics, sales persons, or engineers, and, furthermore, labors for graduates are in short supply. What is worse, the labor market for highly educated students is now too competitive to get a job after finishing their studying. In this regard it is a loss of national productivity that young people spend much time on searching for high salary jobs, even can be a sheer time-consuming.However, on the other side of the coin are voices in the opposition, saying that universities provide not only skills for careers, but also academic knowledge for the human race, such as bio science, politics, and medicine. These academic values are necessary to the progress of the world. More importantly, many researches in the ivory-tower have created ingenious discoveries and achievements for the development of modern society. Another significant factor of universities is that diverse experiences in the campus life can make the young generation more competently because there are a number of chances through internships, deeper discussion, independent life, and exchange scholarships.To sum up both contentions about the necessity of universities' education have reasonable justifications; however, I agree with the latter view. Although higher education does not guarantee young students' success, the benefits of learning in universities are the vital factor in creating more possibilities for the development of society through advancing academic fulfillment and the young generation who have experiences and challenges.
llm: There is ongoing debate about whether it is beneficial for young people to attend university. Some argue that it is crucial for students to receive high-quality education at universities in order to contribute to the country's development, while others believe that it may actually contribute to higher unemployment rates. This essay will examine both perspectives in order to arrive at a well-informed decision.On the one hand, those who oppose university education present several arguments. From their perspective, there are numerous job opportunities available to those without a university degree, such as mechanics, salespeople, and engineers. Furthermore, job opportunities for graduates are scarce. The labor market for highly educated individuals is also highly competitive, making it difficult for them to secure employment after completing their studies. This can result in a significant waste of national productivity, as young people spend a substantial amount of time searching for high-paying jobs, which can be a time-consuming and futile endeavor.On the other hand, there are those who argue that universities provide not only career skills but also essential academic knowledge that benefits humanity, such as biology, politics, and medicine. These academic pursuits are necessary for global progress. Moreover, research conducted at universities has led to numerous groundbreaking discoveries and achievements that have contributed to the advancement of modern society. Another significant advantage of universities is that the diverse experiences and opportunities available on campus, such as internships, in-depth discussions, independent living, and exchange scholarships, can make the younger generation more competent and well-rounded.In conclusion, both arguments for and against the necessity of university education have valid justifications. However, I agree with the latter perspective. Although higher education does not guarantee success for young students, the benefits of learning at universities are a crucial factor in creating more opportunities for societal development through the advancement of academic knowledge and the empowerment of the young generation, who gain valuable experiences and challenges that prepare them for the future.

question: There are social, medical and technical problems associated with the use of mobile phones. What form do these problems take? Do problems of using mobile phones outweigh the benefits?
human: Nowadays, the popularity of mobile phones has brought about a lot of convenience but at the meanwhile a variety of problems as well, such as social, medical and technical problems. However, I do not think these disadvantages will outweigh the advantages brought by cell phones. In this essay, I would like to analyze these three issues in order to support my viewpoint.First of all, almost everything that changed our lifestyle a lot will also cause some social problems. Mobile phones are not out of expectation. Speaking loudly on the phone in public areas, such as schools, libraries and hospitals appears to be very impolite and offensive. What is worse, some students utilize their cell phones as an effective cheating tools in examinations in which they can send and receive answers by texting each other. Nevertheless, it is not impossible to solve these problems, as long as some regulations and rules can be effectively implemented.It is also worth mentioning that some harmful effects on our health are lethal. It has been proved that overusing of the electronic devices including mobile phones could lead to higher possibility of suffering hearing loss and even cancers, although the further investigation are needed.Another debatable problem is about techniques. There is panic among people that their conversation can be intercepted by the third party. This possibility exists all the time. But a more efficient and reliable system can also be invented to guarantee the private information of users.Moreover, the mobile phone has become a dispensable multifunctional tools in people's daily life. Not only used for communication, but it also functions as an Internet browser, a music player, a personal organizer and so forth.In conclusion, nothing can be overused without side effects. The contribution of the mobile phone to our modern society is prominent and people's dependence on it is irreversible, although it has a number of problems that should be well handled.
llm: The rise of mobile phones has brought about unprecedented convenience, but also a multitude of problems, including social, medical, and technical issues. However, I firmly believe that the benefits of mobile phones outweigh their drawbacks. In this essay, I will examine these three concerns to substantiate my stance.Firstly, it is inevitable that any significant change in our lifestyle will give rise to social problems. Mobile phones are no exception. The inappropriate use of mobile phones in public areas, such as schools, libraries, and hospitals, is considered rude and disruptive. Furthermore, some students exploit their mobile phones as a means to cheat during exams, exchanging answers via text messages. Nevertheless, these problems can be mitigated with the implementation of effective regulations and rules.It is also noteworthy that excessive mobile phone use can have severe health consequences. Research has shown that prolonged use of electronic devices, including mobile phones, may increase the risk of hearing loss and even cancer, although further investigation is required to confirm these findings.Another contentious issue is the technical aspect of mobile phone security. There is a growing concern that conversations can be intercepted by third parties, a possibility that always exists. However, it is also possible to develop more efficient and reliable systems to safeguard users' private information.On the other hand, mobile phones have become indispensable multifunctional tools in daily life. They serve not only as a means of communication but also as internet browsers, music players, personal organizers, and more.In conclusion, while it is true that nothing can be used excessively without adverse effects, the contributions of mobile phones to modern society are undeniable, and people's dependence on them is irreversible. Although mobile phones pose several challenges that need to be addressed, their benefits ultimately outweigh their drawbacks.

question: Using computer every day can have more negative than positive effects on your children? do you agree or disagree?
human: Nowadays, thanks to the development of technology, computer is now indispensable to life. Some people think that computer is good for children and it should be used daily by children but some others think differently. In my opinion, the latter opinion is true.First, using computer constantly has bad influence on children's eyes. When they concentrate on computer for too long, their eyes will get tired, which is the main reason for some eyes problems, typically shortsighted.Moreover, children who play games too much on computer can seriously lack communicating skills, they will know little about the outside life. It is a well-known fact that people who are addicted to games, especially online games, can eventually bear dangerous consequences. For instance, several teenagers play games without rest, which leads to health depression, a typical example is the death of Korean gamer, who had a non-stop playing for 3 days.Finally, even people who are not interested in online game can still be negatively affected by using computer too much. Some social surveys have shown that a few children use computer for studying purpose, most of them are attracted by facebook, blog, etc. instead. Due to this neglect, they will have a bad result in school because when they can not live without internet, they will have no time for their studying.In conclusion, although it is undeniable that computer is a crucial part of human life, it still has its bad side, especially for children. People should learn how to use it properly to make it an effective tool because computer should be used not only for entertaining but also for working and studying purpose.
llm: In today's world, where technology has advanced significantly, computers have become an essential part of our daily lives. There is an ongoing debate about whether computers are beneficial for children and should be used by them on a daily basis. Some individuals believe that computers are advantageous for kids, while others disagree. In my opinion, the latter viewpoint holds more truth.Firstly, constant computer use can have detrimental effects on children's eyesight. Prolonged periods of focusing on a computer screen can lead to eye strain, which is a primary cause of various eye problems, most notably shortsightedness.Moreover, excessive computer gaming can severely impair children's communication skills, leaving them with limited knowledge about the world outside their screens. It is well-documented that individuals addicted to games, especially online games, can face severe consequences. For instance, several teenagers have been known to play games non-stop, leading to health issues such as depression. A notable example is the case of a Korean gamer who died after playing continuously for three days.Lastly, even those who are not interested in online gaming can still be negatively affected by excessive computer use. Social surveys have indicated that while some children use computers for educational purposes, the majority are drawn to social media platforms like Facebook and blogs instead. This distraction can lead to poor academic performance, as children who are unable to disconnect from the internet will have little time for their studies.In conclusion, although the importance of computers in human life is undeniable, they also have a downside, particularly for children. It is crucial for people to learn how to use computers appropriately, making them an effective tool for not just entertainment, but also for work and educational purposes. By doing so, we can maximize the benefits of computers while minimizing their negative impacts.

question: Large factory near your community. Advantages and disadvantages of this new influence on your community.
human: Nowadays, whether to establish large factories nearby housing areas has become a controversial issue in our society. Out of the case of economic development, industrial buildings are a necessary part of modern society. However a vast number of people are against building a factory near their community because of pollution. From my point of view, the advantages of building a factory will outweigh its disadvantages, if we tackle the environmental problems brought by factories.First of all, a large factory can stimulate local economic growth and reduce the unemployment rate. To manufacture goods, there must be the demand of laborers, from which the local residents can benefit. What is more, the factory is not isolated, other industries and business will be quickly established, resulting in economic growth of local area. For example, the estate industry will be boosted in order to satisfy the workers' accommodation need.The main disadvantage is contamination. It is true that some area are suffering the dire consequences caused by overdeveloping the industry, such as water pollution, overcrowded traffic and medical problems. For instance, in some industrial cities, a large proportion of the workers are suffering various breathing problems, such as asthma which can be caused by waste ashes and certain chemical substances.However, it is inevitable that there will be more factories built with the development of our society. Therefore, how to improve the disadvantages of building a factory would be more important than whether to build it. In fact most problems can be avoidable if the factories put in real and great effort to manage their waste well.In conclusion, installation of manufacturing plant is a trend of industrialization for many countries. Its advantages will outweigh disadvantages as long as the factories dispose their waste and pollution in the correct way.
llm: The debate about constructing large factories near residential areas has become a contentious issue in today's society. While industrial buildings are a necessary component of modern society, driving economic development, many people oppose their construction due to concerns about pollution. In my opinion, the benefits of building a factory outweigh the drawbacks if environmental issues are effectively addressed.Firstly, a large factory can boost local economic growth and decrease unemployment rates. The demand for labor to manufacture goods creates job opportunities for local residents. Moreover, the establishment of a factory often leads to the development of other industries and businesses, resulting in economic growth in the area. For instance, the real estate industry may experience a surge to meet the accommodation needs of workers.The primary disadvantage of factories is pollution. Over-industrialization has led to severe environmental and health problems in some areas, including water pollution, traffic congestion, and medical issues. For example, workers in some industrial cities suffer from respiratory problems like asthma, which can be caused by waste ashes and chemicals.However, as our society continues to develop, the construction of more factories is inevitable. Therefore, focusing on mitigating the negative impacts of factories is more crucial than debating their construction. In fact, most problems can be avoided if factories make a genuine effort to manage their waste and pollution responsibly.In conclusion, the establishment of manufacturing plants is a natural trend in the industrialization process of many countries. As long as factories properly dispose of waste and pollution, the advantages of their construction will outweigh the disadvantages, making them a valuable component of modern society.

question: Food is now easier to prepare. Is this a good thing?
human: Nowadays, more and more people begin to select prepared food as their daily meals, since it can effectively save time which is considered as money in our modern society. However it is obvious that prepared food can bring about some negative influence result from utilizing the artificial ingredients, ignoring the nutrition of food and modifying people's eating habits. In this essay, I would like to explain why this is not a good thing based on the three reasons above.First of all, to make their food easier to prepare and taste delicious, almost every producer adds a wide range of artificial ingredients in to the food that is now purchased by most people. Some ingredients being added have caused dire consequences. For instance, there are usually some articles in newspapers and magazines which report the relationship between certain chemical components in some food and diseases. Thus, easy-to-cook foods sometimes could be dangerous for human's health.Not cooking fresh food will also lead to the lack of nutrition. It is true that cooking prepared food needs much less time in comparison with the fresh food. Whereas some research has apparently demonstrated that prepared food is unable to support enough nutrients we need, especially for children who are growing up.In addition, cooking is one of arts humans create. The more prepared food we eat the more cooking skills we lose. At the increasing living pace, the majority of people tend to choose microwave as their unique cooker that help them prepare a dish in five minutes. But rare people have been aware that this has contributed to a modification of cooking habits, which may cause the loss of our custom and culture about cooking.In conclusion, although the invention of prepared foods definitely satisfies the demand of some people who are busy in their work, it is not a good thing. Cooking is not a waste of time, contrarily, it is crucial for our health and culture.
llm: In today's fast-paced world, many people are turning to pre-prepared meals as a convenient option for their daily nutrition. The perceived benefit of saving time, which is often viewed as a valuable commodity in modern society, is a major driving force behind this trend. However, the reliance on pre-prepared food has several detrimental effects, including the use of artificial ingredients, the disregard for nutritional value, and the alteration of eating habits. This essay will delve into these issues, arguing that the proliferation of pre-prepared meals is not beneficial, based on these three key concerns.Firstly, the production of pre-prepared food often involves the addition of a wide array of artificial ingredients to enhance taste and ease of preparation. Unfortunately, some of these additives have been linked to severe health consequences. News articles and research studies frequently highlight the correlation between certain chemical components in food and the onset of diseases. This underscores the potential health risks associated with consuming pre-prepared foods.Moreover, the shift away from fresh food preparation can lead to a deficiency in essential nutrients. While pre-prepared meals require significantly less time to cook compared to fresh food, research indicates that they often fail to provide the necessary nutrients, particularly for children during their developmental stages. This nutritional shortfall can have long-term implications for health and wellbeing.Additionally, the increasing reliance on pre-prepared foods threatens the preservation of culinary skills and cultural heritage. Cooking is an art form that not only provides sustenance but also embodies tradition and cultural identity. As people increasingly opt for quick, microwaveable meals, there is a noticeable decline in cooking skills. This trend contributes to a modification of eating habits, potentially leading to the erosion of culinary customs and cultural practices related to food preparation.In conclusion, while pre-prepared foods may cater to the time constraints of busy individuals, they are not without their drawbacks. Contrary to the perception that cooking is a waste of time, it is, in fact, essential for maintaining health, preserving cultural traditions, and fostering a deeper appreciation for the art of food preparation. Therefore, it is crucial to recognize the value of cooking and the potential negative impacts of a diet heavily reliant on pre-prepared meals.

question: The best and only way to assist developing countries is to provide them with financial aid. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
human: As is commonly understood, there is an increasingly gap between developed countries and developing countries. It can be seen that some developed countries and organization are proving financial assistance to the impoverished countries. However, it is disagreed that this can be the best and only way to assist developing countries. This will be proven by analyzing the necessity of developing their education and the real objective of supporters.Firstly, education is an essential part in development. For instance, most developing countries are lack of educational resources, such as experienced teachers, evaluation systems and teaching facilities, which is usually neglected by local authorities. From this example, it is obvious that if the developed countries are unwilling to share their successful experience in education, the developing countries will remain undeveloped, even though they gain a great deal of economic support. Thus, the critical method to improve the condition of poor countries is to help them build up a complete educational system instead of financial aid.In addition, it is well acknowledged that there is no free lunch in the world. This means some powerful countries provide financial support in order to acquire the right to exploit the local resources and target the local labour market. Indeed, they rarely provide local residents with any technological aid and even cause contamination in some areas. Therefore, developing countries should not totally depend on the financial support from powerful countries.In conclusion, financial aid is not the only way to assist poor countries. And it has been proven that developing education and improving national technology and science level are the path they have to undergo if they really want to alter current situation.
llm: The disparity between developed and developing countries is a well-known issue that has been growing increasingly. While some developed countries and organizations provide financial assistance to impoverished nations, it is argued that this is not the most effective or sole means of support. This argument will be substantiated by examining the importance of education and the true intentions of supporters.First and foremost, education plays a vital role in development. Many developing countries lack essential educational resources, such as experienced teachers, evaluation systems, and teaching facilities, which are often overlooked by local authorities. For instance, the absence of these resources hinders the development of these countries, even if they receive significant economic support. Therefore, the most critical approach to improving the condition of poor countries is to assist them in establishing a comprehensive educational system, rather than relying solely on financial aid.Moreover, it is a widely accepted notion that there is no such thing as a free lunch in the world. This implies that powerful countries often provide financial support with the ulterior motive of gaining the right to exploit local resources and tap into the local labor market. In reality, they rarely offer technological assistance to local residents and may even cause environmental degradation in some areas. Consequently, developing countries should not solely rely on financial support from powerful countries.In conclusion, financial aid is not the only means of supporting impoverished nations. It has been demonstrated that developing education, enhancing national technology, and advancing scientific levels are essential steps that developing countries must take if they genuinely wish to alter their current situation. By focusing on these areas, developing countries can work towards achieving sustainable development and reducing their dependence on external financial support.

question: Society should ban all forms of the advertising because it has no purpose and causes damages. Do you agree or disagree?
human: It is no secret that advertising become inseparable part of our modern life. We come across with ads almost everywhere and everyday. Some people argue that companies by advertising their goods or services spend their money for nothing. Other critics say that ads have no purpose, they only cause damages to society and all forms of advertising should be banned. On my part I would like to solve this issue on a different way. Society does need an advertising but it is our responsibility to control the content and what kind of goods and services we would like to offer to our customers.First of all, I do support the idea that advertising alcohol, cigarettes, goods and services with adult content should be prohibited because these kind of ads will have negative effect to our children. Youngsters might be tempted to buy cigarettes or alcohol and later to start consume it on a daily basis. Fortunately, some countries take this issue seriously and advertising alcohol, cigarettes and materials with adult content is banned on those countries.On the other hand by advertising companies, businesses, firms and individuals promote their goods and services. Thanks to ads we learn about new products, we can compare them and choose what’s the best for us.These days, not only many businesses, but also governments have to rely on advertising. For example, tourism makes up one-third of the Czech Republic's economy. In order to promote the country's attractions, the Czech government has to advertise and sell its services to foreign consumers. Only well planned and well targeted advertising will bring more foreign tourists to the country.In conclusion, I think that modern society needs advertising. Ads will keep us well informed about new products and services, but we should also bear in mind that advertising cigarettes and alcohol will definitely affect our children in negative way.
llm: The prevalence of advertising in our daily lives is undeniable. We are constantly bombarded with ads, and opinions about their usefulness vary. Some argue that companies waste their resources on advertising, while others believe that ads serve no purpose and should be completely banned due to the harm they cause to society. However, I propose a more nuanced approach to this issue. In my opinion, advertising is a necessary component of modern society, but it is our collective responsibility to regulate its content and ensure that the goods and services being promoted are suitable for our audience.Firstly, I firmly believe that advertising certain products, such as alcohol, cigarettes, and goods with adult content, should be prohibited. Exposure to these ads can have a detrimental influence on children, potentially leading them to develop unhealthy habits like smoking or drinking. Fortunately, some countries have taken steps to address this concern, banning such advertisements to protect their young citizens.On the other hand, advertising plays a vital role in promoting goods and services offered by companies, businesses, and individuals. Through ads, we gain knowledge about new products, enabling us to compare and select the best options for our needs. In today's economy, not only private businesses but also governments rely heavily on advertising. For instance, tourism constitutes a significant portion of the Czech Republic's economy, with the government needing to advertise the country's attractions to attract foreign visitors. Well-planned and targeted advertising is crucial in this context, as it can effectively draw more tourists and boost the economy.In conclusion, I firmly believe that modern society benefits from advertising, as it keeps us informed about new products and services. Nonetheless, it is imperative to acknowledge the negative impact that advertising certain harmful products, like cigarettes and alcohol, can have on children. By striking a balance and responsibly managing the content of advertisements, we can harness the benefits of advertising while protecting the well-being of our society, especially its younger members.

question: Nowadays there are more opportunities for women than there were in the past. Some people think that women should work to earn money whereas other people belief that women should care about household. What's your opinion?
human: Personally, I believe that married women nowadays have right to take up jobs like men when employment discrimination based on gender have been erased significantly. Working outside home will bring a lot of benefits to both married woman and their household. I will mention some basic reasons as following.Firstly, extra income that women earn will contribute to their family's expenses. By taking up a job, a wife can earn more money to support her family life. This is really necessary in cases of her husband's low salary and the difficulty of getting a good job at the present. So, it is a normal practice for women to be helpmates in earning money.Secondly, working outside the house creates opportunities for married women to contact with the outer world, strengthen their character and show their capacity. These things in turn will make them more confident, independent. These women will set a good example for their children. Therefore, it is no doubt that they play roles as a mother and as a wife better.Last but not least, nowadays, there are many supporting conditions that help women balance housework and work. Besides the gorvernment's policies on limited families and their husbands' sharing in the housework, many employers are willing to offer part-time jobs for women.In conclusion, a well-organized home does not need the housewife's presence the whole day long and married women could go to work in order to enjoy the working life outside the home.
llm: Firstly, the additional income earned by women can significantly contribute to their family's expenses. By taking up a job, a wife can supplement her family's income, which is especially important when her husband's salary is low or when job opportunities are scarce. Therefore, it is a common and necessary practice for women to share the financial responsibilities with their husbands.Secondly, working outside the home provides married women with opportunities to interact with the outside world, develop their character, and demonstrate their capabilities. This, in turn, boosts their confidence and independence. As a result, they become better role models for their children and are able to fulfill their responsibilities as mothers and wives more effectively.Lastly, there are now various support systems in place to help women balance their work and household responsibilities. Government policies that encourage shared family responsibilities, husbands who are willing to contribute to household chores, and employers who offer part-time jobs for women all facilitate this balance.In conclusion, a well-managed home does not require the housewife's constant presence, and married women can pursue careers to enjoy the benefits of working life outside the home.

question: The government has to provide primary and secondary education, but for university education either students or their parents should pay. To what extent do you agree?
human: Primary and secondary education provide a basic knowledge and skills to the people in this world. I completely agree that government should provide those education to their people; however, for the more higher education like university, the students or their parents should pay for the fees.Some parents might not have enough money to pay for their children university fees. In the other hand, I don't think it is also fair for the government as the government has been paying a lot of money for their students' primary and secondary education. It is better for them to use the money to pay for the other students' education so that all people in their country could receive the same education.Moreover, students that already have a basic knowledge and education can get a part-time job and they can pay for their own studies when their parent could not afford to pay it. They will be more responsible with their studies when they pay the fees themselves. In addition to that, the students will become more independent and it will build their characters in the marketplace as well.Furthermore, this will encourage all the parents to think of the way to help their children to achieve more in their lives as they need to make some contribution too for their children future.In conclusion, I completely agree that government should not pay for the university fees because this will make both the parents and students in charge for their future themselves not just depend on the government to do all their responsibilities for them.
llm: I firmly believe that primary and secondary education are essential in providing people with fundamental knowledge and skills. It is the government's responsibility to provide these basic levels of education to its citizens. However, when it comes to higher education, such as university, I think it is reasonable that students or their parents should bear the cost of tuition fees.While some parents may struggle to afford university fees for their children, I also consider it unfair to expect the government to cover these costs, given the significant investment they already make in primary and secondary education. Instead, the government could allocate these funds to support other students in accessing basic education, promoting equality in educational opportunities across the country.Students who have acquired basic knowledge and education are capable of securing part-time jobs to finance their own university studies if their parents are unable to do so. By paying their own fees, students become more accountable for their academic pursuits. Moreover, this independence fosters personal growth and prepares them for the professional world.This approach also encourages parents to think creatively about how to support their children's future aspirations, recognizing that they too have a role to play in contributing to their children's educational and career goals.In conclusion, I strongly agree that the government should not be responsible for covering university fees. By doing so, both parents and students are empowered to take charge of their own futures, rather than relying solely on government support. This shared responsibility promotes a sense of ownership and motivation among individuals to achieve their educational and professional objectives.

question: The first car appeared on British roads in 1888. By the year 2000 there may be as many as 29million vehicles on British roads. Alternative forms of transport should be encouraged and international laws introduced to control car ownership and use. To what extend do you agree or disagree?
human: Recently, a great deal of attention has been paid to means of transportation. Some state that automobile is the most convenient transportation, while others assert that alternative forms of transport should be considered in view of environmental pollution. In my opinion, I strongly agree that alternative means of transportation and international laws in controlling automobiles should be introduced. In this essay, several reasons will be described carefully in the following passages.Firstly, an increase in the number of automobiles brings about environmental pollution. Since automobile exhaust and carbon dioxides emission have bad impacts on the air, the air gets to be polluted and it causes respiratory disease of the local inhabitants. Therefore, it is crucial to alter automobiles to the other means of transportation and to legislate to control automobiles.Secondly, an increase in the number of automobiles causes terrible traffic congestion. Once we get into the traffic jam, it forces us to waste our time for a while. What is worse, traffic congestion irritates drivers and as a result, it leads to an increase of traffic accidents. Thus, the methods to reduce the number of automobiles and to control car ownership and use should be immediately planned and implemented.In order to solve these problems, alternative forms of transportation and international laws to control automobiles ownership and use can work effectively. With regard to the former, alternative forms which emit less carbon dioxides and gasses than automobiles are ideal. For example, rental bicycle system has been introduced in several European countries. This system is that at the corner of each district, the rental bicycles are placed and the people can ride it to the other districts with a small fee. Since bicycle expels neither carbon dioxides nor harmful gasses, it is a better form to protect environment than automobile. As for the latter point, the introduction of international laws can be also effective. For instance, there are some regulations to limit the use of automobiles by time and to allow the people possess one car only. Thus, these attempts to reduce automobiles can ease traffic congestion and environmental pollution.In summary, even though some people claim the convenience of automobile, I would state that alternative forms of transport and international laws on controlling automobiles are necessary due to the environmental protection and the alleviation of traffic congestion.
llm: In recent years, the topic of transportation has garnered significant attention. While some argue that cars are the most convenient mode of transportation, others contend that alternative modes should be considered due to environmental concerns. I strongly agree that alternative transportation methods and international regulations to control car usage should be implemented. This essay will outline several key reasons to support this stance.Firstly, the rising number of cars on the road leads to increased environmental pollution. The exhaust fumes and carbon dioxide emissions from cars have detrimental effects on air quality, contributing to respiratory diseases among local residents. Therefore, it is essential to shift towards alternative modes of transportation and establish laws to regulate car usage.Secondly, the growing number of cars results in severe traffic congestion. Getting stuck in traffic jams wastes valuable time and can also irritate drivers, leading to an increase in traffic accidents. To address this issue, methods to reduce car ownership and usage should be devised and implemented promptly.To tackle these problems, alternative transportation modes and international laws regulating car ownership and usage can be effective solutions. Alternative modes, such as those that emit fewer carbon dioxide and gases than cars, are ideal. For instance, several European countries have introduced rental bicycle systems, where bikes are stationed at district corners and can be ridden to other areas for a small fee. As bicycles do not emit harmful gases or carbon dioxide, they offer a more environmentally friendly option compared to cars. International laws can also be effective, such as regulations limiting car usage by time and restricting individuals to owning only one car. These efforts to reduce car numbers can alleviate traffic congestion and environmental pollution.In conclusion, despite the perceived convenience of cars, I firmly believe that alternative transportation modes and international regulations to control car usage are necessary for environmental protection and reducing traffic congestion.

question: Rich countries should provide financial help to poor contries. To what extend to you agree or disagree?
human: In this world, there is no one who does not know this world 'globalization', which means the world are more closer, and every single countries affects each other more than before in many ways. That is why governmental and non-governmental organizations have been focus on being harmony and contribute to aid to poor countries. It is true that just giving aid to impoverished countries could be manipulated by big power countries. In addition, a great amount of materials and money have poor countries being corrupted and politically dependent on other countries. However, I agree that aiding poor countries has positive effects, overweighing its side-effects for the several reasons.First of all, poor counties suffer from shortage of basic materials and facilities to start businesses and make it richer. To be out of poverty, it is fundamental to support basic industry related factors such as light, electricity, load, highways, natural resources, technology and buildings for companies. Aiding help poor countries in this situation solve their economical problems and run their own business. In actual, republic of Korea used to be the poorest country even compared to others in Africa in 1960's. Now that it has became strong economy country aiding poor countries after 10 years of aid from other counties.Secondly, aiding campaign gives a chance to considerate about poor people. If people in rich countries ponder poor people suffering from poverty and diseases, they would never take their abundance for granted. It not only raises the notice the meaning of harmony and love, but also be a good chance to learn humane doctrine of globalization.Third, the campaigns might include practical benefits. In globalized world, the economies of several countries are in a big network and must influence on each others. When America mortgage loan system went bad, several economies of European and Asian countries fluctuated, even any countries had to be gotten international supports to block its bankrupt.In conclusion, there are abovementioned three key points of positive effects of aid; supporting poor countries to make its economy strong and building humane concepts to people, keeping strong global economy. I strongly believe that being a global neighbor by aiding poor countries would be continues by many organizations and volunteers, and it will make the earth a better place to live.
llm: In today's world, the concept of "globalization" is universally recognized, implying that the world has become a more interconnected place where every country influences and is influenced by others in numerous ways. As a result, both governmental and non-governmental organizations have been focusing on promoting harmony and providing aid to impoverished nations. While it is true that simply providing aid to poor countries can be manipulated by powerful nations, and that a significant amount of resources and funding can lead to corruption and political dependence, I firmly believe that assisting poor countries has overwhelmingly positive effects for several reasons.Firstly, poor countries often lack the basic materials and infrastructure necessary to establish and grow businesses, which is essential for escaping poverty. Providing aid in this context helps poor countries address their economic challenges and become self-sufficient. A notable example is the Republic of Korea, which was one of the poorest countries in the 1960s, even compared to some African nations. However, after receiving aid from other countries for a decade, it has emerged as a strong economy and is now assisting other poor countries.Secondly, aid campaigns raise awareness about the plight of poor people and encourage consideration and empathy from those in richer countries. When people in affluent nations reflect on the struggles of those in poverty and affected by diseases, they are less likely to take their own abundance for granted. This not only fosters a sense of harmony and love but also provides an opportunity to learn about the humane aspects of globalization.Thirdly, aid campaigns can have practical benefits in a globalized world, where the economies of several countries are interconnected and influence one another. For instance, when the American mortgage loan system faced difficulties, several European and Asian countries' economies fluctuated, and many countries required international support to avoid bankruptcy.In conclusion, the three key points highlighting the positive effects of aid are: supporting poor countries in building their economies, fostering humane concepts among people, and maintaining a strong global economy. I strongly believe that being a responsible global neighbor by aiding poor countries will continue to be a priority for many organizations and volunteers, ultimately making the world a better place to live.

question: Even though globalization affects the world's economics in a very positive way, its negative side should not be forgotten. To what extend do you agree or disagree?
human: During the history of the world, every change has its own positive and negative sides. Globalization as a gradual change affecting all over the world is not an exception. Although it has undeniable effects on the economics of the world; it has side effects which make it a controversial issue.Some people prefer to recognize globalization as a threat to ethnic and religious values of people of their country. They think that the idea of globalization put their inherited culture in danger of uncontrolled change and make them vulnerable against the attack of imperialistic governments.Those who disagree, believe that globalization contribute effectively to the global improvement of the world in many aspects. Developing globalization, people can have more access to many natural resources of the world and it leads to increasing the pace of scientific and economic promotions of the entire world. In addition, they admit that globalization can be considered a chance for people of each country to promote their lifestyle through the stuffs and services imported from other countries.Moreover, the proponents of globalization idea point out globalization results in considerable decrease in global tension due to convergence of benefits of people of the world which is a natural consequence of globalization.In conclusion, I would rather classify myself in the proponents of globalization as a speeding factor of global progress. I think it is more likely to solve the problems of the world rather than intensifying them.
llm: Throughout history, the world has undergone numerous transformations, each with its inherent advantages and disadvantages. Globalization, a gradual and far-reaching change, is no exception to this rule. While it has undeniable impacts on the global economy, it also has secondary effects that render it a topic of debate.Some individuals view globalization as a menace to the ethnic and religious values of their native country. They believe that the concept of globalization jeopardizes their cultural heritage, exposing it to uncontrolled transformation and making it susceptible to the influence of imperialistic governments.On the other hand, those who disagree argue that globalization significantly contributes to the global betterment of the world in various aspects. As globalization advances, people gain greater access to the world's natural resources, thereby accelerating scientific and economic progress globally. Moreover, they acknowledge that globalization presents an opportunity for individuals from each country to enhance their lifestyle through imported goods and services from other nations.Furthermore, proponents of globalization assert that it leads to a substantial decrease in global tensions due to the convergence of benefits among people worldwide, a natural consequence of globalization.In conclusion, I align myself with the proponents of globalization, perceiving it as a catalyst for global progress. I firmly believe that it is more likely to alleviate the world's problems rather than exacerbate them.

question: Many children are forced to stay at school and study subjects that will be of little value to them in the future. These children may disrupt the education of the majority and should be allowed to leave school early to find a themselves a job. What are your views?
human: Many people believe that children should study at school to have more knowledge that prepare better for their future. Others, however, think that these children may disrupt their school work and should be allowed to leave school early to find a job. Personally, I tend to agree with the point of view that student have to be forced to study at school.First of all, schools offer to students a good environment with experienced professors and high quality programs for studying. It creates the best conditions for students education and can force them to focus on their school work instead of wasting their time to do useless things. Second of all, schools provide lots of academic knowledge to students. Students may learn professional skills, expand their understandings and gain experiences. Therefore, they have more opprotunities to find a job and to be successful in the future. For example, as we know, employer always prefer to hire an employee of high degree who have professional skills.Nevertheless, it is not unreasonable that some people think that children should interrupt their school work and get a job. Whether children can learn a lot at school, there are many subjects that will be of little value to them in the future. Furthermore, children can learn social skills when they have a job. They can get more experiences that can not be obtained at school. Working helps children be more independent and teach them to esteem and manage the money that they've earned.Overall, I believe that students should study at school. Even though there are some advantages of leaving school to find a job, studying at school is always the best choice for children's future. There are many ways that can train children to learn independent and social skills instead of getting a job.
llm: The debate about whether children should prioritize studying at school or enter the workforce early has sparked a heated discussion. While some argue that attending school can provide students with valuable knowledge and skills, preparing them for a successful future, others believe that it may hinder their ability to gain practical experience and independence through early employment. Personally, I align with the view that students should be encouraged to continue their education at school.Firstly, schools provide students with an ideal learning environment, staffed by experienced professors and equipped with high-quality programs. This setup fosters the perfect conditions for students to focus on their academic work, distracting them from non-essential activities. Secondly, schools offer a plethora of academic knowledge, enabling students to acquire professional skills, broaden their understanding, and accumulate valuable experiences. As a result, students have increased opportunities to secure better job prospects and achieve success in their future endeavors. For instance, employers often prefer hiring individuals with higher education degrees and specialized skills.However, it's understandable that some people advocate for children to discontinue their education and pursue employment. Although schools offer a wealth of knowledge, some subjects may hold little relevance to their future careers. Moreover, having a job can teach children essential social skills, such as independence, money management, and self-esteem. Working experience can provide them with unique opportunities that may not be available in a school setting.In conclusion, I firmly believe that attending school is the most beneficial choice for children's future. Although there are advantages to leaving school to enter the workforce, the benefits of studying at school far outweigh them. There are alternative methods to teach children independence and social skills, such as internships, volunteering, or part-time jobs, that do not require them to sacrifice their education.

question: Today, the high sales of popular consumer goods reflect the power of advertising and not the real needs of the society in which they are sold. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
human: Nowadays, we can see advertisements everywhere, from television set to posters on the streets. Some people believe that these various advertisements get people to buy products that are unnecessary and only look good on television. I tend to agree with this view.To boost their sales and win over customers, companies pour a great amount of money into advertising. Most of the time, it is not about the function or quality of the commodities themselves but really the promotion of the good feeling of possessing the product. By which I mean, huge cooperation hire celebrities as the face of their product. By casting famous singers in their television advertisement, motorcycles or clothes for example, sales increase significantly since youngsters, as the target consumers, love celebrities. Since having these products shows their status, the quality obviously is not relatively important.However, despite the fact that advertisements can be falseful and exaggerated, it is also true that it plays and important role economically. They introduce new products, and provide various choices, not to mention they are often visually enjoyable, since they aim to grab your attention. Advertising also helps to keep prices at reasonable levels, creates a fair environment for commercial competition. Otherwise the market may be monopolistic, and the price as well as the choice will not be so selective.The power of advertising maybe over-rated, we can not deny that the final decision is on the hands of us consumers. No matter how appealing the advertisements are, we should be able to make the decision on our own.
llm: In today's world, advertisements are omnipresent, from TV commercials to street posters. Many people believe that these ads persuade consumers to purchase unnecessary products that look appealing on TV, but lack real value. I share this perspective.Companies invest heavily in advertising to drive sales and attract customers. Often, the focus is not on the product's functionality or quality, but rather on creating a desirable image associated with owning the product. This is achieved by partnering with celebrities, who endorse products like motorcycles or clothing, resulting in significant sales boosts among young consumers. For these consumers, owning such products is a status symbol, making quality a secondary concern.Although advertisements can be misleading and exaggerated, they also play a crucial economic role. They introduce new products, offer choices, and are often visually engaging, aiming to capture attention. Advertising helps maintain reasonable prices, fosters fair competition, and prevents market monopolies, which would limit consumer choices and drive up prices.While the influence of advertising should not be underestimated, ultimately, the purchasing decision lies with us, the consumers. Regardless of how enticing ads may be, we must make informed, independent decisions. By doing so, we can navigate the advertising landscape effectively, recognizing both its economic benefits and its potential to persuade us into unnecessary purchases.

question: Why should the ownership of guns be limited?
human: Gun is definitely not a kind of normal good in our society, which is strictly controlled in most countries. However, gun control in some countries is relatively loose than others. Therefore, this is still a controversial topic around the world. From my point of view, it is sensible to enforce the gun control.The first factor considered is the risk of accidents with guns. The accidents cannot be completely avoided although only those who have gun licenses can purchase guns. For example, we hear some news from time to time that someone was hurt by accident during the hunting. So the fewer guns possessed, the fewer accidents would happened, our surroundings would be safer with lower accident rates.Secondly, most violent crimes are related to the abuse of guns, especially in some countries where guns are available for people. Eventually, guns will create a violent society if the trend continues. Take an example, in American, young adults and even juveniles can get access to guns, which leads to the tragedies of school gun shooting. What is worse, some terrorists are able to possess more advanced weapons than the police, which makes citizens always live in danger.Thirdly, the possession of guns can also raise the rates of suicide. In the US, firearms remain the most common method of suicide, accounting for about 50 per cent. Unfortunately, there is an increasing trend of adolescent suicides and suicides among those age 75 and over.In conclusion, considering the rise in accident rates, violent crime rates and suicide rates, I support that the guns should be strictly limited and the government should enforce a series of laws to prevent our societies from violence.
llm: In our society, guns are not considered a typical commodity, and their use is heavily regulated in most countries. However, the level of gun control varies significantly from one country to another, making it a contentious issue worldwide. From my perspective, implementing strict gun control measures is a sensible approach.One key consideration is the risk of accidents involving firearms. Even with stringent licensing requirements, accidents cannot be entirely eliminated. For instance, we occasionally hear reports of hunting accidents that result in injuries. It logically follows that fewer guns in circulation would lead to fewer accidents, creating a safer environment with lower incident rates.Furthermore, a significant proportion of violent crimes are linked to the misuse of firearms, particularly in countries where gun availability is relatively high. If this trend persists, it will inevitably contribute to the creation of a violent society. The United States, for example, has experienced tragic incidents of school shootings, often perpetrated by young adults or juveniles who have accessed guns. Moreover, the fact that some terrorists can acquire more advanced weaponry than law enforcement agencies puts citizens at constant risk.Additionally, the availability of guns can also contribute to higher suicide rates. In the United States, firearms are the most common method of suicide, accounting for approximately 50% of all suicide cases. Unfortunately, there is a growing trend of suicides among adolescents and individuals aged 75 and above.In conclusion, considering the rise in accident rates, violent crime rates, and suicide rates, I firmly believe that guns should be strictly regulated, and governments should enact a series of laws to protect our societies from violence.

question: Popular events like the football World Cup and other international sporting occasions are essential in easing international tensions and releasing patriotic emotions in a safe way. To what extent do you agree or disagree with this opinion?
human: International sporting events are a good change to create a multi-nation community of fans having the same passion. It will help people around the world understand each other more. Since, international sporting occasions are essential in easing international tensions and releasing patriotic emotions in a safe way.An international sporting event is normal held in a country with huge interest from fans all over the world. For the time of occasions, people regardless of nationality, origin and religion will live together. People can understand more about a country, it is useful to ease tensions between nations. For example in FIFA World Cup 2010, the relation between North Korea and South Korea is dangerous for the warship sinking. The world suspected North Korea of the aggressive action. However, due to this event North Korea showed a friendship and enthuasism. It is rare times when people can learn about this country. It really help to alleviate the tension.Besides easing tensions, an international sporting event also helps fans release patriotic emotions in a safe way. When they garther together to encourage their team, they will show their patriotic emotions. Regardless of the competition between teams, their emotions are always released in a safe way due to the sole passion of the sport. Moreover, all fans know that a sport event will attract the attention of whole the world and a lot of public media. They will try to create a beautiful image about their land and people. In Olympic Beijing 2008, Chinese tried thier best to bring the world a spectacular image about their country. First of all, foreigners came here always received the support of friendly volunteers who were young students. They were welcomed by each Chinese hospitality, beauty in each cities. Everythings is created by patriotic emotions of Chinese who wanted to bring a beautiful China to the world.In conclusion, International sporting events will draw the international concern. It will make the world more peaceful by easing internation tensions and releasing patriotic emotions in a safe way.
llm: International sporting events provide a unique opportunity for fans from different nations to come together, united by their shared passion. This shared enthusiasm helps to foster global understanding, bridging cultural and national divides. Moreover, these events play a crucial role in alleviating international tensions and providing a safe outlet for patriotic emotions.When an international sporting event is hosted in a country, it attracts a massive following from fans worldwide. For the duration of the event, people from diverse backgrounds, nationalities, and religions coexist harmoniously. This convergence facilitates a deeper understanding of different countries and cultures, which is particularly beneficial in easing tensions between nations. A notable example is the 2010 FIFA World Cup, where despite the heightened tensions between North Korea and South Korea following the sinking of a warship, North Korea demonstrated friendship and enthusiasm, offering a rare glimpse into the country and helping to alleviate tension.In addition to easing international tensions, these events also offer a platform for fans to express their patriotic emotions safely. When fans gather to support their teams, they exhibit their national pride, but the competitive spirit of the sport ensures that these emotions are expressed in a controlled and respectful manner. Furthermore, the global attention and media coverage that these events attract motivate fans to showcase their country in the best possible light. For instance, during the 2008 Beijing Olympics, the Chinese made considerable efforts to present a spectacular image of their country to the world. Visitors were warmly welcomed by friendly volunteers, showcasing Chinese hospitality and the beauty of its cities, all of which was driven by the patriotic desire to present a positive image of China to the global community.In conclusion, international sporting events captivate global attention and contribute to a more peaceful world. By facilitating international understanding, easing tensions, and providing a safe outlet for patriotic expressions, these events underscore the power of sports in uniting people across the globe and fostering peace.

question: Some people believe that the range of technology available to individuals today is increasing the gap between rich people and poor people, while others say that technology has the opposite effect. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
human: Technology, in the past two hundred years, has taken a dramatic progress in many fields of our society, such as telecommunications, manufacturing and buildings, etc. Certainly, technologies have also contributed to the great change of our daily lives. However, today some people consider that the range of technology regarding of public has a negative effect on increasing the gap between rich and poor. Personally, I find it hard for me to agree with this opinion by the following reasons.In the first instance, the progress of material technology leads to the sharp fall of price of a great number of products. About ten years ago, mobile phones ware very expensive for most members of my country, only a few of rich individuals have enough money to buy one. Today, mobile phones become a common one of household items, which due to the cheaper materials and better producing technologies. Thus, most members of our society can benefit from the consequences of technical advancements, especially the poor people.Secondly, technical developments improve productivity, which help people to escape from daily chores, and invest more time and energy in studying and living a more meaningful life. With the development of Internet, we can enjoy the pleasure and conveniences which it brings about for us every day. In the past time, we had to spend a lot of time searching information and waiting for letters of our friends who lived far away from us. Nowadays, we can talk with our friends online, no matter where we are and how far between us. In addition, the Internet gives everyone access to the same information, this therefore leads to greater equality between individuals.Undoubtedly, everything has two sides and technology is not an exception. To some extent, the gap between rich people and poor is widen by technology, because only the rich people have ability to afford the expensive high-tech products, and these products can help them to earn more in return. Nevertheless, I think it is a limp opposition to the remarkable advantages of technology, and technology is not the root cause of the gap.In conclusion, the good technology bringing to us is undeniable. Under proper use of technology, the human being can be benefit a lot and perpetually from the advancement of it.
llm: Over the past two hundred years, technology has made tremendous strides in various aspects of our society, including telecommunications, manufacturing, and construction. Undoubtedly, technology has also greatly impacted our daily lives. However, some people argue that the proliferation of technology among the general public has a negative effect, exacerbating the gap between the rich and the poor. Personally, I disagree with this viewpoint for the following reasons.Firstly, advancements in material technology have led to a significant decrease in the prices of numerous products. About a decade ago, mobile phones were a luxury only a few affluent individuals in my country could afford. Today, mobile phones have become a common household item, thanks to cheaper materials and improved manufacturing technologies. As a result, most members of our society, particularly the poor, can benefit from the consequences of technological advancements.Secondly, technical developments have enhanced productivity, allowing people to escape from mundane daily chores and invest more time and energy in education and living a more meaningful life. The development of the Internet has brought about numerous conveniences, enabling us to access information and connect with others effortlessly. In the past, we had to spend a considerable amount of time searching for information and waiting for letters from friends who lived far away. Nowadays, we can communicate with friends online, regardless of our location or distance between us. Moreover, the Internet provides equal access to information for everyone, leading to greater equality among individuals.While it is true that everything has its drawbacks, and technology is no exception. To some extent, technology can widen the gap between the rich and the poor, as only the affluent can afford expensive high-tech products, which can further increase their wealth. Nevertheless, I believe this is a weak argument against the numerous benefits of technology, and technology is not the root cause of the gap between the rich and the poor.In conclusion, the benefits of technology are undeniable. When utilized properly, technology can bring about immense benefits for humanity, and its advancements can have a lasting positive impact on our lives.

question: Governments spent a lot of money for traveling outer space. Do you think the investment is reasonable? Give your own opinion and reasons to support you claim
human: For many centuries, outer space has been one of the most favourable realms of study. Space expeditions have been launched and many have been successful. However, a lot of people still consider space exploration as an act of wasting money, to illustrate, astronauts only brought useless rocks back to planet earth despite the large sum of money spent on their equipment. On the other hand, there are some reasons for human beings to travel to outer space.Firstly, many facts about solar system can be discovered. For instance, a picture of planet earth proved that the earth is round, not flat. Another example is that it is the earth which goes around the sun, not vice versa. If it was not for the space exploration, we would never know these facts.Secondly, people can know more about the planet earth itself. By observing planet earth from outer space, people can find out ample things for example about the atmosphere of the planet earth. With this knowledge, people can work on something to prevent earth hazards such as global warming.Finally, a great deal of sophisticated technology can be invented. As astronauts need to travel to outer space which does not have any oxygen to breathe in, scientists are compelled to do research on the oxygen tanks. Oxygen tanks, for instance, are proved useful not only in outer space but also underwater. Moreover, spaceships, communication satellites and space pens also contribute a lot to the society.As a conclusion, I personally think that human beings should travel to outer space. In spite of costing a fortune, space exploration has given aforementioned benefits.
llm: For centuries, outer space has been a fascinating field of study, with numerous successful space expeditions launched. However, many people still view space exploration as a frivolous waste of resources, citing the example of astronauts bringing back "useless rocks" despite the substantial investment in their equipment. Nevertheless, there are compelling reasons for humans to venture into outer space.Firstly, space exploration has enabled the discovery of numerous facts about our solar system. For instance, images of Earth from space have conclusively proven that our planet is round, not flat. Additionally, space exploration has revealed that Earth orbits the Sun, not the other way around. Without space exploration, these fundamental facts would remain unknown.Secondly, observing Earth from outer space has provided valuable insights into our planet's composition, including its atmosphere. This knowledge can be leveraged to develop strategies for mitigating Earth's hazards, such as global warming. By studying our planet from a unique perspective, we can gain a deeper understanding of its complexities and work towards preserving it.Lastly, space exploration has driven the invention of sophisticated technologies. The need for astronauts to survive in oxygen-free environments has spurred research into oxygen tanks, which have proven useful not only in space but also underwater.
