By doing so, we can create a more sustainable, connected, and healthy community for all.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Animals should be free, people should not keep them in zoos. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
human: Many people state that zoos are a great asset to animals. Others believe that they are inferior creatures and therefore do not deserve our attention. In my opinion, we must help animals live safely and comfortably in their own environment.Many scientific studies have revealed the detriment that zoos have caused to animals. Firstly, like we, human beings, animals are delivered to this world with genetic instincts. Skills which help them live and survive in their residing areas. When we captivate animals and put them to live a style of life that they are unfamiliar with, they begin to loose those in-born instincts. Hence, when they are released or in the worst case, when they escape, they act disorientated and this contributes to the animal mortality rate. In addition to the previous point, various zoos do not have the proper implements or policies that assure the quality of animal care. For instance, I recall my first trip to a zoo, at age eight. I was shocked by the cruelty which animals were treated. I can not think of any staff memeber who did not have an improper behaviour towards the animlas in the zoo. They beat them up because they did not wanted to eat their meals and then excused themselves saying that it was a way to train the animals.In conclusion, I strongly believe that we have to assit animals and provide them the best quality of life possible. Scientific facts showed the damage that zoos can inflict on animals. Moreover, many zoos do not meet the standards of care required for them.
llm: The debate about the role of zoos in animal welfare has sparked intense discussion. While some argue that zoos are beneficial for animals, others believe that these creatures are inferior and do not warrant our concern. In my view, it is crucial that we prioritize the well-being and safety of animals in their natural habitats.Numerous scientific studies have exposed the harm caused by zoos to animals. For instance, animals, like humans, are born with inherent genetic instincts that enable them to thrive in their native environments. However, when animals are captured and placed in unfamiliar surroundings, they begin to lose these essential instincts. As a result, when they are released or escape, they become disoriented, leading to increased mortality rates.Furthermore, many zoos lack the necessary resources and policies to ensure adequate animal care. A personal experience that stands out in my mind is my first visit to a zoo at the age of eight. I was dismayed by the cruel treatment of animals by the staff. None of the staff members displayed proper behavior towards the animals, often resorting to physical abuse when the animals refused to eat, and justifying their actions as a training method.In conclusion, I firmly believe that we must prioritize animal welfare and provide them with the highest quality of life possible. The scientific evidence highlights the potential harm inflicted by zoos on animals, and many zoos fall short of meeting the required standards of care. It is our responsibility to ensure that animals are treated with respect and protected in their natural environments, rather than being subjected to the hardships of captivity.

question: A university plans to develop a new research center in your country. Some people want a center for business research. Other people want a center for research in agriculture (farming). Which of these two kinds of research centers do you recommend for your country? Use specific reasons in your recommendation.
human: Most of the universities in the world seek to develop some research in some countries. These researches can be aimed for several fields such as business or agriculture. If a university plans to develop a new research in my country and I have to choose between establishing a centre for business research or a centre for agriculture research, I would opt for the second one.First of all, my country has a lot of land which is useful for the agriculture. Most of these lands are left without any treatment. The centre for research in agriculture can help my co-citizens to better exploit these land. This centre can also help people there to solve their issues related to their land. Especially, if they have no knowledge or education in this field.Secondly, the centre for research in agriculture helps the economy of my country to improve. The agriculture field has only thirty percent as a market part. The centre of research can raise the market part of this field by developing the agriculture products. For example, the dates are the most important agriculture product in my country. The centre of research for agriculture can make some research in how to get a good quality of this product, how to treat the Palme and maybe how to treat the land of the palms.Another reason that makes the centre of research for the agriculture more important than the centre of business research is that the first one can create a lot of jobs. Obviously, showing people how to exploit a land and get good agriculture products will push people to think about working in the field of agriculture rather than working in business or other field to make money. Some people think that a centre of business research is more important because we have to be in parallel with the advanced countries which have focused in business field. For me being a developed country does not mean that we have to focus only in business, but we have to focus on what really bring us to the level of self satisfaction, and the agriculture for our country is the field that can realize that.My country need to focus more on the agriculture by establishing centers for research in this field, which will have some very positive consequences on agriculture people work, on the economy and on the employment.
llm: Most universities worldwide strive to conduct research in various countries, often focusing on fields like business or agriculture. If a university were to establish a new research center in my country, I would choose to prioritize a center for agricultural research over one for business research.First and foremost, my country boasts an abundance of untapped land suitable for agricultural purposes. By establishing a research center focused on agriculture, we can empower our citizens to optimize the use of this land and address issues related to land management, particularly for those lacking knowledge or education in this area.Furthermore, an agricultural research center would significantly contribute to the economic growth of my country. Currently, the agricultural sector accounts for only 30% of the market share. The research center could enhance this market share by developing agricultural products, such as dates, which are a staple crop in my country. Researchers could investigate ways to improve the quality of dates, palm tree care, and land treatment, ultimately boosting the agricultural industry.Another compelling reason to prioritize an agricultural research center is its potential to create numerous job opportunities. By teaching people how to effectively utilize their land and produce high-quality agricultural products, we can encourage them to pursue careers in agriculture rather than other fields. This, in turn, can lead to increased employment and economic stability.While some argue that a business research center is more crucial for keeping pace with advanced countries that have focused on business, I firmly believe that being a developed country is not solely dependent on prioritizing business. Instead, we should focus on areas that bring us self-sufficiency and satisfaction. For my country, agriculture is the key sector that can achieve this goal.In conclusion, my country should focus on establishing research centers in agriculture, which would have far-reaching, positive consequences for agricultural workers, the economy, and employment rates. By doing so, we can unlock the full potential of our land, improve our economic standing, and create a more sustainable and satisfying future for our citizens.

question: People learn in different ways. Some people learn by doing things, other people learn by reading about things, others learn by listening to people talk about things. Which of these methods of learning is best for you? Use specific examples to support your choice.
human: People have a lot of things to learn in their lives. They use several ways to broaden their knowledge and their skills. One of these several ways of learning that I prefer is doing things by my self rather than learning by reading about things or learning by listening to people talking about. There are a lot of reasons to recommend this method for who is serious about learning some thing in their lives.First of all, learning by doing things develops our maturity. When you do things by your self, you learn to depend on yourself. You will not be in need to refer to books or persons. The fact of doing things by ourselves can help us to get some experiences that would strong our maturity. For example if some one wants to learn how to be a leader, they have to experience this by being in a real situation of leading a team or a group, or even a situation. We can not be leaders by reading books or by listening to person talking about leading. Secondly, learning by doing things is more exciting than learning by reading about things or listening to people talking about. There are a lot of things in life that should be learnt by doing them. Reading about things or listening to people talking about can rarely submit the same sensation or the same excitement to some one who wants to learn about the same thing. People who want to learn how to swim have to go to the beach or to the swimpool and laid themselves in the water to feel and know what is swimming. Nor listening to people or reading about can teach them swimming.Another reason that makes learning by doing things more advantageous than learning by reading about things or listening to people talking about is that we find more motivation to continuing on learning by doing things. With the time, Reading about things or listening to people talking about could become more and more boring. Learning by doing things gives us more and more pleasure especially if we success in learning perfectly this things. So we become motivated to learn other things by doing them.The history shows that learning by doing things is the best way and the best method to learn things. People should not depend only on reading or listening to people talking about things to learn. They should try and keep trying until they learn what they want to learn.
llm: Throughout their lives, people have a vast array of subjects to learn and master. To achieve this, they employ various methods to expand their knowledge and skills. One approach that I highly recommend is hands-on learning, where individuals learn by doing things themselves, rather than relying solely on reading or listening to others. This method is particularly effective for those who are serious about acquiring new skills or knowledge.First and foremost, learning by doing fosters maturity and self-reliance. When individuals take the initiative to learn through hands-on experience, they become more independent and less reliant on external sources of information, such as books or other people. This approach allows them to gain valuable experiences that help build their maturity. For instance, someone who aspires to become a leader must immerse themselves in real-world situations, such as leading a team or group, in order to develop the necessary skills. Simply reading about leadership or listening to others discuss it is insufficient.Moreover, hands-on learning is often more engaging and exciting than traditional methods. Many life skills can only be truly learned through direct experience. Reading about a subject or listening to someone else's account of it can rarely replicate the same level of excitement or sensation as actually doing it oneself. For example, people who want to learn how to swim must get in the water and experience it firsthand, rather than just reading about it or listening to someone describe the process.Another significant advantage of hands-on learning is that it tends to be more motivating than other methods. Over time, reading about a subject or listening to someone talk about it can become tedious and boring. In contrast, hands-on learning provides a sense of accomplishment and pleasure, especially when one succeeds in mastering a new skill. This, in turn, motivates individuals to continue learning and exploring new subjects through hands-on experience.History has consistently shown that hands-on learning is one of the most effective ways to acquire new knowledge and skills. Rather than relying solely on reading or listening to others, people should be encouraged to try new things and persist in their efforts until they achieve their learning goals. By doing so, they will not only gain valuable knowledge and skills but also develop the maturity, motivation, and self-reliance necessary to succeed in their endeavors.

question: Many people think that cheap air travel should be encouraged because it gives ordinary people the freedom to travel further. However, others think that this leads to environmental problem, and so air travel should be more expensive in order to discourage people from having it. Discuss both sides and give your own opinion.
human: In recent years, many airlines offer to their customers more and more number of cheap flights. People have various different views about cheap air travel. Although there are good arguments in favour of this trend should be encouraged, I personally think that cheap flight can make many serious problem.It is undeniable that cheap air fares have broadened travel possibilities for many people, particularly for the lower income group. These days, millions of people can travel around the world for work or pleasure. They can develop their careers, broad their knowledge, and interact with many other people from varied cultural backgrounds. Moreover, travels also help to promote the tourist industry development, boost the economy and job markets of many countries.On the other hand, growing of cheap flights really have negative impact on environment. Apparently, more flights could mean bigger and busier airport that may be grown the air pollution for people who live and work close to it. However, the biggest concern is the effect on global warming. Burning plane fuel can releases carbon dioxide into environment that cause the Earth to heat up. In fact, while many efforts are being made to reduce CO2 emissions from cars and factories, nothing is being done to reins the airlines. In conclusion, I would argue that the drawbacks of cheap air fares outweigh the benefits. However, it does not mean that air travel should be more expensive. Instead, people should be aware of their responsibility to reduce the emissions caused by their lifestyle choices.
llm: In recent years, many airlines have been offering an increasing number of affordable flights to their customers. The trend of cheap air travel has sparked a range of opinions among people. While there are valid arguments in favor of promoting this trend, I personally believe that cheap flights pose significant problems.It is undeniable that low-cost air fares have expanded travel opportunities for many individuals, particularly those with lower incomes. Nowadays, millions of people can travel worldwide for business or leisure, developing their careers, broadening their knowledge, and interacting with people from diverse cultural backgrounds. Furthermore, travel helps promote the development of the tourism industry, boosting the economies and job markets of numerous countries.However, the growth of cheap flights has a detrimental impact on the environment. The increased number of flights leads to larger and busier airports, which can exacerbate air pollution for those living and working nearby. Moreover, the major concern is the effect on global warming. The combustion of plane fuel releases carbon dioxide into the atmosphere, causing the Earth to heat up. Notably, while efforts are being made to reduce CO2 emissions from cars and factories, little is being done to regulate the airlines' emissions.In conclusion, I argue that the drawbacks of cheap air fares outweigh the benefits. Nevertheless, this does not imply that air travel should become more expensive. Rather, individuals should be aware of their responsibility to reduce the emissions resulting from their lifestyle choices.

question: Should governments spend more money on improving roads and highways, or should governments spend more money on improving public transportation(buses, trains, subways)? Why?Ê
human: Many people think that governments should spend money on improving roads and highways while the others say that it would be better to spend money on public transportation. In my opinion, governments should certainly spend money on the public transportation system because it would deal with problems that the rising number of private cars is creating.First, the using of public transportation reduces the amount of resources using on transportation. Cars depend on gasoline, which is a non-renewable resource. Therefore, the more cars we use means that the faster gasoline in this world is used up. In the contrary, if the public transportation is efficiently used, the amount of gasoline consuming per person will be much lower. And this definitely helps to reserve our invaluable natural resource, gasoline.Second, public transportation helps to solve the air pollution problems. Averagely, public transports use much less gasoline to carry people than private cars. It means that by using public transports, the less gas exhaust is pumped to the air and people will no longer have to bear the stuffy situation on the roads, which is always full of fumes.Last but not least, using public transportation is much safer than private transportation. According to National Safety Council, riding the bus is over 170 times safer than private care. Thus there is no reason that governments should hesitate to invest in public transportation, a healthy, safe and economical way of transporting.In short, I can say for certain that spending money on improving public transportation is necessary because it is the key to protect our world, creating a healthy and safe environment for people to live in.
llm: The question of how governments should allocate their transportation budgets has sparked a debate. While some argue that funds should be spent on upgrading roads and highways, others believe that investing in public transportation is the way to go. In my view, governments should prioritize spending on public transportation systems, as this would help mitigate the problems caused by the increasing number of private vehicles on the road.Firstly, using public transportation conserves resources. Since cars rely on gasoline, a non-renewable resource, the more cars on the road, the faster we deplete our gasoline reserves. In contrast, efficient public transportation systems significantly reduce the amount of gasoline consumed per person, thereby helping to preserve this valuable natural resource.Secondly, public transportation can help alleviate air pollution. On average, public transport vehicles use less gasoline to transport people than private cars, resulting in lower gas emissions and a reduction in air pollution. This, in turn, improves the overall air quality, making it safer for people to breathe.Lastly, public transportation is considerably safer than private transportation. According to the National Safety Council, traveling by bus is over 170 times safer than driving a private car. Given these benefits, it is only logical that governments should invest in public transportation, a mode of transport that is not only environmentally friendly and economical but also safe.In conclusion, I firmly believe that investing in public transportation is essential, as it holds the key to protecting our environment, ensuring a healthy and safe living space for everyone.

question: Some students prefer to study alone. Others prefer to study with a group of students. Which do you prefer? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer?
human: Everyone has their method to success in life. At school or university, success depends on how we study. Some students benefit a lot when they study with groups. Yet, I prefer to study individually because it helps me to concentrate more, and it helps me to build my personality.Studying alone helps us to focus more in our lessons. For instance, I am a type of person who cannot comprehend my subjects unless I am alone. I can prepare my schedules, guidelines, exercises and go over them all. Moreover, we have a lot of subjects which require us to sit and study alone such as math, reading, and drawing. In my opinion, I can take advantage of every minute without wasting by studying alone.Additionally, we are building our personalities when we study alone. For example, answering our homework alone encourages us to be more responsible and independent. Also, it motivates us to be accurate in our work in the future. Personally, when I fix my study plan with a specific time and finish it on time, it improves my ability in the future to become more precise and careful. To conclude, there are many ways to study and it is our right to choose which is suitable for our characters whether alone or with group. In fact, I agree with the idea of studying a lone since it helps me to focus more and establish my personality. Success needs us to work hard and sacrifice more whether we choose to study alone or with group.
llm: Each person has their own unique approach to achieving success in life. In an academic setting, success is largely dependent on one's study habits. While some students thrive in group study settings, I personally prefer studying individually as it enables me to concentrate better and develop my personality.Studying alone allows for greater focus on lessons. For instance, I am someone who needs solitude to fully comprehend subjects. This method enables me to create and follow my own study schedules, guidelines, and exercises without distractions. Furthermore, certain subjects like mathematics, reading, and drawing often require solo study sessions. In my view, studying alone permits me to utilize every moment efficiently without wasting time.Moreover, studying alone contributes to building one's personality. For example, completing homework independently fosters responsibility and independence. It also motivates individuals to strive for accuracy in their work, setting them up for future success. On a personal note, adhering to a study plan and meeting deadlines enhances my precision and carefulness over time.In conclusion, there are multiple study methods, and it is an individual's prerogative to choose the approach that best suits their character, whether that be alone or in a group. I concur with the notion of solo studying as it improves my focus and helps establish my personality. Ultimately, success demands hard work and sacrifice, regardless of whether one chooses to study alone or in a group.

question: Some people believe that the Earth is being harmed (damaged) by human activity. Others feel that human activity makes the Earth a better place to live. What is your opinion? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
human: Whether human activity is making the Earth a better place to live or damaging it is a debatable issue. Some people advocate the idea that human activity is advantageously influencing to the Earth. However, I strongly believe that human activities are having a bad effect upon our planet, for human are polluting the Earth's environment, exhausting natural resource and threatening the living of other species.People are corrupting their ecosphere. In recent decades, concurrently with the increase of human consume, the waste discarded by human also multiplies. These wastes including household waste and industrial waste are so big that a "new" continent is now being formed in the sea from garbage. Furthermore, the industrial exhaust gases are adulterating the air, causing the insalubrious phenomenon such as acid rain, global warming or climate change.Besides, people are draining the Earth's natural resources. These resources such as oil, coal are vital for human activity, therefore nowadays, the exploitation activities of these resources are increasing dramatically to adapt to the infinite need of people. Researchers indicated that most of natural resources are un-recyclable and only several decades after, the Earth's natural resources are totally exhausted. At that time, human activity will be seriously affected due to the dependence on these resources.Also, people are endangering other species' live. Hunting has been a fundamental activity of human for having food. Through million years of hunting, especially in recent centuries with the innovation of rifle and dynamite, people have killed many animals and even have made some kinds of them become extinct. Moreover, people, suffering from the population pressure, are expanding their living area; consequently, the living area of other species narrowed. This narrowing of living region is pushing many creatures to the brink of extinction.All in all, from discussed reasons, we can conclude that human activity are gradually destroy the Earth since it is polluting the Earth environment, depleting the resource and imperiling other species' lives.
llm: The impact of human activity on the Earth is a topic of ongoing debate, with some arguing that it has a positive influence. However, I firmly believe that human actions are detrimental to our planet. The evidence suggests that human behavior is causing significant harm to the environment, depleting natural resources, and threatening the survival of other species.Human activities are contaminating the ecosystem. Over the past few decades, as consumption has increased, so too has the amount of waste generated. The sheer volume of household and industrial waste has become so massive that it is forming a "new" continent in the ocean, composed entirely of garbage. Furthermore, the emission of industrial gases is polluting the air, leading to unhealthy phenomena such as acid rain, global warming, and climate change.In addition to environmental degradation, humans are also depleting the Earth's natural resources. Resources like oil and coal are essential for human activity, and as a result, their exploitation has increased dramatically to meet the infinite demands of human consumption. Researchers have warned that most natural resources are non-renewable, and that within a few decades, the Earth's resources will be completely exhausted. At that point, human activity will be severely impacted due to its dependence on these resources.Moreover, human actions are endangering the lives of other species. Hunting has been a fundamental human activity for obtaining food, and over millions of years, particularly in recent centuries with the advent of rifles and dynamite, humans have killed vast numbers of animals, driving some species to extinction. Additionally, due to population pressure, humans are expanding their living spaces, resulting in the contraction of habitats for other species. This reduction in living space is pushing many creatures to the brink of extinction.In conclusion, based on the discussed reasons, it is clear that human activity is gradually destroying the Earth by polluting the environment, depleting resources, and imperiling the lives of other species. The cumulative effect of these actions is causing irreparable harm to our planet, and it is essential that we take immediate action to mitigate these effects and ensure a sustainable future.

question: A company is going to give some money either to support the arts or protect the environment. Which do you think the company chooses? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
human: If I had the opportunity to help a company make a decision on spending money either on supporting the arts or helping the environment, I would choose the latter without hesitation for the reasons below. First, conservation is more urgent now than at any time in history. According to a statistic conducted by the International Animal Preserving Association, we have only ten percent of the animals that have ever existed, which means that the biodiversity of our home is grievously endangered. What's more, rising sea levels, caused by global warming, have reached a level that is threatening human's life in many countries. If we continue discharging carbon dioxide with non-environmentally friendly cars, nations like Japan will be submerged and weather patterns could change, causing flooding, drought, and an increasing amount of damaging storms. In short, the ecosystem is in its worst condition ever and if we didn't take harsh measures now, we never will.Furthermore, supporting environment protection will benefit the company eventually. Nowadays, an increasing amount of people pay more attention to conservation; therefore, sponsoring conservation is a more efficient method of advertising. Just imagine if the project your company is sponsoring effectively improves the environment, then your company would be known as an environmentally-friendly company and benefit from it in this consumer-oriented society.Finally, conservation leads us to a higher standard of living. I confess that art is one of the best ways of entertaining human beings, but, with exhaust fumes and acid rain, we do not have the energy and enthusiasm to appreciate the paintings or photographs. Biodiversity and a more beautiful nature are not only the results of abetter environment but also are the necessities of photography and other types of art.To sum up, although supporting art will benefit the human beings and the company in short-term interest, I still hold the environment protection for long-term interest.
llm: If given the chance to influence a company's decision on allocating funds to either support the arts or environmental conservation, I would unequivocally choose the latter. My reasoning is based on several key points.Firstly, environmental conservation has never been more critical than it is today. A striking statistic from the International Animal Preserving Association reveals that only 10% of all animal species that have ever existed still remain, underscoring the grave threat to biodiversity. Furthermore, the rise in sea levels due to global warming has reached alarming heights, posing significant threats to human life in numerous countries. The continued emission of carbon dioxide, largely due to non-environmentally friendly vehicles, could lead to catastrophic consequences, including the submersion of nations like Japan, drastic changes in weather patterns, and an increase in devastating storms. The current state of our ecosystem is dire, and immediate, drastic measures are necessary to prevent irreversible damage.Additionally, investing in environmental protection can yield long-term benefits for the company. With the growing awareness and concern for conservation among the public, sponsoring environmental projects has become a highly effective advertising strategy. Imagine the positive brand image and goodwill that your company would garner by successfully supporting a project that improves the environment. In today's consumer-oriented society, being recognized as an environmentally friendly company can have significant marketing advantages.Lastly, conservation efforts contribute to a higher standard of living. While art is undoubtedly a valuable form of entertainment and expression, a polluted environment undermines our ability to fully appreciate and engage with it. The beauty of nature and biodiversity are not only outcomes of environmental conservation but also essential inspirations and subjects for various forms of art, including photography.In conclusion, although supporting the arts may offer short-term benefits for both humanity and the company, I firmly believe that prioritizing environmental protection serves the best long-term interest. The urgency and importance of addressing our current environmental challenges, coupled with the potential for positive brand recognition and the intrinsic value of conservation for human well-being and artistic expression, make environmental conservation the clear choice.

question: We all work or will work in our jobs with many different kinds of people. In your opinion, what are some important characteristics of a co-worker (Someone you work closely with) ? Use reasons and specific examples to explain why these characteristics are important.Ê
human: At work, you meet people with diverse backgrounds and you are required to maintain sound relationships with many of them in order to have a pleasant work environment. However, the relationship you need to maintain with your co-worker is the most important one since he or she is the person who works very closely with you, and in most instances you have to rely on him or her. Therefore in my view, a good co-worker needs to have three most important characteristics such as cooperation, trustworthiness, and fellowship.The co-workers should be cooperative with one another. If they do not cooperate, there will be lots of disputes. I once had a co-worker who was too family conscious. Therefore he always left office sharp on time without giving any consideration whether the work has been finished or not. Most of the time, I had to do his work in order to protect him from getting caught to the supervisor who was a very authoritative person. However, one day I wanted to be off early because I had to take my mother to the doctor. When I requested my co-worker to give a helping hand to finish my work early, he turned down my request giving a silly excuse. From that day onwards I did not offer him any support and finally he was transferred from our department to a distant location as a punishment for his irresponsibility. Therefore, I believe if the co-workers do not corporate with each other that would be devastating in a work environment.The co-workers need to trust each other. They should not act on suspicion. This is a very important aspect in the work environment. I came across a situation once such that one of my subordinates used to suspect his co-worker for carrying tales to me. To a certain extent his suspicion was valid as his co-worker made several attempts to highlight the drawbacks of him. However I never encourage tale carriers as a principle and therefore his co-worker gave up talking ill against him with me. But this mistrust continued and created very unpleasant situations for everybody in my department. Finally, the co-workers should believe in fellowship. This helps them to enjoy their work life while building up very strong personal relationships. After all, you spend most of your day at office. If you have a good company in office, it is certainly a blessing.
llm: In a professional setting, interacting with individuals from diverse backgrounds is inevitable, and fostering positive relationships with them is crucial for a harmonious work environment. Among these relationships, the one with your coworker is paramount, as they are the person you collaborate with closely and often rely on. In my opinion, a good coworker should possess three essential characteristics: cooperation, trustworthiness, and fellowship.Firstly, coworkers should be cooperative with each other. Lack of cooperation can lead to numerous disputes and a dysfunctional work environment. I recall a experience with a coworker who prioritized their family commitments over work responsibilities, often leaving the office promptly without ensuring tasks were completed. I frequently had to compensate for their lack of dedication to avoid drawing the attention of our authoritative supervisor. However, when I needed to leave early to attend to a family matter, my coworker refused to assist me, citing a frivolous excuse. This incident led me to reevaluate our working relationship, and ultimately, their lack of cooperation resulted in their transfer to a different department.Secondly, trust among coworkers is vital. Suspicion and distrust can be detrimental to a positive work environment. I encountered a situation where a subordinate suspected a coworker of reporting negatively about them to me. Although the suspicion had some merit, as the coworker had attempted to highlight the subordinate's shortcomings, I do not condone tale-carrying and the coworker eventually ceased their negative reporting. Nevertheless, the mistrust persisted, creating an unpleasant atmosphere in our department.Lastly, fellowship among coworkers is essential. It enables them to enjoy their work life while building strong personal relationships. Considering the significant amount of time spent at the office, having good company can be a blessing. In conclusion, cooperation, trustworthiness, and fellowship are the cornerstone of a positive and productive working relationship, and their absence can have devastating consequences for the work environment.

question: When people succeed it is because of hard work. Luck has nothing to do with success. Do you agree or disagree with the quotation above? Use specific reasons and examples to explain your position.
human: There are many instances that luck has brought people things that they never could even imagine. However, I do not see any rational in believing in luck to reach one's goals. Therefore I strongly agree with the argument that it is one's hard work that helps him reach his target.First, if you depend only on luck for all your accomplishments, you are taking a great risk. Luck is something intangible and no one can guarantee that it would ever come your way. If it doesn't work, it would be a great disappointment. Instead if you strive hard to achieve what you want, then your hard work would take you at least closer to your final goal. In my personal experience, all my accomplishments were backed by my hard work, not my luck. And I never did encounter any disappointments of missing my goals.Secondly, if you believe that hard work is the key to success, it would make you a visionary person. In other words, those who believe in hard work are clear about their goals and know about their final destination. They carefully organize the process of achieving their targets and continue to evaluate their progress until they reach the final goal. If you believe in luck, you would be clueless about where you are heading. For example, a friend of mine, who had severe financial constraints, had the habit of buying lottery tickets thinking that one day he would win a lottery. He was living in an illusion that he can solve his financial issues with this lottery. However, up to this day his luck has not appeared and problems have got further worsened. Thirdly, if you work hard, luck too might shine on you and take you some more steps further ahead from your actual target. For example, my boss worked tirelessly for his promotion. He looked at every aspect that he needed to qualify for the promotion. He realized that having a master's degree would be a great credential for him to outperform his competitors. Although he had many commitments at home and work, he somehow managed to complete this degree before he was eligible to apply. At the end he was not only able to get the promotion amidst a stiff competition but also got nominated for a foreign scholarship since he had more credentials than other officers in his capacity. Although it is good to be lucky, depending on luck for everything is not good. Hence I strongly believe in hard working that would not easily disappoint you as luck sometimes does.
llm: The concept of luck has led many individuals to achieve things they never thought possible. Nevertheless, I fail to see the logic in relying solely on luck to attain one's objectives. Consequently, I strongly endorse the notion that hard work, rather than luck, is the key to reaching one's goals.Firstly, relying exclusively on luck for accomplishments is a risky endeavor. Luck is an intangible and unpredictable entity that may never materialize. The disappointment that follows when luck does not prevail can be overwhelming. In contrast, striving diligently towards one's goals ensures that hard work, at the very least, brings one closer to their desired outcome. My personal experience serves as a testament to this, as all my accomplishments have been the direct result of my hard work, not luck. I have never encountered the disappointment of falling short of my goals.Secondly, believing in the importance of hard work fosters a visionary mindset. Individuals who prioritize hard work are typically clear about their objectives and are well-versed in the process required to achieve them. They meticulously organize their approach, continually assess their progress, and persist until they reach their target. Conversely, those who rely on luck often lack direction and clarity regarding their goals. For instance, a friend of mine, plagued by financial constraints, had a penchant for purchasing lottery tickets, hoping to win and alleviate his financial woes. However, his luck has yet to manifest, and his problems have only intensified.Thirdly, dedication and hard work can actually attract luck, propelling one even further towards their goals. My boss, for example, worked tirelessly towards his promotion, scrutinizing every aspect necessary to outperform his competitors. He recognized the value of a master's degree in enhancing his credentials and, despite numerous commitments, successfully completed the degree before applying for the promotion. Ultimately, not only did he secure the promotion amidst fierce competition, but he was also nominated for a foreign scholarship, as his credentials surpassed those of his peers.Although being lucky can be beneficial, relying solely on luck is not a viable strategy. Therefore, I firmly believe in the power of hard work, which is less likely to lead to disappointment compared to luck. Hard work provides a sense of control and agency over one's achievements, making it a more reliable and fulfilling approach to reaching one's goals.

question: Distance learning and online computer classes should replace classroom learning.
human: During these digital age, the online classes has become more interest and more common in the society. Almost every school develops their online class systems. One question I always thought about is whether online computer classes should replace classroom learning. Although, online classes have many advantages, for me, I prefer traditional learning classes for several reasons.First, the participant with the others like classmates or professors is still an important factor in studying. Working in group leads to more discussion and more opinion among the class. Consequently, the discussion class results in expanded children vision and their respect to others roommate's ideas. Unlike the distance learning that children have few opportunities to discuss with their friends.Second, classroom learning provides other activities than studying. During student's free time, they have a number of activities that they can join, such as playing sports, going to lab, or going to library. These activities lead to more interact with their friends. Connection with friends improves their IQ abilities, furthermore, they have a chance to learn about their societies. While the online course keeps the children at their home only.Lastly, in school, there are professors that guided you during you had a problem or needed an advice. The professor provides good answers to you. They do not mind helping you, and they never leave you alone when you got a problem. In contrast, in distance learning, these aspects of the professor had reduced their important. The professor has been assigned to teach only. Moreover, there will be a long response from the teachers when children ask them a question.In conclusion, traditional learning still has many benefits to the students. But in the future, it seems that the distance learning become more popular and ordinary in schools.
llm: In this digital age, online classes have gained significant interest and become increasingly common in society. Nearly every school has developed its own online class system, raising the question of whether online computer classes should replace traditional classroom learning. Although online classes have numerous advantages, I prefer traditional learning classes for several reasons.Firstly, interaction with others, such as classmates and professors, remains a crucial aspect of studying. Group work fosters discussion and the exchange of opinions among students, leading to expanded perspectives and respect for others' ideas. In contrast, distance learning provides limited opportunities for discussion and interaction with peers.Secondly, traditional classroom learning offers a range of activities beyond studying. During free time, students can engage in various activities, such as playing sports, working in labs, or visiting the library, which promotes social interaction and friendship. These connections can enhance cognitive abilities and provide opportunities to learn about society. In contrast, online courses often confine students to their homes, limiting their social interactions.Lastly, traditional schools provide professors who guide and support students when they encounter problems or need advice. Professors are readily available to offer guidance and assistance, and they prioritize helping students. In contrast, distance learning reduces the importance of these aspects, with professors primarily focused on teaching and often slow to respond to student inquiries.In conclusion, traditional learning still offers numerous benefits to students. However, it appears that distance learning may become increasingly popular and prevalent in schools in the future. Despite this trend, I believe that traditional learning classes provide unique advantages that online classes cannot replicate, making them a valuable and preferable option for students.

question: Some people believe that university students should be required to attend classes. Others believe that going to classes should be optional for students. Which point of view do you agree with? Use specific reasons and details to explain your answer.
human: The issue at hand is whether it should be obligatory for university students to attend classes. This is an interesting question because it affects a great amount of students worldwide. Nonetheless there are various different policies regarding this topic. An important aspect might be whether one desires to optimize the learned knowledge or the amount of valuable experiences for the students. However, to my mind students should be free not to attend classes because it improves the quality of student life as well as their learning motivation and teaches important life skills.Firstly, a liberal policy is very feasible. Checking for attendance requires a lot of bureaucracy. Especially for larger classes it is impossible to check for everybody to attend. So an optional attendance saves time and money.Secondly, some students might learn better at home on their own, for instance, by reading the textbook. This problem occurs especially if the lecturer is lethargic. By letting students choose not to attend class you give them the opportunity to escape bad teaching. Thus they are able to save precious study time and dive into the course syllabus independently.In addition, being free to stay away from classes improves flexibility and therefore quality of student life. Sometimes the wild party on Thursday night is too good to end already at midnight only because of a lecture on Friday in the morning. With a liberal policy students are able to postpone the learning to the afternoon which gives a feeling of freedom and improves time efficiency. Research has shown that the more satisfied the students are with those life aspects, the better they perform in academic areas.Finally, psychology knows two types of motivation. There is intrinsic motivation which comes from your own mindset. And there is extrinsic motivation which comes from the praise and laud of other people. Intrinsic motivation is known to be much more desirable because it leads to better learning and well-being. However, in order to gain intrinsic motivation students need to become aware of their strengths and aims. By giving students the freedom to choose about class attendance they might rather be thinking about why they decided to study and learn to motivate themselves. These are crucial skills for the duration of their study and their whole life time.To conclude, it is clear that going to classes should be optional for students. I hold this belief due to the improvement of students' current experience as well as the valuable skills and knowledge they obtain for their whole life afterwards.
llm: The debate about whether university students should be required to attend classes is a pressing issue that affects a vast number of students globally. Despite varying policies on this matter, a crucial consideration is whether the goal is to maximize the acquisition of knowledge or the accumulation of valuable experiences for students. In my opinion, the freedom to choose not to attend classes is essential, as it enhances the overall quality of student life, boosts learning motivation, and fosters important life skills.Firstly, a liberal attendance policy is highly practical. Monitoring attendance is a bureaucratic burden, particularly in large classes where it is nearly impossible to track every student's attendance. Allowing optional attendance saves time and resources.Secondly, some students may learn more effectively through self-study, such as reading textbooks, especially if the lecturer is uninspiring. By giving students the autonomy to miss classes, they can avoid poor teaching and optimize their study time. This enables them to delve into the course material independently and make the most of their study time.Moreover, the freedom to skip classes promotes flexibility, which in turn enhances the quality of student life. Sometimes, personal or social commitments, like a Thursday night event, may conflict with Friday morning lectures. A liberal policy enables students to postpone their studying to a more convenient time, giving them a sense of freedom and improving their time management. Research has shown that student satisfaction with their lifestyle is directly linked to their academic performance.Lastly, psychology distinguishes between two types of motivation: intrinsic, which stems from personal interest, and extrinsic, which is driven by external praise. Intrinsic motivation is more desirable, as it leads to better learning outcomes and overall well-being. However, to develop intrinsic motivation, students need to discover their strengths and goals. By granting students the freedom to choose their attendance, they are more likely to reflect on their reasons for studying and develop self-motivation skills. These skills are essential for their academic success and lifelong personal growth.In conclusion, it is evident that attending classes should be optional for university students. I firmly believe this, given the benefits to students' current experience and the valuable skills and knowledge they acquire for their future. By adopting a liberal attendance policy, universities can promote student autonomy, flexibility, and intrinsic motivation, ultimately leading to better academic outcomes and enhanced overall well-being.

question: Some people prefer to live in a small town. Others prefer to live in a big city. Which place would you prefer to live in? Use specific reasons and details to support your answer.
human: Place of living has the most significant affect on our lives and we have to choose it according to several factors. Some people prefer to live in tall buildings and crowded areas, whereas others prefer to live in a small and calm town. I would prefer to live in a small town and I think a small town has some advantages, such as good weather, a healthy life and better facilities.Firstly, the first advantage of living in a small town is a healthy life that we can obtain due to many items. One of the conditions that helps us to be healthy is good weather and less population that exist in a small town. Also, in a small town there are less crowded and less traffic. Living in a place with less pollution such as air pollution or sound pollution helps us to have a healthier life and one of the main consequences is less stress and more happiness. Moreover, in a small town foods and materials we need are healthier than in big cities and there are fresh foods and fruits. Regardless of some exceptions, it is obvious that living in small towns is healthier than in big cities.Secondly, another advantage of small towns is living costs. Living cost is one of the important concerns in every society and then, in a small town living cost is fewer than in big cities. Therefore, in a small town we can live in big houses with good landscapes, also because of less crowded spaces we have more facilities and more services. Transportation cost is less than in big cities and we have less traffic so that we can save time and money.In conclusion, I prefer to live in a small town and I think it has some advantages such as less stress, because of better weather conditions and also, better relationship within a town. In small town people know each other and have better deal together than big cities therefore on big cities people feel alone and depress more than small cities. However it is an obvious fact that people in small town have more happiness and friendship and less illness and stress.
llm: The place where we live has a profound impact on our lives, and its selection should be based on various factors. While some individuals prefer residing in tall buildings and crowded areas, others opt for a quieter, smaller town. Personally, I would choose to live in a small town, as I believe it offers several advantages, including pleasant weather, a healthier lifestyle, and better amenities.Firstly, one of the primary benefits of living in a small town is the opportunity to lead a healthier life. This is attributed to several factors, including favorable weather conditions and a lower population density. Small towns are also characterized by less crowding and traffic congestion, resulting in reduced pollution, such as air and noise pollution. This, in turn, contributes to a life with less stress and greater happiness. Moreover, the food and materials available in small towns are generally fresher and healthier than those found in large cities, with an abundance of fresh produce and fruits. With few exceptions, it is clear that residing in small towns is healthier than living in metropolitan areas.Secondly, another advantage of small towns is the lower cost of living. Living expenses are a significant concern in every society, and small towns offer a more affordable lifestyle compared to big cities. As a result, it is possible to reside in spacious homes with attractive landscapes, and the less crowded environment provides more facilities and services. Transportation costs are also lower in small towns, with less traffic, allowing for valuable time and money savings.In conclusion, my preference is to live in a small town, which I believe offers numerous advantages, including reduced stress due to better weather conditions and stronger community relationships. In small towns, residents are more likely to know and interact with each other, fostering a sense of community and cooperation that is often lacking in larger cities, where individuals may feel isolated and more prone to depression. Ultimately, it is evident that people living in small towns tend to experience greater happiness and friendship, and fewer instances of illness and stress.

question: In many countries, young people leave rural areas to study or work in cities. What do you think are reason of this? Do you think the advantages outweigh the disadvantages?
human: These days, there are increasing numbers of young people from the countryside moving to cities in search of jobs and educational opportunities. Personally, I think it has some drawbacks that will be discussed in this essay together with some reasons about this.To begin with, the major cause that leads to urban migration of young adults is that cities often offer more well-paid jobs and study chances compared to rural areas. Obviously, many large companies and universities often locate in cities which are hailed as promising lands to develop their career. Therefore they move to big cities to pursue academic career and find jobs in order to have a higher standard of living. For example, if a gradate stays in the city after leaving his college and seeks a job with good salary instead of returning his village to do farm work, he could perhaps buy a house or his own car after a short time. However, this phenomenon sometimes poses several negative consequences. There can be no doubt that the burgeoning number of young adults from the countryside flocking to cities gives rise to overpopulation in cities. As a result, cities cannot provide adequate space for thousands of dwellers that might lead to poor housing conditions and sanitation. Additionally, it might put strain on the environment. If there are more people in the cities, there would be large numbers of vehicles on the road, which causes air pollution.In conclusion, young people tend to study or work in urban areas since these provide them many educational opportunities and career potentials. In my opinion, however, I do not approve of this trend due to negative effects such as low quality of life and affecting the environment.
llm: In recent years, a growing number of young people from rural areas have been migrating to cities in pursuit of employment and educational opportunities. In this essay, I will discuss the drawbacks of this trend, as well as the underlying reasons behind it.The primary motivation for young adults to migrate to cities is the prospect of better-paying jobs and greater educational opportunities compared to what is available in rural areas. Cities are often home to large companies and universities, making them attractive destinations for those seeking to advance their careers. As a result, many young people move to cities to pursue academic and professional goals, with the aim of improving their standard of living. For instance, a graduate who remains in the city after completing their studies and secures a well-paying job may be able to afford a house or car within a relatively short period.However, this phenomenon also has several negative consequences. The influx of young people from rural areas to cities inevitably leads to overpopulation, resulting in inadequate living space and poor housing conditions. Furthermore, this can put a strain on the environment, as the increased number of people in cities leads to a higher volume of vehicles on the roads, causing air pollution.In conclusion, while cities offer numerous educational and career opportunities that attract young people, I believe that this trend has significant drawbacks. The negative effects on the quality of life and the environment are notable concerns that cannot be ignored. Ultimately, I do not support this trend due to its detrimental consequences.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement. High school students should take a course on basic economics
human: In today's community, economy becomes the order of the day. Getting to know the theory in this area seems really important for our students. Then, the earlier we jump into this area, the more skillful we will be. Thus, in my point of view, although it will take some time on it, high school students should take a course on basic economics. Let me explain it in detail.For the primary concern, it can provide students a sense of direction in academy. Basic economic class can help the students touch the surface of this field, let them to know what this subject mainly discuss. That will help the students cultivate their own interest and a sense of career orientation. Finally, students may study harder for their economic dreams. On the other hand, economy is always correlate with politics, students can study specialized knowledge along with some Politian status, which may open their vision toward the nation and don't get limited in the textbooks. Besides, there is also an intimate connection between economy and enterprises, students can also gain knowledge more practical and vivid.In addition, the basic economic course can also help with the students when they go to college. They may feel more readily to learn the knowledge in this field and save much time, with that they are able to study more efficiently and more deeply than other students. That as well would provide the students with more confidence and let them become more compatible.Considering all those factors above, I suggest the basic course of economic is necessary.
llm: In today's society, economics plays a vital role, making it essential for students to gain a solid understanding of its principles. The sooner students are introduced to this field, the more proficient they will become. Therefore, in my opinion, high school students should be required to take a basic economics course, despite the time commitment it may require. Let me elaborate on this point.Firstly, a basic economics class can provide students with a sense of direction in their academic pursuits. By introducing them to the fundamentals of economics, students can develop an understanding of the subject matter and cultivate their own interest in the field. This, in turn, can foster a sense of career orientation, motivating students to work harder towards achieving their economic goals.Moreover, economics is closely tied to politics, allowing students to explore specialized knowledge alongside political concepts. This can broaden their perspective on national issues, encouraging them to think beyond the confines of their textbooks. Additionally, the inherent connection between economics and enterprise can provide students with practical and engaging knowledge.Furthermore, a basic economics course can also benefit students when they transition to college. With a foundational understanding of economics, they will be better equipped to learn and absorb new knowledge, saving time and enabling them to study more efficiently and in-depth than their peers. This, in turn, can boost their confidence and make them more competitive.Considering these factors, I firmly believe that a basic economics course is essential for high school students. It can provide them with a strong foundation, practical knowledge, and a competitive edge, ultimately preparing them for success in their academic and professional pursuits.

question: University education should be restricted to the very best academic students, rather than being available to a large proportion of young people. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
human: Universtiy is an entrance to life. It equips us with a package of wisdom and virtue to succeed. It is the importance of university that raises a question whether students with best scholastic performance deserve university study or just any young wishful people. Both sides are to be discussed before a conclusion is reached.To begin with, outstanding academic students are eligible for university due to their intellectual advantage. To be precise, such abstract or complicated informatin, easily absorbed by those students, may prove as a matter of pressure for those who lack equivalent skills. Besides, it is undeniable that one deserves what he has done. University is like a gift presented to those who have gone to great length to attain.However, university is not just about academic studies but also a place to nurture artistic talent and develop soft skills. Therefore, it should be up for grabs for a majority of young people, who wish to pursue their passion as well as develop comprehensively. What is more, there is a tendency for social vices to rise if university is to be restricted to only the best people. Apart from the disheartened ones, many devoiding of neccessary preparations are likely to be recipes for failure when applying for jobs, mostly the white-collar ones.In conclusion, university restriction has both pros and cons. In my opinion, it will yield more negative results than positive ones. That's why it should be made available for a wide range of learners.
llm: University is a gateway to life, providing individuals with a foundation of wisdom and virtue that enables them to succeed. The significance of university raises an important question: do only students with exceptional academic performance deserve to attend university, or should it be accessible to any young person with aspirations? To answer this, it's essential to consider both perspectives before reaching a conclusion.On one hand, students who excel academically are naturally suited for university due to their intellectual capabilities. They can easily grasp complex information, which may be overwhelming for those with lesser skills. Furthermore, it's only fair that individuals reap the rewards of their hard work and dedication. University can be seen as a reward for those who have put in the effort to achieve academic excellence.On the other hand, university is not solely focused on academic pursuits, but also serves as a platform for nurturing artistic talent and developing essential life skills. Therefore, it should be accessible to a broad range of young people who wish to pursue their passions and develop holistically. By doing so, individuals can explore their interests, develop their skills, and become well-rounded individuals.Moreover, restricting university access to only the most academically gifted students could have negative social consequences. Those who are denied access may become disheartened, and those who lack necessary preparation may struggle to secure employment, particularly in white-collar jobs. This could lead to an increase in social problems and unemployment.In conclusion, the idea of restricting university access has both advantages and disadvantages. In my opinion, the negative consequences outweigh the positive ones. Therefore, university education should be made available to a diverse range of learners, providing them with the opportunity to grow, develop, and succeed in their chosen paths.

question: Prevention is better than cure. Out of a country's health budget, a large proportion should be diverted from treatment to spending on health education and preventative measures. To what extent do you agree or disagree with this statement?
human: In today's world, the concept of the welfare state requires governments to provide sustainable healthcare and health education to their citizens. I completely agree with the idea that governments should devote a greater portion of their health budgets to health education and means for precautions.The first reason why education and preventative measures should receive a greater budget is the potential improvements in health system. I believe that decreasing the number of patients in the health system can lead hospitals and healthcare centers to be managed effectively which will result in better treatments for current patients. Therefore, society should be educated and became aware of health issues so that the potential precautions on the way of illnesses can be taken instead of trying to provide treatment for the increasing number of patients.The second reason why governments should allocate more budget on prevention from illness and providing health education is the welfare of the society. In my opinion, there is nothing more important than health in a human's life and the happiness and welfare come with health. Therefore, a government's role should be providing means that lead its citizens to learn how to prevent from potential illness that can cause misery in people's lives. For example, the marketing campaign of Ministry of Health in Turkey which aimed smoking problem among the youth increased the well-being of those who quit smoking and adapted a better lifestyle after the campaign.In conclusion, a greater proportion of the budget should be allotted to education and prevention issues in comparison with treatment due to achieve more effective health system and greater level of well-being.
llm: In the modern era, the notion of a welfare state obliges governments to ensure their citizens have access to comprehensive healthcare and health education. I firmly endorse the proposition that governments should allocate a larger share of their health budgets to health education and preventive measures.The primary rationale for prioritizing education and prevention is the potential for significant enhancements in the healthcare system. By reducing the number of patients, healthcare facilities can be managed more efficiently, ultimately leading to improved treatment outcomes for existing patients. To achieve this, it is essential to educate society about health issues, enabling individuals to take preventive measures against illnesses rather than relying on treatment for an increasing number of patients.A secondary justification for governments to dedicate more resources to illness prevention and health education is the overall welfare of society. In my view, health is the most vital aspect of human life, as it is a precursor to happiness and well-being. Consequently, a government's responsibility should include providing the means for citizens to learn how to prevent potential illnesses that can cause suffering. For instance, the Turkish Ministry of Health's marketing campaign targeting smoking among youth led to improved well-being among those who quit smoking and adopted healthier lifestyles following the campaign.In conclusion, a larger proportion of the budget should be assigned to education and prevention compared to treatment, as this approach can yield a more effective healthcare system and a higher level of societal well-being.

question: With the pressures on todayÕs young people to succeed academically, some people believe that non-academic subjects at school (eg: physical education and cookery should be removed from the syllabus so that children can concentrate wholly on academic subjects. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
human: Students have become more and more stressed during the last few years due to the increase in academic tasks assigned by their teachers to improve their academic success. While some people believe that non-academic subjects should be completely removed, I strongly disagree with that.To begin with, from the health point of view, schools should not only deliver academic subjects. If physical education is removed from the syllabus, there will be considerable negative effects on students’ health. For instance, after studying and sitting in the classroom for the whole morning, it is better for students to do some outdoor activities, such as stretching, jogging and playing ball games, in order to improve their learning ability during the afternoon classes. Removing physical classes from school education will not only be harmful to young people’s health, it will also decrease their learning capability.In addition, schools are responsible for developing their students into well-rounded people. It is more important for a person to success in life than to success only academically. Success in life should be the ultimate goal of a student, which requires more than academic knowledge, but also practical life skills such as cooking, good communication skills and teamwork spirit. Thus, school education should not only focus on the academic development of a student as it is much more crucial to teach them how to be independent and live a good life.Some people may argue that students can learn practical skills after school hours from their parents. However, I believe that it is not a good idea because most young people would rather watch TV or play computer games after school instead of learning life skills from their parents. Moreover, parents are usually too busy with their daily jobs to teach their children the life skills.In conclusion, I strongly believe that non-academic subjects are as essential as academic subjects for a student’s development. Therefore, schools should not remove these subjects.
llm: In recent years, students have experienced increasing levels of stress due to the rising number of academic tasks assigned by teachers aimed at boosting academic achievement. Although some argue that non-academic subjects should be eliminated entirely, I firmly disagree.Firstly, from a health perspective, schools should offer more than just academic subjects. Removing physical education from the curriculum would have significant negative consequences on students' well-being. For example, after a morning of studying and sitting in class, participating in outdoor activities like stretching, jogging, and playing team sports can enhance students' learning capacity in afternoon classes. Eliminating physical education would not only harm students' health but also diminish their ability to learn.Furthermore, schools play a crucial role in developing students into well-rounded individuals. Achieving success in life is more important than mere academic success. To succeed in life, students need more than just academic knowledge; they require practical life skills like cooking, effective communication, and teamwork. Therefore, school education should focus on teaching students how to be independent and lead a fulfilling life, rather than solely concentrating on academic development.Some may argue that students can acquire practical skills from their parents outside of school hours. However, I believe this is not a viable solution, as many young people would rather engage in leisure activities like watching TV or playing video games instead of learning from their parents. Additionally, parents are often too preoccupied with their jobs to dedicate time to teaching their children essential life skills.In conclusion, I firmly believe that non-academic subjects are just as vital as academic ones for a student's overall development. Consequently, schools should not consider removing these subjects from their curriculum.

question: When people move to another country, some of them decide to follow the customs of the new country. Others prefer to keep their own customs. Compare these two choices. Which one do you prefer? Support your answer with specific details.
human: When people move to another country, most likely, they will face the choice between following the customs of the new country or keeping their original one. Some people choose the former one to assimilate themselves into the new culture, while some insist the latter one because the new customs are difficult to be accepted. As for me, I would follow the new customs, if I migrated to another country.On one hand, it will be easier for people to assimilate into a new country, if they follow the new customs. When people migrate to a new country, they are likely to suffer the culture shock, because of the difference between two cultures. The custom is just a form of the culture and following the custom is a good way to know more about this culture. For example, if one wore in white and went to common Viharas to observe a rather longer-than-usual, full-length Buddhist sutra in Buddha's Birthday in India, he or she would learn something about Indian religion and culture. As a result, people understand the culture, and then they adapt to the new country.On the other hand, keeping own customs stably might cause discrimination. When people insist to keep their own customs and refuse to accept the new one, they regard themselves as a special group in the new country. The local people may also regard them as a special group as well and separate them from the main-stream society. One example of this is that the Chinese immigrants in Indonesia in 1969. They formed Chinatown and kept Chinese language and customs in it. While the Indonesians stopped working at 4:00 pm and went home for rest, Chinese immigrants were still working. Although being much richer than local people, they faced the discrimination. Their houses and private cars were buried by local people, because the locals were jealous of Chinese people, who had so much wealth, which should have been theirs. If the Chinese immigrants had followed the local customs and assimilated into Indonesia, they would not have been regards as a group of Chinese and discrimination might have been alleviated.All in all, the immigrants should follow the customs in the new country, which can help them survive from the culture shock sooner, and assimilate to a new culture.
llm: When individuals relocate to a new country, they are often faced with the decision of whether to adopt the customs of their new home or retain their original ones. Some choose to assimilate into the new culture by following local customs, while others prefer to maintain their traditional ways, finding it challenging to adapt to new practices. Personally, I would opt to follow the new customs if I were to migrate to another country.On the one hand, embracing new customs can facilitate a smoother transition into the new country. Immigrants often experience culture shock due to the differences between their native culture and the new one. Adapting to local customs is an effective way to learn about and understand the new culture. For instance, participating in a Buddhist ceremony in India, such as observing a traditional Buddhist sutra on Buddha's Birthday, can provide valuable insights into Indian religion and culture. By doing so, individuals can gain a deeper understanding of the culture, which in turn, aids in their adaptation to the new country.On the other hand, insisting on maintaining one's original customs can lead to discrimination. When people cling to their traditional practices and resist adopting new ones, they may be perceived as a distinct group within the new society. Locals may also view them as separate from the mainstream community. A notable example is the Chinese immigrants in Indonesia in 1969, who established their own community, Chinatown, and preserved their language and customs. While the locals would stop working at 4:00 pm to rest, the Chinese immigrants continued to work, leading to resentment from the locals who felt jealous of the immigrants' wealth. This ultimately resulted in the locals targeting the Chinese community.
