llm: Every parent aspires for their child to be outstanding and successful, and to achieve this, they often start cultivating their children from a very young age. In addition to basic subjects like language and science, music and art are typically at the top of the list of essential skills for parents to teach their children. In my opinion, I firmly believe that children should learn music and art at a young age, as they offer numerous benefits.Firstly, it is ideal for children to develop their sense of music and art when they are young, as they possess a natural ability to absorb and learn quickly. Children have a vivid imagination, which is a crucial element in music and art, allowing them to think creatively and bring new ideas to life. Unlike subjects like math or language, which have strict rules and guidelines, music and art are more abstract and rely on imagination and creativity. Children have the freedom to express themselves without the constraints of reality, and even simple drawings and melodies can bring them immense joy and allow their imagination to soar.Secondly, music and art are lifelong pursuits that are well worth investing time and effort into. They teach us to appreciate beauty, express our feelings in a creative way, and are essential to our spiritual well-being. Even if children do not grow up to be great musicians or artists, learning music and art is still valuable, as it can enrich their character and serve as a hobby.Some people may argue that parents should not put too much pressure on children to learn multiple skills, as it can be overwhelming for them. However, in my opinion, it depends on how these learning activities are approached. If parents push their five-year-old child to practice piano for eight hours a day, like a professional performer, that is indeed excessive. At a young age, music and art should be introduced as a way to explore the world of art, rather than as a means to acquire specific skills. By approaching it in this way, it will not be a burden on children.In conclusion, the young age is the perfect time for children to learn music and art, and these skills are valuable not only during childhood but throughout one's life. Music and art have the power to accompany and enrich a person's spirit, as long as they are given the opportunity to enter their life.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? The best way for teachers to make students more interested in a subject is explaining how that subject will help in their lives outside school.
human: There are many ways of teaching. Some people believe that strictly and carefully presenting theories in the class is the best way of teaching, while others assert that involving applications on that theory will be more convincing. In my opinion, I agree with the second idea that the best way for teachers to make students more interested in a subject is to explain how that subject can help and apply to their lives outside school.First of all, by explaining how the subject contributes to daily life, students will have vivid impression on that subject thus become more interested and active in acquiring the knowledge on that subject. Take chemistry for example, merely memorizing the names of the substances and the structural formulas seems to be very boring, while representing where and how those chemical reactions really happen near students will raise their curiosity and lead them to digest those theories learned from the class. While I was in senior high school, my chemical teacher once showed us how the detergent dissolves oil by an experiment and later on taught us how to describe this process with formal structural formulas. This type of learning method is more fun and eventually the results are good. I connected the visual images of that experiment with the formula and I barely forget, even though now I'm not studying chemistry anymore.Second, by bridging the theories with daily life events, students are given the chance to apply knowledge to their lives and develop their own ability of problem-solving. This will address students' interests because it's the assignment that needs real life participation. For example, in law class, students are informed their rights and duties and they are taught how they can apply law to different situations that might happen upon them. When any one of the situations occurs, they can think independently and figure out how to react.In conclusion, using life experiences and examples to demonstrate the knowledge on a subject is an effective way to attract students' attention and keep them eager on learning, not only because it reinforces students' impression on the knowledge but also invites students to practice the knowledge out on their own.
llm: The art of teaching can be approached in numerous ways. While some individuals believe that meticulously presenting theories in a classroom setting is the most effective teaching method, others argue that incorporating practical applications of those theories is more persuasive. Personally, I concur with the latter viewpoint, which suggests that the most compelling way for educators to pique students' interest in a subject is to illustrate its relevance and applicability to their everyday lives beyond the school walls.Initially, by elucidating how a subject contributes to daily life, students are likely to form a vivid impression of the subject matter, thereby becoming more engaged and proactive in acquiring knowledge about it. For instance, consider chemistry: merely memorizing the names of substances and their structural formulas can be a tedious exercise, whereas demonstrating where and how chemical reactions occur in students' immediate surroundings can spark their curiosity and motivate them to internalize the theories learned in class. During my senior high school years, my chemistry teacher conducted an experiment showing how detergent dissolves oil, subsequently teaching us how to describe this process using formal structural formulas. This pedagogical approach was not only more enjoyable but also yielded positive outcomes. By connecting the visual images of the experiment with the formula, I was able to retain the information with ease, even after I had stopped studying chemistry.Furthermore, by bridging theoretical concepts with everyday life events, students are afforded the opportunity to apply their knowledge in real-world scenarios and develop their problem-solving skills. This strategy caters to students' interests as it involves real-life participation and practical application. For example, in a law class, students are informed about their rights and duties, and taught how to apply legal principles to various situations that may arise in their lives. When such situations occur, they can think critically and determine an appropriate course of action.In conclusion, utilizing life experiences and examples to demonstrate subject matter is an efficacious method for capturing students' attention and sustaining their enthusiasm for learning. This approach not only reinforces students' impression of the knowledge but also invites them to practice and apply it in their own lives, thereby rendering the learning experience more engaging, relevant, and effective.

question: Governments should focus its budget more on environmental protection than on economic developments.
human: Environmental protection and economic developments might be the biggest issues in the 21st century. They are both important because they are vital to human's future and welfare. However, since the budget and the recourse are limited, governments must choose between these two issues. In my opinion, I believe that tackling down environmental problems is of the first priority rather than economic developments. The following are reasons why. First, environmental protection is far more urgent than economic developments. All the living creatures live together on our mother Earth and she is the only one. Without Earth, whatever great civil constructions and economic achievements will end up in vain because we will all perish as she's gone. Just like a man that needs a healthy body, all the living creatures as a whole needs a strong planet as well. Second, the influence on environmental problems are boarder and more profound than economic issues. Environmental problems are global rather than local, which means that no countries can be spared from these problems. Take global warming for example, when the temperature increases, the whole globe is affected, suffering the hotter weather together. The melting ice mountain not only jeopardizes habitats of animals living in the polar region, but its effects of the rising sea level also endangers the residents living in the small island near the equator, since the rising sea water could drown them. Environmental issues can not be divided by nationality because all humans are simply entwined together by our only home-Earth.Some people might argue that economic issues are global and critical as well thus can not be put aside. They may say that if the economic is in a very bad situation, people would revolt instantly, while environmental problems seem to be more like chronic diseases that would not burst out right away. However, the truth is that we've been encountering so many sighs and warnings of global climate anomalies and other environmental crisis right now. It would be unwise to still deny the truth and keep focusing on economic developments and unfortunately, usually the economic developments are even the causes of environmental damages.In conclusion, environmental conservation is more essential than economic developments in the aspects of urgency and ranges of influence. As mentioned in the second paragraph, how can a man live happily if he is unhealthy? Similarly, how can we live safely and joyfully when our home is devastated by, ironically, by ourselves?
llm: In the 21st century, two paramount issues dominate the global agenda: environmental protection and economic development. Both are crucial for human welfare and the future, but due to limited resources and budgets, governments are often forced to prioritize one over the other. In my view, addressing environmental issues should take precedence over economic development, and here's why.Firstly, environmental protection is more pressing than economic growth. The Earth is our sole habitat, and without it, all our achievements and advancements would be rendered meaningless, as our very existence would be at stake. Just as a person needs a healthy body to thrive, all living beings collectively need a robust and healthy planet. The urgency of environmental issues surpasses that of economic development because the consequences of neglecting the former are irreversible and catastrophic.Secondly, environmental problems have far-reaching and profound impacts that transcend national boundaries. Unlike economic issues, which can be localized, environmental challenges are inherently global, affecting every nation and population without discrimination. The example of global warming illustrates this point starkly. As temperatures rise, the entire globe suffers together, from the melting of polar ice caps, which not only threatens the habitats of polar animals but also endangers island residents near the equator due to rising sea levels. Environmental issues cannot be compartmentalized by nationality because all humans are inextricably linked through our shared home, the Earth.Some may argue that economic issues are equally global and critical, and thus cannot be neglected. They might posit that economic downturns can lead to immediate and violent reactions from the public, whereas environmental problems seem like chronic conditions that do not escalate as quickly. However, the reality is that we are already witnessing numerous signs and warnings of environmental crises, including global climate anomalies. It would be prudent to acknowledge these warnings rather than continue to prioritize economic development, which, ironically, is often the root cause of environmental degradation.In conclusion, environmental conservation takes precedence over economic development in terms of both urgency and the scope of influence. The analogy of a person's health is apt; just as one cannot be happy while being unhealthy, similarly, we cannot live safely or joyfully on a planet devastated by our own actions. It is imperative that we prioritize the health of our planet to ensure our own well-being and survival.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? In twenty years there will be fewer cars in use than there are today. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
human: Views differ considerably when it comes to the issue of whether cars will be less than there are today in twenty years or not. Some people believe that since the environmental concern has risen, the car use will decrease. While others think that a personal car is important for ones daily life. Both of the opposite arguments appear to be somewhat convincing and stand to reason. But as far as I am concerned, I agree with the idea, which is that there will be a decrease in cars use in the future. The following reasons will present my points.First of all, since the public transportation has improved, it is much convenience to take a subway or a bus. For example, I live in a city which always have a jam in the morning and doesn't have enough parking lots for the cars. So, with the stations increased people are willing to take a public transportation than drive on their own. Second, a driving car can make a lot of different pollutions to the world. So, with the risen of the aware to the environment, people will think more about whether to drive on their own or not. For example, instead of driving each one's car, if we put forty people in a bus, it will solve the traffic jam by decrease the cars use and also reduce the air pollution for the city.Although, I am agree with the idea that reducing of the car use will be achieve in twenty years. I think I still have to point out that there are some different points of view. People who hold different opinion may argue that a personal car uses is in need because a public transportation can't meet every place. Of course, it may be true when you want to go to some countryside or some other inconvenience places. However, no matter you are going to somewhere for a trip or you just simply live in some suburbs and so on, it always have some other ways that you can do, you can ride a bike, or even walk on your feet. It not only helps you to reduce the car use, but also good to your health. In this way, this won't be a problem at all.In conclusion, given the reasons described above, when the advantages and disadvantages of whether there will be fewer cars in use in twenty years or not are carefully compared, the best choice is obviously stand on my side, which is that the car use will definitely decrease in twenty years.
llm: The topic of whether the number of cars on the road will decrease in the next twenty years sparks a significant amount of debate. Opinions are divided, with some individuals believing that the growing concern for the environment will lead to a reduction in car usage, while others argue that personal vehicles are essential for daily life. Both perspectives have their merits, making them convincing to a certain extent. However, I am inclined to agree with the notion that car usage will indeed decrease in the future, and I will outline the reasons that support this viewpoint.Firstly, the improvement in public transportation systems has made commuting significantly more convenient. For instance, living in a city plagued by morning traffic jams and a shortage of parking spaces, I have observed that the increased availability of subway and bus stations has encouraged people to opt for public transport over driving their own vehicles. This shift is not only beneficial for reducing traffic congestion but also for minimizing the need for personal cars.Secondly, driving cars is a major contributor to various forms of pollution, which has become a pressing global issue. As environmental awareness rises, people are more likely to consider the impact of their actions, including their choice of transportation. A notable example is the efficiency of using buses over personal cars. By filling a bus with forty passengers, it not only alleviates traffic congestion by reducing the number of cars on the road but also significantly decreases air pollution in urban areas.Although I concur with the idea that car usage will diminish over the next twenty years, it's essential to acknowledge the counterarguments. Some might argue that personal car usage is necessary because public transportation cannot reach all areas, particularly rural or less accessible regions. This point is valid, especially when considering trips to the countryside or other hard-to-reach locations. Nonetheless, there are often alternative solutions available, such as biking or walking, which not only reduce car usage but also offer health benefits. For example, living in suburbs or planning a trip can be managed with these eco-friendly and healthy transportation methods, making the limitation of public transportation less of an issue.In conclusion, after weighing the advantages and disadvantages of the potential decrease in car usage over the next twenty years, it becomes apparent that the most logical stance is that car usage will indeed decrease. The reasons outlined above, including the convenience of improved public transportation and the environmental benefits of reducing personal vehicle use, strongly support this prediction. As society continues to evolve with a greater emphasis on sustainability and health, the reliance on personal cars is likely to diminish, paving the way for a future with fewer cars on the

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? ItÕs not necessary for university students to attend class as long as they can pass their examinations.
human: In university education, students are given much independence in the ways of learning. Some students still rely on classes to keep up with the courses, while some students don't feel the need to attend classes because they believe that they can handle the exams. These different ideas of learning methods lead to a question whether it is necessary for university students to attend the class as long as they can pass their examinations. In my opinion, I believe that students should always attend class no matter what the outcome of the exam is. First, in terms of learning, attending class is more effective than simply studying alone to pass the exams. Classes are designed diligently for the students and professors absolutely bear more knowledge than the students. Professors not only have the knowledge, but also equip with experiences, knowing how to guide their students toward their academic achievements. Second, it's students' basic responsibility to attend class. Attending class is the most persuasive way for the students to show respect to the professor as well as themselves. Many professors grade their students with class attendances. In other words, class attendances are regarded as critical as examination performances. Those who even achieve high scores on exams could fail if they didn't show up in the classes.Some people might argue that if students already understand the contents on the class enough to pass the exams or they can study the course on their own. Why wasting time going to classes? Doesn't self-study more efficient? However, in my opinion, this is a rather immodest way of thinking. I believe that professors can always give students more than students themselves could because of the experiences and their qualifications as professors. Besides, even if students believe that they are so brilliant to surpass their professors, they can still go to the classes to discuss with professors and classmates. In conclusion, students can learn more thoroughly as well as showing respect for professors and themselves through attending classes. It's an essential learning process. Passing the exams is not the terminal purpose of learning. The learning process itself, however, is the most important and powerful way of evaluating a student.
llm: In higher education, students are afforded a significant amount of autonomy in their learning approaches. While some students rely heavily on attending classes to stay on top of their coursework, others feel that attending classes is unnecessary as long as they can pass their exams. This raises the question of whether attending classes is a necessity for university students, as long as they can achieve academic success. In my opinion, I firmly believe that students should attend classes regardless of their potential exam outcomes.Firstly, attending classes is a more effective way of learning compared to studying alone for the sole purpose of passing exams. Classes are meticulously designed by professors who possess a wealth of knowledge and experience, making them better equipped to guide students towards academic achievement. The structured learning environment and expert guidance provided in classes facilitate a deeper understanding of the subject matter.Secondly, attending classes is a fundamental responsibility of students. It demonstrates respect not only for the professor but also for oneself. Many professors consider class attendance a crucial factor in evaluating student performance, often incorporating it into their grading criteria. In fact, even students who achieve high scores on exams may fail if they have poor attendance records. This underscores the importance of attending classes as an integral part of the learning process.Some might argue that if a student already grasps the course material sufficiently to pass exams, or if they can effectively study the course on their own, then attending classes would be a waste of time. They might suggest that self-study is more efficient. However, I consider this viewpoint to be somewhat arrogant. Professors, due to their experience and qualifications, can offer insights and knowledge that surpass what students can achieve on their own. Furthermore, even the most confident students can benefit from attending classes, as it provides a platform to engage in discussions with both professors and peers, fostering a richer learning experience.In conclusion, attending classes is essential for a thorough learning experience and demonstrates respect for both the professors and oneself. The process of learning, rather than just the outcome of passing exams, is the ultimate goal of education. It is through attending classes and engaging with the academic community that students can truly evaluate their own learning and growth. Therefore, I strongly advocate for the importance of class attendance as a vital component of the university experience.

question: When people succeed, it is because of hard work. Luck has nothing to do with success." Do you agree or disagree with the quotation above?
human: What do you think when you see a beautiful building? And also when you see an airport? Do you think they have built by chance? Of course don't. Also it is ridiculous if you think world wide webs such as Google, Yahoo etc. created by chance. Howbeit some people think that luck is cause of a lot of success, but to be frank I cannot agree with them. I would explore my primary reasons here. To begin with, famous people are usually diligent people not lucky people. Hard work make you a professional man/woman which are powerful in his or her job. I mean, when you work hard you decrease portion of chance in your success. For example in football game it is said that penalty-kick need good chance to be goal. Statically the chance of being goal is fifty-fifty. But I think Ronaldo make a goal from a penalty-kick with more possibility than me. It is not for which Ronaldo is more fortune than me. Definitely it is for which he have more practice and exercise than me. He do a lot of exercise in football field every day, so it is not for which he is luckier than me.Moreover, we cannot always lean on our luck to be successful. I don't want to disavow the role of luck in success, but as you know it hardly accompany us. So, for example you prepare for TOEFL or other multiple-choice test which has four option to choose in every question. You cannot prepare for it without any study and Rely on your luck, even if you be a very lucky. If you pick up any choice by chance you would fail the exam. Undoubtedly it is wise advice which you have hard study to success on exam.Finally, you have to work hard to learn and to get a lot of information before doing a project in good way. The most fortunate people in the word cannot manufacture an automobile or build a high tower just by her or his chance. These plans is done by someone who is mastered in his/her work. Undoubtedly such people do work hard and have great experiences because of their hard works.In the end, I think any great success need great work not great luck, even though luck is one factor in reaching goal but its impact is extraneous and we must not reckon on luck in our plans.
llm: When we come across impressive structures like beautiful buildings or airports, it's unlikely that we attribute their existence to chance. Similarly, it's absurd to think that complex global networks like Google or Yahoo were created by luck alone. While some people believe that luck plays a significant role in achieving success, I strongly disagree. In this essay, I will outline my primary reasons for this stance.Firstly, it's evident that famous and successful individuals are often diligent and hardworking, rather than simply lucky. Through dedication and perseverance, one can develop expertise and become a powerhouse in their field. The more we work hard, the less we rely on chance for success. For instance, in a football game, a penalty kick has a 50-50 chance of resulting in a goal. However, a skilled player like Ronaldo is more likely to score than an amateur like myself, not because he's luckier, but because he has put in countless hours of practice and exercise. His success is a direct result of his hard work, not mere luck.Moreover, we cannot rely solely on luck to achieve success. While I acknowledge that luck can play a role, it's unreliable and unpredictable. For example, preparing for a multiple-choice exam like TOEFL requires diligent study and preparation. One cannot simply rely on luck to pass the exam, even with the best of intentions. The wise approach is to study hard and make informed decisions, rather than leaving it to chance.Finally, achieving success in complex projects requires a tremendous amount of learning, planning, and effort. Even the most fortunate individuals cannot manufacture a car or build a skyscraper solely based on luck. Such feats are accomplished by individuals who have mastered their craft through hard work and dedication. These individuals have gained valuable experience and expertise, which enables them to undertake and complete complex tasks.In conclusion, while luck may play a minor role in achieving success, it's the hard work and dedication that ultimately lead to great accomplishments. We should not rely on luck to achieve our goals, but rather focus on putting in the effort and perseverance required to succeed. Great success demands great work, not great luck.

question: Some people think that they can learn better by themselves than a teacher. Others think that it is better to have a teacher. Which do you prefer? Use specific reasons to develop your essay.
human: Different people prefer different styles of learning. I think both learning by myself and learning with a teacher could be helpful. Learning with a teacher can prevent one from being confused and increase the rate and speed of learning. Another important point is that for practical subjects you have to have a teacher. On the other hand, sometimes I would rather learning on my own.A good and experienced teacher can help me learn faster and easier. Sometimes when learning a course by myself which is hard and confusing to understand and has few sources available, I get discouraged after spending a lot of time. In this situation, I'll look for a teacher and request for help from him or her. And then he or she will teach me the course efficiently in a short time and therefore I will learn faster and better and won't get discouraged and confused.There are some practical subjects that you can only learn them with a teacher or an instructor. For example, if you want to learn driving a car or some jobs like medicine and engineering and some sports like skiing and swimming, you'll have to find a teacher. It's almost impossible and inefficient to learn those things on your own. By the way, if you are going to learn some things by yourself, you may learn and understand them incorrectly! For example, from my own experiences, after I had started learning playing the guitar without a teacher, I got used to wrong habits regarding strumming and tempo, but after finding and learning with a tutor and identifying and eliminating those incorrect habits, I was able to play properly.There are some things that I prefer to learn them without a teacher because I won't have to spend extra money for a teacher and my time will not be wasted either because of going to classes. In today's world there are many great and useful sources available like books, electronic books, the internet and TV and satellite. I can utilize them as tutorials for many things. For instance, I can learn English or other languages by a lot of helpful books and many online websites. In sum, sometimes it is good to learn with a teacher and sometimes on my own. In my view, both can help and each of them has its own advantages and disadvantages.
llm: People have different preferences when it comes to learning styles, and I believe that both self-directed learning and learning with a teacher have their benefits. On one hand, learning with a teacher can be extremely beneficial, as they can clarify confusing concepts, increase the pace of learning, and provide personalized guidance. This is particularly important for practical subjects, which often require hands-on instruction and supervision. For instance, learning to drive a car, pursuing a career in medicine or engineering, or mastering sports like skiing or swimming, typically necessitate the guidance of a qualified teacher or instructor.A skilled and experienced teacher can significantly enhance the learning process, making it faster and more efficient. When faced with a challenging course that is difficult to comprehend and has limited resources available, I often find myself getting discouraged after investing a significant amount of time. In such situations, seeking the help of a teacher proves invaluable, as they can teach the course effectively and concisely, thereby facilitating quicker and better learning while minimizing confusion and discouragement.Moreover, certain subjects can only be effectively learned with the guidance of a teacher. For example, I learned this lesson the hard way when I initially started learning to play the guitar without a teacher. I developed incorrect strumming and tempo habits, which were later identified and corrected by a tutor, enabling me to play properly. This experience underscored the importance of proper instruction in certain areas.On the other hand, I sometimes prefer learning on my own due to the associated cost and time savings. With the plethora of resources available today, including books, e-books, the internet, TV, and satellite, I can utilize these as self-study tutorials for various subjects. For example, learning English or other languages can be easily accomplished through helpful books and numerous online resources.In conclusion, the decision to learn with a teacher or on one's own depends on the situation. Both methods have their advantages and disadvantages, and I believe that each can be beneficial in different contexts. Ultimately, the key to effective learning lies in choosing the approach that best suits the subject matter and the individual's learning needs.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Working at home with a computer and a phone is better than working at a companyÕs office using the same equipment.
human: Due to the convenience of current technology, people can do their works everywhere as long as they have the equipment around them. People are no longer restricted in the office. This rapid progress in technology leads to the question whether it's better working at home with a computer and a phone than working at the company's office. In my opinion, I believe that working at home is worse and less efficient than working in the office.First of all, while working in the office, people can interact with their colleges instantly. They can either get help from colleges or discuss about the work together. Think about the big project that a group is working on, if any group member has new idea about the project, he/she can assemble his/her colleges right away and discuss. It's more efficient and straight-forward than talking in the phone. For another example, if one’s computer or Internet has any breakdown, he/she can call the MIS staff to fix.Second, working at home has many disadvantages that will no doubt lower the efficiency of works. For example, people are easily distracted while working at home. It's hard to concentrate on work if people can grab the TV remote or some junk foods right away. In addition, while people are working at home, there will be no one supervising them, thus raises the chance of loafing. Moreover, people who work at home are more likely to miss the important events happening in the office, like some announcements from the boss.In conclusion, working in the office is obviously better than working at home in terms of efficiency. It not only has the advantage of working with colleges but also it provides a real working atmosphere that can never be grasped if people choose to work at home.
llm: The advancement of modern technology has made it possible for people to work from anywhere, as long as they have the necessary equipment. This has led to a debate about whether working from home is more effective than working in a traditional office setting. In my opinion, I firmly believe that working in an office is more efficient and productive than working from home.Firstly, working in an office provides the opportunity for instant interaction with colleagues. This facilitates collaboration, discussion, and problem-solving, which are essential for successful project completion. For instance, when working on a group project, team members can quickly assemble and discuss new ideas, making the process more efficient and straightforward than communicating over the phone. Additionally, if technical issues arise, such as computer or internet problems, office staff can be readily available to provide assistance.On the other hand, working from home has several drawbacks that can significantly hinder productivity. For example, home-based work is often plagued by distractions, making it challenging to maintain focus. The ease of access to entertainment, such as television, and the temptation of junk food can easily derail work progress. Moreover, the lack of supervision at home increases the likelihood of procrastination and reduced work effort. Working from home also means missing out on important office events, including crucial announcements from management, which can leave remote workers feeling disconnected and out of the loop.In conclusion, working in an office is undoubtedly more efficient than working from home. The office environment offers the dual benefits of collaborative work opportunities and a structured, professional atmosphere that is difficult to replicate at home. This setting is conducive to higher productivity, better communication, and a stronger sense of team cohesion, ultimately leading to more successful outcomes.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? In order to succeed, you should be more like others than be different from everyone else.
human: Achieving success is everybody's goal for life and there are absolutely many different directions that can lead people to success. Some people choose to be normal to wait for chances, while some other people prefer to be different from everyone else. Which one is the promising way to succeed? In my opinion, I believe that once you are unique enough, you are already on the way to success.First, being positively different from everyone else usually means that you've achieved something that is superior than others. As living in a competent world, we are like playing a survival game. Only who has the sharpest weapon can survive. If you don't make yourself outstanding enough or you fail to distinguish yourself from others, you will be easily replaced and eliminated by someone who is better than you. Take myself for example, when I was in college, I was always chosen to be the presenter of group report because I was the only one in my group who could present the report thoroughly and fluently.Second, being unique can create your own value which can never be taken by others. In other words, once you are special and unique, pursuing success is a matter of actively creating the fashion rather than passively waiting for other people to recognize and appreciate you. Take the most popular and prestigious technology company- Apple- for example. The reason why it gains such a tremendous success is because it achieves some brilliant qualities that can never be caught up by other competitors. It has its operating systems that can run smoother than any other companies and its design always wins the popularity among consumers. It is the uniqueness of Apple design that creates its own value.In conclusion, being different and unique is the better way to achieve success. It not only shows your competence but also creates your own value, making you take the lead in your way towards success.
llm: Achieving success is a universal goal, and there are numerous paths that can lead to it. While some individuals prefer to blend in and wait for opportunities, others choose to stand out from the crowd. In my opinion, being unique is the key to unlocking success. Firstly, being distinct from others often indicates that one has achieved something exceptional. In a competitive world, it's essential to have a unique edge to survive. Those who fail to differentiate themselves can easily be replaced by someone more talented. For instance, during my college days, I was consistently chosen to present group reports because I possessed the ability to present them thoroughly and fluently, setting me apart from my peers.Secondly, being unique allows you to create your own value, which cannot be replicated by others. This means that instead of passively waiting for recognition, you can actively shape your own success. A prime example of this is Apple, one of the most successful and prestigious technology companies. Apple's tremendous success can be attributed to its exceptional qualities, such as its operating systems and designs, which cannot be matched by its competitors. The uniqueness of Apple's design has created its own value, setting it apart from others.In conclusion, embracing individuality and uniqueness is the more promising approach to achieving success. It not only showcases one's competence but also creates a unique value, enabling individuals to take the lead on their path to success. By being different and unique, one can establish a competitive edge, creating a foundation for success that is difficult to replicate.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement: Younger school children (aged five to ten) should be required to study art and music in addition to math, language, science and history.Ê
human: Undoubtedly, math, language, science and history are all extremely important subjects in student's education since these subjects provide students the basic understanding of the world. Therefore, some people assert that there is no need to learn other subjects for younger students. Nevertheless, the art and music, from my point of view, are also essential for younger student's future life because those subjects help students learn this planet from another perspective and they can release people from the enormous pressure nowadays. In this case, I would definitely agree that the art and music should be required to study.First of all, art and music would broaden student's horizon and therefore make them thoughtful. It is well known that the art and music are not bound by country border, and they are something that is shared by the people from every parts of this world and is symbols of various cultures. Under this circumstance, learning art and music enables students to appreciate the fruits of eminent artists and musicians and to feel the fascination of different cultures. For instance, students are able to feel the greatest music masterpiece in Euopren as the symphony of destiny-Beethoven's most notable workpiece is played. In addition, studying art and music is also the appropriate outlets of stress and superb ways to relax. Obviously, with the improvement of life rhythm, people have currently suffered too much pressure from their studies or jobs, and these pressure are likely to destroy one person if he cannot find a way to emancipate himself. Art and music are, of course most accessible tools for modern people to liberate themselves from the extremely stressful life. When enjoying one piece of brilliant paintings, such as the Mona Lisa, people would put all their pressure down on the ground and just think about what the most proficient and mysterious smile in this world stands for. At this moment, they would totally involve in the ocean of art and their stressful nervous would be relieved. Apparently, this sense towards art is built on the initial study on the art.Admittedly, the study of art and music is supposed to rely on younger student's own interest. The education of art and music would not work if students resist it. Thus, the school should replace some basic science class with some art and music class in order to cultivate student's interest of art without adding extra study pressure.In a nutshell, in the modern society, since understanding of the lengthen and depth of the world is important and meanwhile people have burdened excessive pressure, younger students' art and music education should not take the second place.
llm: It is undeniable that mathematics, language, science, and history are crucial subjects in a student's education, providing them with a fundamental understanding of the world. Some people argue that these subjects are sufficient for younger students, rendering other subjects unnecessary. However, from my perspective, art and music are equally essential for a younger student's future life, as they offer a unique perspective on the world and provide a much-needed respite from the immense pressure of modern life. I firmly believe that art and music should be a required part of the curriculum.Firstly, art and music broaden a student's horizons, fostering thoughtfulness and an appreciation for diverse cultures. Since art and music transcend national borders, they provide a shared experience that connects people worldwide, symbolizing various cultures. By studying art and music, students can appreciate the works of renowned artists and musicians, and experience the fascination of different cultures. For example, listening to Beethoven's iconic symphony, a masterpiece of European music, can evoke powerful emotions and a deeper understanding of the cultural context.Furthermore, studying art and music serves as an excellent outlet for stress and a superb way to relax. In today's fast-paced life, people often suffer from overwhelming pressure, which can be detrimental to their well-being if left unchecked. Art and music offer accessible tools for modern individuals to liberate themselves from stressful lives. Admiring a brilliant painting, such as the Mona Lisa, can transport people to a world of art, allowing them to momentarily forget their worries and ponder the mysteries of the artwork. This connection to art is rooted in initial exposure and study, highlighting the importance of introducing art and music education at a young age.Admittedly, the study of art and music should be driven by a student's inherent interest. Forcing art and music education can be counterproductive if students resist it. To cultivate interest without adding extra pressure, schools could consider replacing some basic science classes with art and music classes.In conclusion, in modern society, where understanding the complexities of the world is paramount, and people are burdened with excessive pressure, art and music education for younger students should not be marginalized. Instead, it should be valued as a vital component of their educational journey, providing them with a unique perspective, creative outlets, and essential tools for navigating life's challenges.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? The personal and work-related challenges that young people are facing are not different with their parents and grandparents faced when they were young.
human: While debating about generation issues, people always have different opinions. Some people believe that little things changed through generation, while others claim that generation differences are presented in every way. In my opinion, I believe that every prospective between generations alters and especially the challenges for this generation are significantly different from the last generation.First, under globalization and industrial integration, the work-related challenges for this generation are getting more complicated and challenging. The successful people are those who can quickly respond to this rapid-changing world. In the past, focusing on one skill was enough to deal with the problems because every industry was rather small in size and simple to manage. However, as those industries expand and become internationalized, people are required to equip with multiple skills to answer those challenges. For example, now there are more chances to do business with people around the world, so besides one's own profession, language ability is essential as well. For another example, financial crimes are rampant in the 21st century, thus surging up demands for those who excel at both laws and financial management. Second, this generation is encountering the self-recognition issue which could not be experienced by the previous generation. The past generation was given less freedom and was usually asked to follow the paths their parents had prepared for them. In contrast, young people in this generation are exposed to more creative ideas and rather think individually. They are eager for finding who they are and what they really want. It is fortunate that they can struggle with these sweet worries and these worries are indeed never easy for them. They have to make decisions between so many possibilities and they are responsible for taking the consequences. In conclusion, challenges for this generation are more complicated and diverse than the past generation, whether in career or in self-identification. It is hard to judge which generation's problems are more difficult but it is no doubt that until the next generation, there will be whole new challenges waiting for the next youngsters.
llm: When discussing generational issues, people often have differing opinions. Some believe that few things have changed between generations, while others argue that generational differences are evident in every aspect. In my view, I think that every perspective between generations is unique and that the challenges facing this generation are significantly different from those of the previous one.Firstly, in the era of globalization and industrial integration, the work-related challenges for this generation have become increasingly complex. To be successful, one must be able to adapt quickly to the rapidly changing world. In the past, mastering a single skill was sufficient to tackle problems, as industries were relatively small and simple to manage. However, as industries have expanded and become internationalized, individuals are now required to possess multiple skills to meet these challenges. For instance, with the increased opportunities for global business, language skills have become essential in addition to one's profession. Furthermore, the rise of financial crimes in the 21st century has created a high demand for individuals who excel in both law and financial management.Secondly, this generation is grappling with the issue of self-recognition, which was not experienced by previous generations. In the past, people were given less freedom and were often expected to follow the paths laid out by their parents. In contrast, young people in this generation are exposed to a wide range of creative ideas and are encouraged to think individually. They are eager to discover who they are and what they truly want, which is a fortunate yet challenging experience. They must navigate multiple possibilities and take responsibility for the consequences of their decisions.In conclusion, the challenges facing this generation are more complex and diverse than those of the previous generation, whether in career or self-identification. While it is difficult to judge which generation's problems are more daunting, it is clear that each new generation will face unique challenges. As we look to the future, it is inevitable that the next generation will encounter a new set of challenges, and it is up to them to adapt and thrive in an ever-changing world.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? It is better to have broad knowledge of many academic subjects than to specialize in one specific subject. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
human: Views differ considerably when it comes to the issue of whether having broad knowledge of many academic subjects is better than specializing in one specific subject. Some people believe that having a broad knowledge can give you a higher chance to success, while others think that professional in a specific subject is the key to enroll a success. Both of the opposite arguments appear to be somewhat convincing and stand to reason. As far as I am concerned, having a large scale of different knowledge is the key to success. The following will present my points.First of all, when one knows different region's works, it will help one to get a friend much easier. For example, I worked in a large company, which has many different departments. I was in the Management Information System department. What we do every day is to solve the problem that our clients asked in the phone. While some of the problems are the Engineering department's part, I went there and discussed with the colleagues there, since I have studied some of the engineering courses. It is much easier for us to contact than any other person in my department, which made me popular there, and much easier to get the help that I need.Second, when you want to translate your major, it is important to know some of the things about different fields. Take my cousin Jeff and his friend as an example. They majored in financing when they were in college. But, they decided to enroll in the art system after graduated. Thanks to Jeff's hard working during his leisure time, he learned a lot about the history of art. Things ended up that he joined in a great team, while his friend who only knew financing issues can do nothing but worked in a bank.Although I agree with the idea that knowing different fields is important. I think I still have to point out that there are some different points of view. People who hold different opinion may argue that if one can’t success one’s own major, what else things he can do in different filed. Of course, it may be true when talking about this topic. However, what if one finally find out him or her has the talent in other filed. In this way, it won’t be a problem at all.In conclusion, given the reasons described above, when the advantages and disadvantages of whether having the knowledge in different fields is better or not are carefully compared. The best choice is obviously stand on my side, which is that a broad knowledge of different subjects is really important.
llm: The debate about whether having a broad knowledge of many academic subjects is more beneficial than specializing in one specific subject has sparked intense discussion. While some people believe that specializing in a particular field is the key to success, others argue that having a wide range of knowledge increases one's chances of achieving success. Both arguments seem convincing, but in my opinion, having a broad knowledge base is the key to success. The following points will support my stance.Firstly, having knowledge of various subjects enables individuals to communicate more effectively with people from different backgrounds. For instance, during my time at a large company with multiple departments, my knowledge of engineering courses, which I had studied, allowed me to collaborate seamlessly with colleagues from the Engineering department. This, in turn, made me a popular and reliable point of contact, facilitating my work and earning me the help I needed when required.Secondly, having a broad knowledge base is crucial when transitioning between fields. My cousin Jeff and his friend, who majored in finance, are a case in point. After graduating, they decided to pursue a career in the art industry. Thanks to Jeff's efforts to learn about art history during his free time, he was able to join a prestigious team. In contrast, his friend, who only had knowledge of finance, was limited to working in a bank. This example illustrates the importance of being well-versed in multiple fields.Although I acknowledge the importance of having a broad knowledge base, I must also consider alternative perspectives. Some people may argue that if an individual cannot succeed in their own major, they are unlikely to succeed in other fields. This argument may hold some truth, but it does not account for instances where individuals discover their true talent lies in a different field. In such cases, having a broad knowledge base can be a significant advantage.In conclusion, after weighing the pros and cons of having a broad knowledge base versus specializing in one subject, it is clear that the former is the more beneficial approach. The benefits of being well-versed in multiple subjects, including enhanced communication skills and increased career flexibility, make it an essential aspect of achieving success.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Successful people try new things and take risks rather than only doing what they already know how to do well. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
human: I have my own reasons why I agree with the statement that successful people try new things and take risks. There are many viewpoints regarding what the main characteristics of successful people are. In my opinion, one of the main reasons for supporting this statement is that successful people can learn important and very valuable points from trying new things. The other reason is that great success requires taking great risks.There are always interesting and useful experiences that successful people can learn them only by trying new things. For example, if you want to know how to act effectively when communicating with people, you can try something new like salesmanship in various stores and places. By selling goods or other commodities you will face different people with different behaviors and personalities and as a result you will learn how to behave people in different situations and jobs in the future. These experiences can only be obtained by trying new things and can’t be always found in books. I do believe that great success requires taking great risks. If you want to gain very high profits in investments, you should use great and very high amounts of money in very risky financial decisions and dealings in which you may lose much amount of money. If you want to achieve a remarkable success in an important exam, you should risk studying all the time and sacrificing your free time and your favorite hobbies. The more you take risks, the greater your successes will be. If you don’t take any risks, you will have an ordinary life with average successes. That’s why it is important to take risks.In sum, I believe that success and trying new things and taking risks go hand in hand and to achieve success you should consider them.
llm: I wholeheartedly agree with the notion that successful individuals are those who venture into new experiences and take calculated risks. The characteristics that define successful people are often debated, but in my view, two key factors stand out: the ability to learn valuable lessons from trying new things and the necessity of taking bold risks to achieve greatness.By stepping out of their comfort zones, successful people can gain unique and valuable insights that may not be found in books or traditional learning settings. For instance, someone looking to improve their communication skills could try their hand at sales in various settings. This hands-on experience would expose them to diverse personalities and behaviors, allowing them to develop essential people skills that can be applied to various situations and professions in the future.Furthermore, I firmly believe that remarkable success requires a willingness to take significant risks. To reap substantial rewards, one must be prepared to invest heavily in uncertain ventures or make sacrifices, such as dedicating ample time and effort to studying for a crucial exam. The correlation between risk-taking and success is clear: the more you're willing to take risks, the greater your accomplishments will be. Playing it safe, on the other hand, can lead to a mediocre existence with average achievements. Therefore, embracing risk and trying new things is essential for achieving success.In conclusion, I firmly believe that success is inextricably linked to trying new things and taking risks. To attain success, it's crucial to adopt this mindset and be open to new experiences and challenges.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? For success in a future job, the ability to relate well to people is more important than studying hard in school. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
human: I think that No factor is important enough by itself to succeed in any situations. We should consider many factors and choose the best of them. I believe that both the ability to relate well to people and studying hard in school are important for success in a future job for following reasons:We need to know and learn about the theoritical basis of our future job. This can be done in school. In school, we are able to identify skills required for our future job and work on mastering and learning them. If we study them hard, we will have the chance of doing our job better and quicker in the future. For example, if someone wants to become a good industrial engineer, he should study his technical courses very well so that he will be able to utilize them well in his future job. As you can see, studying hard in school is an important factor to succeed in a job.One of the other factors for success in a future job is effective commuincation. By relating well to people, we are likely to have a lot of friends and therefore we will have a wide network of communication. Commuincation can bring many benefits. For example, if you need help with getting a job, by commuincating with people offering jobs whom you treat well and therefore they respect you as well, you can achieve your goal. Or, if you are a salesman in a store or any other place, by relating well to your customers, you will increase the chance of their coming back again and becoming your regular customers. So, relating well to people is also another important factor. In sum, though some people may disagree with me, as I explained my reasons and examples above, none of those factors are important and sufficient enough by themselves and we should notice to both of them because each of them has its own benefits.
llm: Firstly, acquiring a deep understanding of the theoretical foundations of our future profession is vital, and this can be achieved through schooling. In school, we have the opportunity to identify the skills required for our future career and work towards mastering them. By studying hard, we increase our chances of performing our job more efficiently and effectively in the future. For instance, an aspiring industrial engineer must thoroughly study their technical courses to apply them effectively in their future role. As evident, diligent academic effort is a critical factor for job success.Another significant factor for success in a future job is effective communication. By relating well to people, we are likely to build a wide network of connections. This, in turn, can yield numerous benefits. For example, when seeking a job, communicating with potential employers who respect us can significantly aid in achieving our career goals. Similarly, as a salesman, building strong relationships with customers can increase the likelihood of them becoming repeat customers. Thus, connecting well with people is also a vital factor.In conclusion, while some may disagree, the reasons and examples I've provided underscore the importance of considering both factors. Neither is independently sufficient, and each has its unique benefits. Therefore, it's essential to focus on both to maximize our chances of success in our future careers.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? The advertising is the main cause of unhealthy eating habits.
human: Advertising is becoming part of our modern society. They penetrate into people's life, affecting people's choices in different things. Therefore, it comes to the debate whether advertising has positive influences on people's life. Some people say that advertising must be blamed for the unhealthy eating habits, while others believe that there are still some other factors directing people's judgments. In my opinion, the advertising is not the main cause of unhealthy eating habits.First of all, advertising is not entirely decisive on personal eating habit. The key to forming a healthy eating pattern lies in people's concept of wholesome diets and self-control. It is sure that advertising always makes the products so tempting, regardless of whether they might bring negative effects on the human body. However, advertising is not the only information source for people. People can still acquire different viewpoints about foods from other sources, like news or magazines. As long as people are clear about how to maintain a healthy body and they persistently keep track of their eating habits, they can successfully prevent themselves from those temptations. It will be not persuasive if people just blame the advertising sector of a fast-food company for making them so fat and not reassess their own behaviors. Second, in the era when people are becoming conscious of a healthier lifestyle, some companies are actually aiming at this rising trend and start to promote healthy foods. In other words, advertising may even bring healthier eating habits to the people. Think about the recently popular organic foods that are claimed to grow in an environment without pesticide and those crude foods in which less salt or less sugar are added. These are the main traits that advertising is hitting on and the overall results are good. In these cases, the advertising industry bolsters people's awareness of having a healthy lifestyle. In conclusion, advertising is not the primary reason of unhealthy eating habits. There are the build-up of the concept about healthy eating habits and self-control that really matter. Besides, advertising might lead to healthier eating customs due to the growing awareness of living under a better lifestyle. It is inevitable to be exposed to the environment full of advertisements but it does not mean that our right to choose is taken away. We will always be able to decide our own lifestyles.
llm: The presence of advertising in our modern society is undeniable, as it permeates every aspect of our lives and influences our decisions on various matters. This raises the question of whether advertising has a positive impact on our lives, particularly when it comes to eating habits. While some argue that advertising is to blame for unhealthy eating habits, others contend that there are other factors at play. In my opinion, advertising is not the primary cause of unhealthy eating habits.Firstly, advertising is not the sole determining factor in shaping our eating habits. The key to developing healthy eating patterns lies in our understanding of wholesome diets and our ability to exercise self-control. Although advertising can make products appear tempting, regardless of their potential negative effects on our health, it is not the only source of information we have access to. We can acquire diverse viewpoints on food from other sources, such as news articles or magazines. As long as we are informed about how to maintain a healthy body and remain mindful of our eating habits, we can resist the temptations presented by advertising. It is unconvincing to place blame solely on the advertising sector of a fast-food company for our weight issues without reassessing our own behaviors.Secondly, in an era where people are becoming increasingly conscious of the importance of a healthy lifestyle, some companies are responding to this trend by promoting healthy foods. In other words, advertising can actually contribute to healthier eating habits. Consider the recent popularity of organic foods, which are grown without pesticides, and foods with reduced salt or sugar content. These are the key traits that advertising is highlighting, and the overall results are positive. In these cases, the advertising industry is promoting people's awareness of healthy lifestyle choices.In conclusion, advertising is not the primary reason for unhealthy eating habits. Rather, it is our understanding of healthy eating habits and our ability to exercise self-control that truly matter. Furthermore, advertising may even lead to healthier eating customs due to the growing awareness of the importance of living a healthy lifestyle. While it is inevitable that we will be exposed to an environment filled with advertisements, this does not mean that our autonomy to make choices is taken away. We will always have the ability to decide our own lifestyles.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? television has destroyed communication among friends and family. Use specific reasons and examples to support your opinion.
human: Nowdays there are different resources to entertain, educate and inform people. One of this resource is television; however television has some negative effects among some people. Therefore, I agree that Television has destroyed communication among friends and family. Some People spend a lot of time watching television, others even eat watching television, and some others make of this media a priority.First of all, some people spend a lot of time watching television. Sometimes his wife wants to talk before they go to work, but he only let her talk during commercials. So, she is used to his habit that she prefers to write him an email. Time with the family is gold, some people have to realize that and take quality of time to talk to them.Another way television has destroyed communication is when some people cannot even seat at the table and have dinner with the family. This is the time, when if they have children, they can share everything about school, a project and even concerns. Also, when there is a dinner with friends, some people do not have a fluid conversation because the television is again in between them. When family or friends gather together to have a good time eating and talking, this is not the reality in some cases.Finally, some people make the television a priority. I remember a friend told me one day that because she was watching a telenovela I could not go to her house a certain time during the night. Honestly, I was in shock! How she could say that to me?. As I have said, television is a great tool to learn, entertain and inform what is happening, but I agree that television has destroyed communication among friends and family as soon as television become a priority, spend a lot of time watching it and eat in front of the television.
llm: In today's world, there are numerous resources available for entertainment, education, and information. One such resource is television, but unfortunately, it has several negative effects on certain individuals. I firmly believe that television has hindered communication among friends and family. Many people spend excessive time watching TV, some even eat while watching, and others prioritize it over social interactions.Firstly, some individuals devote a significant amount of time to watching television, often at the expense of spending time with loved ones. I know someone who starts their day by watching TV, even before eating breakfast, and records programs to watch later, including during work hours. His wife has grown accustomed to his habits and now prefers to communicate with him via email, as he only allows her to talk during commercial breaks. It's essential for people to realize the value of quality time with family and make an effort to engage in meaningful conversations.Another way television has eroded communication is when people cannot even be bothered to have dinner with their family. This is a crucial time for sharing experiences, discussing school projects, and addressing concerns, especially if there are children involved. Similarly, when friends gather for dinner, the presence of television can hinder fluid conversations. Unfortunately, this is the reality in many cases, where family and friends gather to spend quality time together, but the TV takes center stage.Lastly, some people make television a priority, often at the expense of social relationships. I recall a friend telling me that I couldn't visit her at a certain time because she was watching a favorite show. I was taken aback by her response, as it highlighted the excessive importance she placed on television.In conclusion, while television is a valuable tool for learning, entertainment, and staying informed, I agree that it has destroyed communication among friends and family when it becomes a priority, consumes excessive time, or is used as a substitute for human interaction. It's essential to strike a balance between TV time and social interactions to maintain healthy relationships.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the folowing statement? At universities and colleges, sports and social activities are just as important as classes and libraries and should receive equal financial support
human: University students can be divided into two groups, one group with less interest to study and the other which include hard working students. Usually the second group's members do not have enough time to do exercise. We all know doing exercise for at least 30 minutes form the basis of the healthy and happy life. But I don't think that equal amount of money should be spent on academic issues like libraries and laboratories and physical or social activities.First, in my view spending too much money for equipping the gyms or constructing football/basketball courts are really not necessary to encourage students to do sports. For example, my roommate, Mary, always wakes up 6 in the morning and spends 1 hour doing sport in the park which is near our dormitory. When she gets to the dorm, she is really full of energy and after taking a shower, she is ready to start a good day. As you see, she is doing exercise without spending a cent. What the university should do is informing the students the benefits of doing sport by hanging some posters in the campus, inviting some athletes to lecture for students and encourage them to spend some time for their body and health.In addition, students choose their major based on their interests. The university should provide the best equipment needed for physical education students. Because their major in completely involved in physical activities. In contrast, for an engineer or a medicine student I do not find it fair enough to equip gyms instead of their laboratories, because it really make the students enthusiastic to use innovative technology to learn and maybe find new things in their field.Finally, spending money on social activities looks like wasting money. For students who want to gather with their friends or want to go out to meet new people, university programs are the last place they would choose. For example when I and my friends want to spend time with each other, we prefer to go out of university to the places where we do not want to be disturbed by any familiar people. In conclusion, I do not deny the importance of doing sports in the success of university students, but I think both sports and social activities should not receive equal amount of money with libraries and laboratories.
llm: University students can be broadly categorized into two groups: those with limited interest in academics and hardworking students who often have little time for exercise. As we all know, regular exercise, ideally for at least 30 minutes, is essential for a healthy and happy life. However, I believe that the allocation of funds should prioritize academic resources over physical and social activities.In my opinion, investing heavily in gym equipment or sports facilities is not necessary to encourage students to engage in physical activity. For instance, my roommate Mary wakes up at 6 am every day to exercise in the nearby park, and she does so without incurring any costs. Instead, the university could promote the benefits of exercise by posting informative posters around campus, inviting athletes to give lectures, and encouraging students to dedicate time to their physical well-being.Furthermore, students choose their majors based on their interests, and the university should provide the necessary equipment for physical education students, as their field of study is directly related to physical activities. In contrast, for students pursuing engineering or medicine, it would be more beneficial to allocate funds to laboratories rather than gyms, as this would allow them to utilize innovative technology and potentially make groundbreaking discoveries in their field.Additionally, I believe that spending money on social activities is a waste of resources. Students who want to socialize with friends or meet new people tend to prefer off-campus locations where they can interact without being disturbed by familiar faces. For example, when my friends and I want to spend time together, we opt to go off-campus to places where we can enjoy each other's company without interruptions.In conclusion, while I acknowledge the importance of physical activity in the success of university students, I think that sports and social activities should not receive equal funding to libraries and laboratories. The university's priorities should focus on providing top-notch academic resources to support students' intellectual and professional growth.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? For success in a future job, the ability to relate well to people is more important than studying hard in school.
human: To agree or disagree the statement that as far as getting a successful job in the future concerned, good ability of relating to people is more crucial than studying hard in the univeirsity is a matter of balancing its pros and cons. However, if one coniders the issue carefully, he or she may agree the title statement as I do.First of all, friends is a treasure with respect to either our daylife or our career. Relating well to people can bring plenty of merits to future job. Having a good ability of relate to people means you have a number of friends in a variety of fields, imagine when you are in trouble, you have a lot of people who have good relationship with you, so you can ask for your friends to help you solve this problem as soon as possible, even an esy phone call, instend of a series of complex solutions.Futuermore, no matter who you are a top-level managers of a company or a low-level employee of that company, relating well to people is also a importent issue. If top-level managers want to make a project successful, have a good relationship with their subordinaries is the prerequisit for the managers' work complete successfully, managers should listen to their employees needs and complaints about this job, pay much patiant and care to them. Consequently, make a good relationship with them.On the other side, if a low-level employee desire to enhance his position, it's fairly important to have a good relationship with their boss, only if the employee is considered excellent in his boss's eyes, he will be more possible to enhance position.However, someone may maintain that good specify knowledge is more crucial for future job. Studying harder in school, getting a good resume and absorbing lots of working knowledge, which can make these graduates more competitive than other applicants in one certain job. But imagine it, a person who is good at working knowledge but has an poorly relate to people, and a person who has a good ability of relating to people but his working knowledge is less better than the former, which person do you want to be? I think majority of people would choose the former because it has more chance than the latter in terms of getting good jobs in the future.In my point of view, I do really prefer to improve my ability of relating people and make more friends rather than studying hard in school.
llm: The debate about whether having good people skills is more important than academic achievement for securing a successful job in the future is a matter of weighing the pros and cons. However, after careful consideration, I agree with the statement that good people skills are more crucial, and I will explain why.Firstly, friends are a valuable asset in both our personal and professional lives. The ability to relate well to people can bring numerous benefits in the job market. Having a strong network of friends across various fields means that when you encounter problems, you have a multitude of people who can offer assistance, often with just a simple phone call, rather than resorting to complex solutions.Furthermore, regardless of your position within a company, be it a top-level manager or a junior employee, relating well to people is essential. For managers, a good relationship with their subordinates is a prerequisite for the successful completion of projects.
