They must listen to their employees' needs and complaints, show patience, and care for them, which in turn fosters a positive working relationship. Similarly, for employees aiming to advance their careers, having a good relationship with their superiors is crucial, as it increases their chances of being recognized as excellent performers and subsequently promoted.On the other hand, some might argue that specialized knowledge is more critical for future job prospects. Studying diligently, acquiring a good resume, and absorbing extensive work knowledge can indeed make graduates more competitive in the job market. However, consider two individuals: one excels in work knowledge but lacks people skills, and another has excellent people skills but is less proficient in work knowledge. Who would you rather be? I believe most people would choose the former, as they perceive it offers better job prospects.In my opinion, I prioritize improving my people skills and expanding my social network over merely studying hard. While academic achievement is valuable, the ability to relate and connect with others opens more doors and provides a stronger foundation for success in both personal and professional contexts. Therefore, I firmly believe that good people skills are more crucial than academic rigor alone for achieving a successful job in the future.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? As modern life becomes more complex, it is essential for young people to have the ability to plan and organize
human: With the fast rolling wheels of modern society, life becomes more complex and is not easy to handle than in the past. Therefore, it is essential for people, especially young ones, to possess the ability to plan and organize since it can improve the efficiency and reduce the crisis of our actions. Meanwhile, eliminating meaningless actions.First of all, great planning and organizing ability is able to cause our actions more efficient and productive. Take myself as an example, I used to be overwhelmed by the burden of preparing for the final exam, submitting my paper, and finishing my internship work at the end of each term. Yet, in this year, following the suggestion of my roommate, John, I make a to-do list to plan and organize perfectly everything I should get done in the final and hence take every tasks and trivials into control. This plan ability helps me a lot, making me climb to the top rank of the class while finishing everything else.Equally important, the capacity to plan and organize also help young people to eliminate the crisis in their actions, which may ruin one's whole effort over a very long time. As we all know, the employees in every company have to create profit as much as they can for their supervisors and complete their assignments perfectly. If some employees lack the ability to plan and organize ahead, they may get the procrastination and therefore take into action until the deadline is imminent. However, things have been changing all the time. For instance, the deadline of task is shifted to an earlier date for the change of company's schedule. In this case, those employees who did not plan and finish their assignments ahead of time perhaps are unable to finish these tasks on time and therefore will be penalized or get fired. Every employee can not afford this kind of loss.Finally, some assert that the ability to plan and organize can be learned until obtaining a job. Thus, it is not need for young people to possess this ability. Nevertheless, this ability is also essential for young people since young people can overcome their bad habits and fulfill their goals more quickly with this ability. As searching information on the internet, young people are probably distracted by other attractions such as online games or social webs. At this circumstances, they would surf on the internet for hours and end up no where. It is obviously a huge waste of time. But if they make their plan in the first place, and then stick to their plans, they could get their work done quickly beyond their imagination.In this complex society, we, young people, are encompassed with multiple tasks, so the ability to plan and organize is undoubtedly a powerful and sharp weapon that we must be armed with.
llm: In today's fast-paced world, life has become increasingly complex, making it more challenging to manage than in the past. As a result, it's crucial for individuals, especially young people, to develop the skill of planning and organization. This ability can significantly enhance the efficiency of our actions, reduce crises, and eliminate unnecessary tasks.Firstly, possessing excellent planning and organizing skills can make our actions more efficient and productive. For instance, I used to feel overwhelmed by the pressure of preparing for final exams, submitting papers, and completing internship work at the end of each term. However, this year, I took my roommate John's advice and created a to-do list to plan and organize everything I needed to accomplish. This planning ability has been incredibly helpful, enabling me to excel in my class and complete all my tasks.Equally important, the capacity to plan and organize helps young people avoid crises that can undermine their efforts over a long period. Employees in companies, for example, are expected to generate profits and complete assignments perfectly. Those who lack planning and organization skills may procrastinate and only take action when deadlines are imminent. However, circumstances can change rapidly, such as when a company's schedule is altered, and deadlines are moved forward. In such cases, employees who haven't planned ahead may struggle to complete tasks on time, leading to penalties or even termination. No employee can afford such losses.Some may argue that the ability to plan and organize can be acquired after entering the workforce, and therefore, it's not essential for young people to possess this skill. Nevertheless, this ability is vital for young individuals as it enables them to overcome bad habits and achieve their goals more quickly. For instance, when researching online, young people can easily get distracted by online games, social media, or other attractions, leading to hours of unproductive surfing. However, by creating a plan and sticking to it, they can complete their work efficiently and effectively, often exceeding their expectations.In conclusion, in this complex society, young people are faced with multiple tasks, making the ability to plan and organize an indispensable and powerful tool. It's essential for young individuals to arm themselves with this skill to navigate the challenges of modern life successfully. By doing so, they can enhance their productivity, avoid crises, and achieve their goals more efficiently.

question: Some people believe that university students should be required to attend classes. Others believe that going to classes should be optional for students. Which point of view do you agree with? Use specific reasons and details to explain your answer.
human: Nowadays, it is often claimed that attending classes has a lot of benefits for students and provide them with a variety of learning opportunities (options) as well. On the contrary to this popular belief, there are still those who subscribe to this view that having a choice for attending classes enable students to study at home and through this way they do not waste their time for commuting and also they can save their money. However, I am inclined to believe that being present at classes seems a wiser option.First and foremost, I truly believe that being present at classes provide students with opportunity of communicating with other students that is beneficial for understanding new material by reviewing them throughout the free times in college. Also, they can help each other for learning materials better. However, if they do not attend classes they cannot use the help of others for assisting them to comprehend difficult problems. Another significant fact which should be taken into consideration is that by the help of teachers, students can understand ideas faster and easier since teachers explain them thoroughly in the class and after that give them a lot of examples to clarify the points. In this way attending classes not only wastes their time but also facilitates their understanding process that takes them less time for comprehending materials in comparison with self-study. Finally yet importantly, appearing in class makes students more conscientious since they have to obey class’s disciplines and they practice to be more perseverance in the process of doing their assignments. However, the ones who choose to study at home do not have any discipline for their studies and cannot force themselves to study in particular times. Through this way, they may miss some important parts in virtue of the chaotic and incoherent study. On the basis of the points mentioned above, I convinced that communicating and studying with peer group is a good way for learning materials. Moreover, teachers have a conspicuous role in assisting students for learning materials that being present at classes is a requisite for benefiting it. Also, attending to classes makes students more attentive and have them to do their studies on time that this attitude lead them to success.
llm: The idea that attending classes is beneficial for students and provides them with numerous learning opportunities is a commonly held notion. However, there are those who argue that having the option to attend classes allows students to study from home, saving them time and money that would be spent on commuting. Despite this, I firmly believe that attending classes is the wiser choice.Primarily, being present in classes offers students the chance to interact with their peers, which is invaluable for grasping new material. Through discussions and reviews during free time in college, students can better understand the learning materials and assist each other in overcoming challenging concepts. This collaborative learning experience is lost when students opt to study from home, depriving them of the opportunity to seek help from others when faced with difficult problems.Another crucial point to consider is the role of teachers in facilitating learning. Teachers explain concepts thoroughly in class, supplementing their explanations with examples to clarify key points. This not only makes learning easier and faster but also optimizes the study process, reducing the time required to comprehend materials compared to self-study. Thus, attending classes is not a waste of time but rather a catalyst for understanding.Lastly, attending classes instills discipline in students. By adhering to class schedules and disciplines, students practice perseverance in completing assignments. In contrast, those who study from home often lack the structure and discipline needed to maintain a coherent and timely study schedule. This can lead to missed important concepts due to disorganized study habits.Based on the aforementioned points, I am convinced that learning within a peer group setting, facilitated by teachers, is an effective way to absorb learning materials. Moreover, the presence of teachers is pivotal in assisting students, making class attendance a necessity for benefiting from their guidance. Regular class attendance also fosters attentiveness and punctuality in studies, attitudes that are essential for achieving success.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Telephones and email have made communication between people less personal. Use specific reasons and examples to support your opinion.
human: There are many advantage of these invention, telephones and email. Communication between people by using telephones and email made my life easier. I personally disagree with this notion that these types of communication, telephones and email, made people less personal. I will give several reasons to support my opinion.To begin with, telephones and email help people, who live far away from other people, to connect each other. Unlike email, send message by using mail service could be lost and could be sent to wrong address. I can using telephones and email to talk or write directly to people I want to connect with. For example, right now, I am in the U.S. It is not possible to have conversation in person with my parents, who live in my country. Consequently, I can make a phone call or write email to my parents whenever I want. Telephones and email made me feel close to my parents.Second, using telephones and email could express some important words better than face-to-face communication. For instant, sometime when I argue with my friends, I cannot express my self to my friends at that moment. So, when I have a time to realize what had happened, I could explain the real thought that I want to express without emotion. Thus, these types of communications make me feel personal.Telephones and email make me feel personal because I could directly connect with people that I love. Beside, I could express my personal thought through telephones and email. As a result, I believe that telephones and email do not make communication between people less personal.
llm: The advent of telephones and email has numerous advantages, making communication between individuals significantly easier. In my opinion, these inventions have not made people less personal, as some may suggest. Instead, I firmly believe that they have improved the way we connect with each other. Here are several reasons that support my viewpoint.Firstly, telephones and email have bridged the gap between people who live far apart, enabling them to stay in touch effortlessly. Unlike traditional mail services, which can be unreliable and prone to errors, telephones and email allow for direct and instant communication. For instance, currently residing in the U.S., I can easily keep in touch with my parents who live in my home country. With just a phone call or an email, I can connect with them whenever I want, making me feel closer to them despite the physical distance.Secondly, telephones and email can sometimes be more effective than face-to-face communication, especially when it comes to expressing important or sensitive thoughts. For example, during an argument with friends, I may not be able to articulate my thoughts clearly in the heat of the moment. However, after taking time to reflect, I can use telephones or email to convey my genuine thoughts and feelings without being influenced by emotions. This aspect of telephones and email makes me feel more personal and heard.The ability to directly connect with loved ones and express personal thoughts through these mediums is what makes telephones and email so valuable to me. They have not diminished the personal aspect of communication; rather, they have enhanced it by providing more avenues for expression and connection. Therefore, I strongly disagree with the notion that telephones and email have made communication less personal. On the contrary, they have made it possible for me to feel more connected and understood, even across distances.

question: Some people prefer to live in a small town. Others prefer to live in big city. Which place would you prefer to live in? Use specific examples to support your answer.Ê
human: I highly prefer living in a big city to living in countryside. The big cities have lots of advantages and facilities over the small towns. Where a person lives and grow up is very important to his future life, because the environment that a person grow up, build the personality and his/her culture.There are lots of social places in big cities like restaurants, museums, bars, sporting clubs, cinemas, theatre and etc. People in big cities have many options to enjoy their life and spend their times with their friends in social places in contrary to people living in small towns who have few choices and at most cases one bar or one cinema to socialize with their friends.In big cities educational facilities is quite better than small towns with more experienced and profession teachers. It’s undisputed that in this modern world education has a very important role in the human kind future life. Better education results better career and been well paid. So persons in big cities have more chance to get the better job than people living in small towns. Also lots of companies placed in big cities and there are more job positions in there than small towns.But by living in big cities one sacrifices quiet and peaceful life with breathing fresh air and loses much time in traffic and anyway for transportation, because distances in big cities often are too far to pass quickly. Every technology has it’s good and bad effects but I prefer having the technologies with their disadvantages to living like 16 century without any of modern facilities of technology. In addition to what mentioned, medical technologies is completely better in big cities and in my view this profit overcomes all the bad influences of technologies on human kind.In conclusion, in my view living in big cities is quite funnier and better and more exciting than living in small towns because of many more social places, technologies facilities, better education and medical services.
llm: I strongly prefer living in a large city over residing in the countryside. Big cities offer numerous advantages and facilities that surpass those found in small towns. The environment in which a person grows up plays a significant role in shaping their future, as it influences their personality and cultural development.Big cities boast a wide range of social venues, including restaurants, museums, bars, sports clubs, cinemas, theaters, and more. This provides city dwellers with ample opportunities to enjoy their lives and socialize with friends, unlike those living in small towns who have limited options. In small towns, socializing is often restricted to a single bar or cinema.In terms of education, big cities have a significant edge over small towns, with more experienced and professional teachers. It is undisputable that education plays a vital role in shaping an individual's future, and better education leads to better career prospects and higher pay. Consequently, individuals living in big cities have a greater chance of securing better jobs compared to those residing in small towns. Furthermore, many companies are based in big cities, resulting in a higher number of job opportunities.However, living in a big city comes with its drawbacks, including the sacrifice of a quiet and peaceful life, fresh air, and the loss of time due to traffic and transportation, as distances in big cities can be substantial. While every technology has its benefits and drawbacks, I prefer to have access to modern facilities and technologies, despite their disadvantages, rather than living without them.In addition to the previously mentioned advantages, medical technology is also far superior in big cities. In my opinion, the benefits of medical technology outweigh the negative impacts of technology on human life.In conclusion, I firmly believe that living in a big city is more enjoyable, exciting, and beneficial than living in a small town, due to the numerous social venues, technological facilities, superior education, and medical services.

question: Some people like to do only what they already do well. Other people prefer to try new things and take risks. Which do you prefer? Use specific reasons and examples to support your choice.
human: You may love to try new things and take risks even if you aren't good at the things. That may help you expand experiences, look for your personalities and find your new talents. This ideal, however, doesn't necessarily be accomplished. If not, you might lose another chance that you could use to accomplish other things. So, I definitely believe that you should focus on what you are good at.Focusing what you are good at helps you attain your goal. Without doubt, the more time you spend on what you do well, the more likely to achieve something great you will be. For instance, Albert Einstein, one of the most competent physicians in history, devoted most of his life to develop theory in physics and finally established special and general relativity. Instead, he hardly cared about something else. It is said that, surprisingly, he never tried to distinguish a hand soup and a facial soup because, at least for him, using two different soups properly was quite annoying. As the example above indicates, you will be more likely to accomplish your purpose by concentrating on what you do well.If you keep doing what you already do well, you can be better good at it. When you're doing something well, you will feel more satisfied and more interested in it. Then, you will motivate yourself to do more. To give an example, I used to be good at math when I was in junior high school. Because I was really satisfied with the fact that I could do preferably, I became to absorb myself to try more advanced level of math problems. As a result, I could not only get higher scores in math test but also solve the university-level problems. Thus, by doing what you are good at, you will be better at it.In summary, doing what you can already do well helps you make a big accomplishment and do it much better.
llm: It's natural to want to try new things and take risks, even if you're not naturally talented at them. Exploring new experiences and discovering new passions can be beneficial, as it can help you grow as a person and uncover hidden talents. However, this approach may not always yield the desired results, and you may end up missing out on opportunities to excel in areas where you have a natural advantage. For this reason, I firmly believe that focusing on your strengths is the key to achieving success.Concentrating on what you're good at allows you to make progress towards your goals. The more time you invest in your areas of strength, the more likely you are to achieve something remarkable. Take, for example, Albert Einstein, one of the most accomplished physicists in history. He dedicated his life to developing theories in physics, ultimately establishing the groundbreaking concepts of special and general relativity. Notably, he was so focused on his work that he didn't bother with other pursuits, including even the simplest tasks, like distinguishing between different types of soup. This example illustrates the importance of focusing on your strengths in order to achieve your objectives.When you continue to work on what you're already good at, you'll naturally become even better at it. As you experience success and satisfaction, you'll become more engaged and motivated to push yourself further. For instance, I was proficient in math during my junior high school years. My confidence and enjoyment of math encouraged me to tackle more advanced problems, which ultimately enabled me to achieve higher scores on math tests and even solve university-level problems. Therefore, by building on your existing strengths, you'll not only make significant progress but also improve your skills.In conclusion, doing what you're already good at can lead to significant accomplishments and enhanced performance. By focusing on your strengths, you'll be more likely to achieve your goals and make meaningful progress, rather than spreading yourself too thin by trying to master new areas.

question: In order to become financially responsible adults, children should learn to manage their own money at a young age. Do you agree or disagree with the following statement?
human: One of the best characteristics of a mature adult is responsibility, specially in financially matters. Actually what is the best way to learn responsibility? many people argue about learning their children the financial responsibility in young ages or in adulthood. I am a kind of person who believes to children should learn to manage their own money at a young age, due to reasons that I stated below.The first important point that I want to make is that sociologists found that our characteristics and personality forms early in life, even though when we are not borne. So it is crucial to learn our children as soon as possible to learn financially issues. To clarify my point I would like to say a memory from my childhood, when I was at age 7 my father gave me monthly money to buy thing that I liked. First time I spend the whole money to eat at school and my money finished. I asked my father for extra money, but he refuse to give it to me. I found that I should manage the way that I spend money. From then I learned to be economical and now I have every thing I wanted.Another aspect of learning children to manage their money is on the finance of the family. If parents get the children all they wanted, they would be run out of their money for their essential needs. Even in rich families if children did not learn to manage their own money, when they grow up they will become unappreciative and dependent persons who want to just used their parents prosperity. As a case in point, I had a friend to had a rich and prosperous family, his parent gave him everything he demanded from his childhood. He became an arrogant person who could not stand on his feet and always asked for money. His parent tried a lot and hired some experts to learn him manage his financial and carrier life, but unfortunately it was useless. Finally one night, having fun with his irresponsible friend in his luxuries car, he crashed a truck and died. Not only did he cause lots of damage to the society property, but also bring sorry to his family.Although some people argue that children should be free to spend money to they what they want, In my opinion it is very important to learn our children from their beginning of their life to be financially responsible persons, because our personality form in childhood and it is not easy to change it in adulthood.
llm: One of the key characteristics of a mature adult is responsibility, particularly when it comes to financial matters. The question of how to learn responsibility is a topic of debate, with many people arguing over whether children should be taught financial responsibility from a young age or when they reach adulthood. I firmly believe that children should learn to manage their own money from a young age, and I'd like to outline the reasons why.First and foremost, research by sociologists has shown that our characteristics and personality traits are formed early in life. It is essential to teach children about financial issues as soon as possible. I recall a personal experience from my childhood that illustrates this point. When I was 7 years old, my father gave me a monthly allowance to spend on things I liked. The first time, I spent the entire amount on food at school and quickly ran out of money. When I asked my father for extra funds, he refused, teaching me the importance of managing my expenses. From then on, I learned to be economical and have been able to achieve my goals.Another significant aspect of teaching children to manage their finances is the impact on family finances. If parents provide their children with everything they want, they risk depleting their own savings and compromising their essential needs. Even in wealthy families, failing to teach children to manage their own money can lead to them becoming unappreciative and dependent individuals who rely solely on their parents' prosperity. A friend of mine, from a rich and prosperous family, is a case in point. His parents gave him everything he demanded from a young age, and as a result, he grew up to be an arrogant person who couldn't stand on his own feet and constantly asked for money. Despite his parents' efforts to teach him financial management and career skills, it was too late, and unfortunately, he met a tragic end. One night, while driving recklessly with friends, he crashed into a truck and lost his life. The incident not only caused significant damage to public property but also brought sorrow to his family.Although some argue that children should be free to spend their money as they please, I strongly believe that it is crucial to teach children financial responsibility from a young age. Our personality traits are formed in childhood, and it is challenging to change them in adulthood. By teaching children the value of money and how to manage it responsibly, we can help them develop into mature, financially responsible adults who can achieve their goals and make a positive contribution to society.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Dancing plays an important role in a culture. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
human: In every country, people do dance for fun, for entertrain, and for decrease a stress. Dancing is also one of important parts of culture that represent to something that people believe. Many cultures do dance to show a great prosperous of its culture. And also dancing to entertain people. I will give reasons to support my opinion.First, dancing are significant part of culture that could show to something that people believe. For example, some culture people believe that they dance in order to sacrifice to their god so they will be get a happy life. Or some part of the world that are in arid area believe that if they danced, the rain would come. Consequently, dancing are the part of people belief.Secondly, dancing can represent to civilization of that culture. For instance, I have seen many western movies that when a kingdom have visitor from another kingdom, king or queen would dance to show a splendid of their kingdom culture. The way of movement, the way that they costume and also a music while they dance. All this is a civilization of their culture.Thirdly, many culture, people have many ways to entertain themselves. And dancing is one of that ways. Both people who see and dance also have a good time. For example, many event, such as christmas, last christmas I went to mall to buy gifts, and I was entertained by group of people in santa custom dancing in christmas song. I felt that people around me happy and group of santas also happy to see people happy.In conclusion, I strongly agree with notion that dancing is an important part of culture because dancing are represent to believe of people. Besides, dancing could show how civilization of that culture is. Moreover, people use dancing to entertain themselves. So dancing is important in every culture.
llm: Dancing is a universal activity that brings people joy, entertainment, and stress relief in every country. It is also a vital part of cultural heritage, reflecting the values and beliefs of a community. Many cultures use dance to showcase their prosperity and entertain others. In this essay, I will provide reasons to support the importance of dance in culture.Firstly, dance is a significant aspect of culture that represents people's beliefs and values. For instance, some cultures believe that dancing is a way to sacrifice to their gods, ensuring a happy life. In arid regions, people believe that dancing can bring rain. Therefore, dance is an integral part of people's beliefs and superstitions.Secondly, dance can represent the civilization and sophistication of a culture. For example, in Western movies, royalty often dance to showcase the splendor of their kingdom's culture. The movements, costumes, and music all reflect the civilization and refinement of their culture.Thirdly, dance is a popular form of entertainment in many cultures. Both the dancers and the audience have a great time, enjoying the music, costumes, and energy of the performance. For example, during Christmas, I visited a mall and was entertained by a group of people dressed as Santas, dancing to Christmas songs. The atmosphere was joyful, with both the performers and the spectators feeling happy and festive.In conclusion, I strongly agree that dance is a crucial part of culture, as it represents people's beliefs, showcases a culture's civilization, and provides entertainment. Therefore, dance is essential in every culture, bringing people together and promoting joy, unity, and celebration.

question: Do you agree or disagree with following statement? It is more important for students to understand ideas and concepts than it is for them to learn facts.
human: There are many debates regarding whether understanding ideas and concepts is more essential than learning facts for students or not. Although multitudes of people think that knowledge of ideas and concepts is more vital for students, I am in the conviction that learning facts has more subsequent advantages for students' future lives. In the following, I will state my reasons for this choice.First, when students learn facts more in school, they would be ready for facing problems in their own life after their graduations. As a case in point, more information about facts would make students more familiar with the real life other that only their concepts. As a result, they would prepare to encounter their life out of school to solve their problems better. Second, it would improve students' social behavior. If students only rely on concepts and ideas theorically, they would not realize human's mind very well. They should understand objects more that concepts to obtain the ability of analyzing matters well. Thus, if they deal more with facts, they can realize social situations effectively and so improve their social communication in everyday life. Moreover, these way students are teached to control their fears and concerns in facing facts. As a matter of fact, when a student understands a fact and its consequences, he or she can encounter it more confidently. In my viewpoint, concerns and anxieties are very destructive in everybody's life. It can prevent person to progress and thrive in every position. All in all, I am in the belief that learning facts is more beneficial for students in both social and individual life in the view of above-mentioned reasons. Students would improve their social positions and encounter their problems in positive ways and also intend in the more confidence manner and etc.
llm: The debate about whether understanding ideas and concepts is more crucial than learning facts for students has sparked intense discussion. While many people argue that knowledge of ideas and concepts is more vital, I firmly believe that acquiring factual knowledge has more significant advantages for students' future lives. In this essay, I will outline my reasons for this stance.Firstly, when students focus on learning facts in school, they will be better equipped to handle real-life problems after graduation. For instance, having more information about facts enables students to become more acquainted with the practical aspects of life, beyond just theoretical concepts. As a result, they will be more prepared to tackle challenges outside the classroom and solve problems more effectively.Secondly, learning facts improves students' social behavior. Relying solely on theoretical concepts and ideas can limit their understanding of human nature. To develop their analytical skills, students need to grasp concrete facts and objects, rather than just abstract concepts. By engaging with facts, students can better navigate social situations, leading to enhanced social communication in everyday life.Moreover, learning facts helps students develop the ability to manage their fears and concerns. When a student understands a fact and its implications, they can confront it with more confidence. In my opinion, anxieties and concerns can be highly detrimental to one's progress and success. By learning facts, students can build confidence and develop a more positive approach to challenges.In conclusion, I strongly believe that learning facts is more beneficial for students in both their social and individual lives, as supported by the aforementioned reasons. By acquiring factual knowledge, students can enhance their social interactions, tackle problems more effectively, and develop the confidence to succeed in various aspects of life.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? At universities and colleges, sports and social activities are just as important as classes and libraries and should receive equal financial support. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
human: There are a lot of debates about the importance of sports and social activities in contrast with the main classes. It is very subjective decision for students to have or not have these facilities. Although multitudes of people think that sports and social activities are not as necessary as academic subjects in colleges, I think that these activities have the same efficient role in students' lives. In the following, I will state my reason for this choice.First, besides the good body shape, sports have very vital effects on human's healthfulness. In my viewpoint, our body and moral health depend to physical activities directly. As a case in point, last month I had very difficult exam that I forced to study for one week back to back. After that exam, I felt depressed and exhausted. Therefore, I decided to go to gym to recuperate and it responded very well! As a result, sports are necessary for students to acquire their energy and health.Second, besides the academic knowledge, the awareness of social behavior is an important factor for human's life. As a practical epitome, students should be prepared to present in society after their graduation. Thus social activities can help them to be familiar with other's mind and different environment. In my opinion, social groups and classes are significant factors to prepare students to contribute in discussion and encounter real social environment. So, social activities have same rights to receive monetary support.Moreover, they bring about students to be happier and to have more fun and entertainments. If we follow just one wing of my life i.e., studying as a student, after some whiles it would be boring and we wouldn't have any motivation. Such activities can help us to pick up with other students and have more friends. In my perspective, more friends and new experience inspire the feeling of happiness and excitement in me.All in all, I am in the conviction that sports and social activities should obtain analogous concern and money in the view of above-mentioned reasons. They bring a lot of advantages and benefits for students and also affect their future in a positive way.
llm: The importance of sports and social activities in educational institutions is a topic of ongoing debate, with many arguing that they are secondary to academic subjects. However, I firmly believe that these activities play a vital role in the lives of students, comparable to the significance of academic classes. In this essay, I will outline the reasons behind my stance.Firstly, sports have a profound impact on both physical and mental health. In my opinion, regular physical activity is essential for maintaining overall well-being. For instance, after a week of intensive studying for a difficult exam, I felt drained and depressed. A visit to the gym proved to be an effective remedy, underscoring the necessity of sports for students to regain their energy and health. The physical benefits of sports, such as maintaining a healthy body shape, are complemented by their psychological advantages, making them an indispensable part of student life.Secondly, social activities are crucial for fostering social awareness and behavior, which are essential life skills. These activities prepare students for their future roles in society by familiarizing them with diverse environments and mindsets. Social groups and classes are vital in equipping students with the skills to engage in discussions and navigate real-world social scenarios. Therefore, I believe that social activities deserve equal financial support, as they are fundamental in readying students for their post-graduation lives.Furthermore, sports and social activities contribute significantly to the happiness and enjoyment of students. If studying were the sole focus of student life, it would inevitably lead to boredom and a lack of motivation. These activities provide a platform for students to interact with peers, form new friendships, and garner new experiences, all of which inspire feelings of happiness and excitement. In my view, having more friends and experiencing novel situations are key to a fulfilling student life.In conclusion, I am convinced that sports and social activities should receive comparable attention and funding, given the multitude of benefits they offer students. These activities not only enhance student life during their academic tenure but also positively impact their future. By acknowledging the importance of sports and social activities, educational institutions can provide students with a well-rounded experience that prepares them for all aspects of life.

question: Some people say that the internet provides people with a lot of valuable information. Others think access to so much information creates problems. Which view do you agree with? Use specific reasons and examples to support your opinion.
human: In the modern society, internet is considered as one of the most important inventions over the past century. Some people believe that several problems occur from an information on the internet. However, some say that the internet provides a lot of valuable information. In my opinion, I agree with the latter because the internet gives daily necessary information, people can gain knowledge and they can explore the world.First of all, everybody would like to know what is going on around the world in their everyday lives. Sometimes, they want an information that can help them in daily life which the internet can provide all of these to people. For example, a businessman who has no time to watch a television or read a newspaper can receive news and check stock markets easily via the internet.In addition, people can gain more knowledge by using the internet, the most useful technology in the world. Many people such as students can take online courses to study at home or they can watch beneficial videos which also teach them knowledge. Not only students but also everyone could get more information and knowledge. For instance, people who have problems with their health can search for more information about it.Last but not least, The internet makes the world becomes smaller which is a good thing. This is because people who have no time or have financial problems could travel around the world by using the internet. They can see lots of picture and videos of many interesting places. Moreover, people can learn other countries's culture and tradition which makes them have more knowledge about that nations.To conclude, people are satisfied with the internet and sometimes even thanks it because it helps us in studying, doing business and exploring the world. With valuable information it provides, people can enjoy their lives much more.
llm: In today's modern society, the internet is widely regarded as one of the most significant inventions of the past century. While some individuals believe that the internet is a source of numerous problems due to the abundance of information available, others argue that it provides a vast amount of valuable information. I firmly agree with the latter, as the internet offers essential daily information, enables people to acquire knowledge, and facilitates exploration of the world.First and foremost, people have a natural desire to stay informed about global events and issues that affect their daily lives. The internet caters to this need by providing easy access to information that can aid in daily life. For instance, a busy businessman who lacks the time to watch television or read newspapers can effortlessly stay updated on news and stock market trends via the internet.Furthermore, the internet serves as a powerful tool for acquiring knowledge. Students, in particular, can leverage online courses and educational videos to learn from the comfort of their own homes. This opportunity for knowledge acquisition is not limited to students; anyone can expand their understanding and gain insight into various subjects. For example, individuals dealing with health issues can research and find valuable information on their conditions.Lastly, the internet has made the world seem smaller, which is a positive development. People who are constrained by time or financial limitations can now virtually travel the world through the internet. They can view numerous photos and videos of fascinating places, and even learn about the cultures and traditions of other countries, thereby broadening their knowledge about different nations.In conclusion, people generally appreciate the internet and often express gratitude for its role in facilitating studying, conducting business, and exploring the world. The valuable information it provides enhances the quality of life, allowing people to enjoy their lives more fully.

question: Some universities require students to take classes in many subjects. Others universities require students to specialize in one subject. Which is better? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
human: University is the place that provides people knowledge and skills to use in their real life. Some universities require students to study in one subject. On the contrary, others require students to study in several subjects. In my point of view, studying many subjects is better that one because students can study in subjects that they interested in, they can gain knowledge more than one field and they will have more chance to choose their future.First of all, when students finished their high schools, they are confused about subjects that they are going to choose to study in universities. This is because they interested in many subjects and they want to try them all. For example, pupil who want to study science are also like to learn music. Therefore, requiring students to study in many subjects is good for them.In addition, people who know a wide range of is better than people who know just one. Students can gain more knowledge in every different subjects thy study. For instance, university students who study business are also know history of the world. Furthermore, students not only gain knowledge but they also have more experience because they will meet new friends and teachers. Hence, they all can share opinion and knowledge to one another.Finally, students who graduated with a variety of courses during university and lots of experience are definitely have more opportunity to choose their future or career. This is because graduates can work in various kind of works which they can select a job they prefer. For example, students will choose a career that they want including the job with high salary include. Moreover, bachelors can earn lots of money by working in other fields due to their knowledge.In concluding, learning several subjects in universities is better than specialize in one subject because it makes students have more chance to gain knowledge to use in their lives and opportunity to choose their own future.
llm: A university education provides individuals with the knowledge and skills necessary to succeed in their future endeavors. While some institutions require students to specialize in a single subject, others offer a more interdisciplinary approach, allowing students to explore multiple fields of study. In my opinion, studying multiple subjects is preferable to specializing in just one, as it enables students to pursue their interests, gain a broader range of knowledge, and increase their future career opportunities.Upon completing high school, many students are uncertain about which subjects to pursue at the university level, as they are often interested in multiple areas of study. For instance, a student interested in science may also have a passion for music. By requiring students to study multiple subjects, universities can cater to these diverse interests and provide a more well-rounded education.Furthermore, individuals with a broad range of knowledge are often more versatile and skilled than those who specialize in a single area. By studying multiple subjects, students can acquire a deeper understanding of various fields and develop a more nuanced perspective. For example, a business student who also studies history can gain a unique understanding of the global context in which businesses operate. Additionally, studying multiple subjects provides students with valuable experiences, such as interacting with new peers and instructors, which can lead to the exchange of ideas and knowledge.Ultimately, graduates who have completed a variety of courses and gained extensive experience during their university years will have a greater range of career opportunities. With a broad-based education, they can pursue various careers and select a profession that aligns with their interests and salary expectations. Moreover, having a diverse range of knowledge enables individuals to explore multiple career paths and increase their earning potential.In conclusion, studying multiple subjects at university is superior to specializing in a single subject, as it provides students with a broader range of knowledge, increased future opportunities, and a more well-rounded education to apply in their personal and professional lives.

question: Some people think governments should spend as much money as possible exploring outer space (for example, traveling to the Moon and to other planets). Other people disagree and think governments should spend this money for our basic needs on Earth. Which of these two opinions do you agree with? Use specific reasons and details to support your answer.
human: Although developing technologies to discover amazing thing in galaxy is interesting, there are many people in the world are in poverty or starvation. Thus, these technologies mean nothing if people lack of prosperity. Therefore, in my opinion, I accede with notion that government should pay attention on basic needs of people first.First, as you can see that after great economic recession, many people in many countries were unemployed. Then, many people did not have money. When people did not have money, They had to rob other people. There were increasing in criminal rate in many cities. Consequently, quality of life were dropping and this make people unhappy. So that, government should invest to create more jobs. When people have jobs, they did not have to steal money. Therefore, criminal rate were drop. Thus, people have a good quality life.Second, environment is also important issue that everyone depend on it. Nowaday, industrial in many countries still emit high intense of carbon dioxide, which caused of greenhouse effect. Greenhouse effect causes of climate change. These impact on every living creature in the world. So, government take care of this issue by declare regulate to control emission of carbon dioxide. In addition to controlling emission carbon dioxide, government should invest in alternative energy such as using solar energy instead of coal energy. If we lived in good environment, our life would be better.Lastly, family is a root of society. If everyone in family did not have time to spend with each other, that family could have problems, If family had problems, it mean society could have problems. When society had problems, it could impact to a nation. Thus, government should create campaign to fill love to family. For example, setting event once a week to gather everyone in family to spend time with each other. When family understand each other, it mean society and a nation will not have much trouble.In conclusion, I personally agree with statement that government should spend money on basic people needs. The basic needs: jobs, good environment, and love in family. These three issues are the most important basic needs of people in my opinion that government should pay attention on to improve quality life of people.
llm: While advancing technologies to explore the galaxy is intriguing, many people worldwide suffer from poverty and starvation. Therefore, these technological advancements are meaningless if people lack basic prosperity. In my opinion, I concur with the notion that governments should prioritize the fundamental needs of their citizens.Firstly, as evident from the aftermath of the great economic recession, widespread unemployment plagued numerous countries. The lack of financial resources led to increased crime rates in many cities, as people resorted to theft to survive. Consequently, the quality of life deteriorated, resulting in widespread unhappiness. Hence, governments should invest in job creation, enabling people to earn a living without resorting to crime. This, in turn, would lead to a decrease in crime rates and an improvement in the overall quality of life.Secondly, environmental concerns are equally crucial, as every living being depends on a healthy ecosystem. Currently, many industrialized nations continue to emit high levels of carbon dioxide, exacerbating the greenhouse effect and contributing to climate change. This has far-reaching implications for all living creatures. To mitigate this issue, governments should establish regulations to control carbon dioxide emissions and invest in alternative energy sources, such as solar energy, to replace fossil fuels. By preserving a healthy environment, we can ensure a better quality of life.Lastly, the family unit is the foundation of society. When family members lack quality time together, it can lead to problems within the family, which can, in turn, affect the broader society and ultimately, the nation. To address this, governments should launch campaigns to foster love and togetherness within families. For instance, organizing weekly events to bring families together can help them bond and understand one another. When families are strong and harmonious, societies and nations are more likely to thrive.In conclusion, I firmly believe that governments should allocate resources to address the basic needs of their citizens, namely, employment, a healthy environment, and strong family bonds. These three fundamental issues are, in my opinion, the most critical basic needs that governments should prioritize to enhance the quality of life for their people.

question: People have different ways of escaping the stress and difficulties of modern life. Some read, some exercise, others work in their gardens. What do you think are the best ways of reducing stress? Use specific details and examples in your answer.
human: Nowadays, we are living in in the world which is absolutely complicated. Everything seem to be rush, and it have a lot of competition. These make people get stress. Thus, many people try to reduce their stress. There are many activities that could relieve those people who are in stress. in my opinion, reducing stress by listening to music, playing sports, and doing meditation are easy and practical ways.First of all, listening to music is a great way to relax. For example, when I go to office, I use public transport. I see many things such as traffic jam, crowded people at bus stop, and all so crowded people in buses. These make me stress. So that I always listen music from my mp3 player. I could enjoy listening music without thinking of people around me. Consequently, I feel happy when I listen music.Second, another way that is perfectly work for everyone to reduce the stress is exercise. For instance, I alway have many things in my mind such as a difficult of my work that I have to finish in time. These problem sometime make me hard to fall asleep because it make me stress. Thus, after work, I always do exercise, and jogging is my favorite sport. I feel that after working out, I am easily to fall asleep. Exercising not only reduce my stress but also make me get a good health.Third, meditation also one of the ways to reduce the stress. when I have many things to think about, and this make me stress, I will do meditation. Meditation is easy way to relax because it is not require any equipment, and it take few minutes. A way to do meditation is that I just sit down, close my eyes, and count my breath. These could relieve me from stress. In conclusion, there are many ways to reduce the stress. In my point of view, listening to music, exercising, and doing meditation are the most activities that people could do to escape from stress. It is are easy and usable. And everyone should find the time to do more and more to feel better physically and in everyone mind.
llm: We live in a world that is increasingly complex, where everything seems to be in a rush and competition is rampant. This environment can be overwhelming, leading to stress for many people. As a result, numerous individuals are seeking ways to alleviate their stress. In my opinion, there are several easy and practical methods to reduce stress, including listening to music, playing sports, and practicing meditation.Firstly, listening to music is an excellent way to unwind. For instance, during my daily commute to the office, I use public transportation and am surrounded by stressful stimuli such as traffic jams, crowded bus stops, and packed buses. To cope with this, I always listen to music on my MP3 player, which allows me to tune out my surroundings and enjoy some peace. Consequently, I feel happy and relaxed when I listen to music.Secondly, exercise is another effective way to reduce stress. For example, when I have a lot on my mind, such as a daunting work project with a tight deadline, it can be challenging to fall asleep due to stress. To combat this, I engage in physical activity after work, with jogging being my preferred sport. I find that exercising not only reduces my stress but also improves my overall health and helps me fall asleep more easily.Thirdly, meditation is also a viable option for stress relief. When I have a multitude of thoughts swirling in my mind, causing me stress, I practice meditation. This technique is straightforward and requires minimal equipment, taking only a few minutes to perform. One way to meditate is to simply sit down, close my eyes, and focus on my breathing. This helps to calm my mind and alleviate stress.In conclusion, there are numerous ways to mitigate stress. In my view, listening to music, exercising, and meditating are among the most effective activities for reducing stress, as they are easy to implement and require minimal effort. Everyone should make time to engage in these activities regularly to improve their physical and mental well-being.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Teachers should be paid according to how much their students learn. Give specific reasons and examples to support your opinion.
human: Everyone is different. Although students are in the same process of education system, learning abilities in each students are not equal. Some students are fast learner, but some students are not. Thus, paying for teacher base on grade that students got is not appropriate, and it is not fair for teacher. So that, I disagree with this notion.To begin with, in schools, main task of teacher to give knowledge to students, and this role have to finish in time. there are certain period of time for teachers to teach. In these short time, it is not possible for teachers to pay attention to individual students in class. Teachers have to manage to teach every topics by schedule. If teachers pay attention to specific students, their work might not finish on time, and this might make many student miss some field in topics that they should know.Second, learning abilities in each students is different. It is not possible that they all comprehend all lessons in the same period of time. Some students might understand all topics that they had learnt but some are not. Therefore, testing result are different. This problems depend on how hard study they do. It is not teachers fault. Thus, teachers should not be paid by testing result that students get.Lastly, there could lead to a big problem if schools pay teachers by grade that students get. That is problem in quality of education. Teacher may not care about how they have to teach to make students understand the topics. Teachers may just give high grades to get higher salary. This problem should not be happened. Therefore, grade that students get should not be in evaluating teacher.In conclusion, I totally disagree with this statement that teachers should be paid by how much their students learn because teacher could not pay attention to each students in class. Besides, learning abilities of student are different. Moreover, there are problems if paying teacher by grade students get.
llm: The notion that teachers should be paid based on their students' grades is not only unfair but also impractical. Every individual is unique, and this diversity is particularly evident in the learning abilities of students within the same education system. Some students are quick to grasp new concepts, while others may need more time and attention. This disparity makes it unjust to evaluate teachers solely on the grades their students achieve.Firstly, the primary responsibility of teachers is to impart knowledge to their students within a specified timeframe. The curriculum is designed to be covered within a certain period, leaving teachers with the daunting task of managing their time effectively to ensure all topics are taught. Given the constraints of time, it becomes impossible for teachers to provide individualized attention to each student. If they were to focus on specific students, it could lead to incomplete coverage of the syllabus, resulting in some students missing out on crucial topics.Secondly, the varying learning abilities among students mean that they comprehend lessons at different paces. While some students may fully understand the topics covered in class, others may struggle, leading to diverse test results. The disparity in test outcomes is more reflective of the students' effort and learning capabilities rather than the teachers' abilities. Therefore, it is not reasonable to tie teachers' pay to their students' test results, as it overlooks the intrinsic differences in how students learn and retain information.Lastly, adopting a payment system based on student grades could lead to significant issues with the quality of education. Teachers might prioritize higher salaries over effective teaching methods, potentially leading to a culture where high grades are awarded leniently to secure better pay, rather than being a genuine reflection of a student's understanding. This could undermine the integrity of the education system and is a scenario that should be avoided. Thus, student grades should not be a factor in evaluating teacher performance.In conclusion, the idea of paying teachers based on how much their students learn is flawed. The impracticality of providing individualized attention to each student, coupled with the differences in learning abilities among students, and the potential for abuse of the grading system, all argue against this payment structure. It is crucial to find more equitable and effective methods to evaluate and compensate teachers, ones that promote the quality of education and do justice to the diverse needs and abilities of both teachers and students.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Movies and television programs should present stories in which good people are rewarded and bad people are punished.
human: When we watch movies or dramas, some of us like to see good people have a good ending and bad people are punished. While there are also some people who do not like this. Personally, I prefer to see good people get rewarded. However, if the good people always get an happy ending, I don’t think it’s proper.First, if all the story end up in the same way, it will be boring. If good people always win, we can guess the ending of the movies or dramas. Then we will feel less interested in them. But if the good people are not always rewarded, we will try to finish the movie or dramas to find out the end of the story. For example, Hollywood stories usually have a happy ending like a hero beats a crime and get a girl. But now many people, including me, have been tired with it. I don’t want to see the same kind of ending again and again. So we can’t always let good people be rewarded in movies or TV programs.Even in the real world, good people can get a bad ending sometimes. And I think it happen more often in the real world than in those movies. So if children always watch the TV programs that good people get rewarded, they may think it will be true in the real world. They will be misleading by those movies. And they may act like good people in order to get reward. Once they find the good people are not always get rewarded, they may feel upset and not to be a good person. But in fact, the good people do good things no matter the ending is good or not. So we should tell this to the young children to avoid the misunderstanding.In fact, those good endings sometimes are helpful. Some people may be encouraged to do good things. But like I said, this kind of behavior won’t last long, because someday they will realize the truth. So I suggest we should show people the truth in the stories. And if they can, they will be good people no matter how the story ends.Based on my arguments above, I think movies and TV programs should present different stories in which good people get reward or get nothing.
llm: When watching movies or dramas, many of us enjoy seeing good characters receive a happy ending and bad characters face punishment. However, some people disagree with this sentiment. Personally, I prefer to see good characters rewarded, but I also believe that it's not realistic or engaging to always have them emerge victorious.If every story ends with a happy ending, it becomes predictable and boring. When good characters always win, it's easy to guess the outcome of the movie or drama, leading to a lack of interest. On the other hand, if good characters don't always succeed, viewers are more invested in finding out what happens next. For instance, many Hollywood stories feature a hero who defeats the villain and gets the girl, but this trope has become tired and overused. Even I have grown weary of seeing the same ending repeatedly, which is why I think it's essential to mix things up and not always reward good characters.In reality, good people often face difficult outcomes, and this occurs more frequently than in movies. If children are only exposed to TV programs where good characters are always rewarded, they may develop unrealistic expectations and believe that being good will always lead to a positive outcome. They may act virtuously solely to receive rewards, and when they discover that this isn't always the case, they may become disillusioned and less inclined to be good. In fact, good people do good deeds regardless of the outcome, and it's essential to convey this message to young children to avoid misunderstandings.While happy endings can be motivating and encourage people to do good things, this effect is often short-lived, as individuals will eventually realize that reality is more complex. Therefore, I suggest that movies and TV programs should depict a range of stories where good characters are sometimes rewarded and sometimes not. This approach will promote a more realistic understanding of the world and encourage people to be good for its own sake, rather than just for a potential reward. Based on these arguments, I believe that movies and TV programs should present diverse stories that reflect the complexity of real life.

question: Distance learning and online computer classes should replace classroom learning.
human: There are many advantages of distance learning, but it should not replace classroom learning. Learning in classroom could provide more information to study. Besides, learning in classroom are not only learning academic skills but also learning social skills, and learning how to solve problem in real situation. Consequently, I completely disagree with this statement that we should replace normal course with online course. I will give reasons to support my opinion.To begin with, learning in classroom could provide more information and make students more comprehend in subjects that they had learnt. Because in classroom have many equipment to demonstrate real example. For example, in biology class, learning anatomy by operating fog have many benefits. Learner could learn how to use tools and see actual organs of fog. Unlike classroom, online class just only study in textbook not learnin real situation.Secondly, online class could not provide knowledge about social skills. For instance, In a classroom, teacher could give assignment to student to work as a group. This could help students to learn how to deal with people, how to collaborate with people in their group. This important skill cannot be gotten in online classes.Lastly, learning in classroom, student could have healthier life because in school can provide exercise class which train student to move their body. Classroom have specialist trainer to teach students to it right way. If student do it by themselves, they might be hurt themselves. This make students have healthier life which online class cannot provide. In conclusion, I personally disagree this this notion that we should replace classroom with online class. Because, classroom could provide real actual example to make students more understand in their subject. Besides, classroom courses are also provide students to learn social skill. Moreover, classroom could provide exercise class to set students to have a good health. Thus, having classroom could provide abundant skills to students.
llm: While distance learning has its advantages, it should not serve as a replacement for traditional classroom learning. Classroom learning provides a more comprehensive learning experience, offering a wealth of information and hands-on experiences that enhance students' understanding of the subject matter. Moreover, learning in a classroom setting is not solely focused on academic skills; it also encompasses the development of essential social skills and the ability to solve problems in real-world situations. Therefore, I strongly disagree with the idea of substituting online courses for regular classes and will provide several reasons to support my viewpoint.First and foremost, classroom learning offers a richer learning experience, facilitating deeper comprehension of the subjects being taught. This is largely due to the array of equipment and resources available in classrooms that can demonstrate real-life examples. For instance, in biology classes, learning anatomy through dissecting frogs provides invaluable hands-on experience. Students learn how to use various tools and observe actual organs, an experience that significantly surpasses the limitations of textbook learning in online classes.Secondly, online classes lack the capability to provide the same level of social skills education as traditional classroom settings. In a classroom, teachers often assign group projects that foster collaboration among students, teaching them how to interact, work together, and solve problems as a team. These crucial social and teamwork skills are difficult to replicate in an online learning environment.Lastly, traditional classroom learning promotes a healthier lifestyle for students. Schools typically offer physical education classes, led by specialist trainers who teach students the correct techniques for exercising, thereby reducing the risk of injury. This structured approach to physical activity is a significant advantage over self-directed exercise at home, which may lead to improper form and potential harm. Thus, classroom learning environments contribute to the overall health and well-being of students in ways that online learning cannot.In conclusion, I firmly believe that traditional classroom learning should not be replaced by online courses. Classrooms offer tangible, real-world examples that enhance subject comprehension, provide indispensable social skills, and promote physical health through structured exercise programs. Overall, the benefits of classroom learning are multifaceted, offering students a wide range of skills and experiences that are essential for their development and success.

question: What are some of experiences that have shaped your outlook and the way you live now.
human: Many circumstances that I experienced change the way I think. There are many experiences that are improve my life in many way. For example, I could improve the way that I solve problems, improve how I take care of my health, and improve to plan my life for future. I will give reasons to support my opinion.To begin with, studying in university taught me to be more prudent person to solve problems. For example, in math class, the way that we learnt to find an answer by doing step by step. Start with find cause of problem and the way to do research to solve the problem. I could adapt this method to use my real life. When I want to go to somewhere, I try to find the way to reach to destination. Which ways are shortest and which ways are less consume my time. I could find a better way to solve problems.Secondly, Some experiences could teach me the way to take care of myself. For instance, reading and listening the news about choosing a good diet are the way to keep myself are more healthy. Thus, I am always buy a quality food such as organic food. This food are not have chemical. So that, I can have a good health. This experience teach me to aware my health.Lastly, experiences are also change to plan for my future life. For example, I read about saving money for my retire is a good plan for my life. Consequently, I start changing myself from spending many thing that I want to saving money for my entire life. This experience change me to concern about making plan for my future life.In conclusion, experiences that shape my thinking and the way to live my life are teach me to be a better person. Because I could find a better way to solve problems. Besides, experiences could shape me to be more aware about my health. Moreover, these experiences could make me to make plan for my future life. These experiences taught me to change my life to be a better person.
llm: Numerous experiences have profoundly impacted my perspective and transformed the way I approach life. These experiences have improved my life in various ways, enabling me to enhance my problem-solving skills, prioritize my health, and plan for my future. I will elaborate on the reasons that support my opinion.To begin with, my university education has taught me to be a more prudent and methodical person when tackling problems. For instance, in mathematics classes, I learned to break down complex problems into manageable steps, starting with identifying the root cause and conducting research to find solutions. I have successfully applied this approach to real-life situations, such as navigating to a destination. By analyzing the most efficient routes and time-consuming options, I can make informed decisions. This experience has equipped me with better problem-solving skills.Furthermore, certain experiences have taught me the importance of self-care and health awareness. For example, reading and listening to news about healthy diets has led me to prioritize purchasing high-quality, organic food that is free from harmful chemicals. This conscious decision has contributed to my overall well-being and heightened my awareness of the significance of maintaining good health.Lastly, experiences have also influenced my approach to planning for my future. Reading about the benefits of saving for retirement, for instance, has prompted me to reassess my spending habits and adopt a more frugal mindset. Instead of indulging in impulse purchases, I have started saving for my long-term goals. This experience has instilled in me a sense of responsibility and foresight, enabling me to make informed decisions about my future.In conclusion, the experiences that have shaped my thinking and approach to life have been instrumental in my personal growth. I have developed more effective problem-solving strategies, become more health-conscious, and acquired the habit of planning for my future. These experiences have collectively contributed to my transformation into a more responsible and aware individual, empowering me to lead a more fulfilling and purposeful life.

question: Many people have learned a foreign language in their own country, others have learned a foreigh language in the country in which it is spoken. Which is better? Give the advantages of each and support your viewpoint.
human: Knowing foreign language is became more and more important in this time. Many people pursue to study foreign language. There are two options to learn foreign language. First is stay in homeland to study foreign language. The second option is that go to study in another place that foreign language are spoken. Going to another place to learn language is better choice. I will give reasons to support my opinion.To begin with, going to another country to learn language is a good environment to stimulate people to learn language. For example, everyone around me speaks foreign language, and then I have to improve myself to communicate with people. If I could not communicate with other people, I could not even buy food to sacrifice my hunger. This environment makes me want to develop myself to be able to communicate with people that speak foreign language.Secondly, having friend that speaks another language is help people to professional in that language faster. For instance, English school in outside my home country, there are many people that come from different places and from different languages. The only language that I could talk to make friends is English language. Thus, I could talk with my friend without worrying about speaking wrong. This reason makes me have a progress in foreign language faster.In conclusion, I personally believe that learning language from foreign country is better than learning language in home country because I have to improve myself to communicate with other people. Besides, in foreign country I could have a chance to speak foreign language with my friends. Learning foreign language form another country is better choice for me to study language.
llm: In today's globalized world, proficiency in a foreign language has become increasingly important. As a result, many individuals are pursuing language studies. When it comes to learning a foreign language, there are two primary options: studying in one's home country or traveling to a country where the language is spoken. In my opinion, studying abroad is the better choice, and I will provide reasons to support this viewpoint.Firstly, immersing oneself in a foreign language environment is an effective way to stimulate language learning. For instance, when surrounded by people who speak the language, one is compelled to improve their communication skills in order to interact with others.
