Therefore, offering the option to choose which classes to attend would likely yield more benefits than drawbacks, as it allows students to make the most of their time in a way that is tailored to their individual needs and learning styles.

question: Technology makes people's lives simpler rather than makes people's lives more complicated.
human: Believe it or not, nowadays people are always confronted with a problem that whether technology makes their life simpler or not, thus making them confused. Many people advocate that technology makes their life easier. Although I conceded technology may make people's life complicated in some aspects, the convenience it brings is more. In what follows, I will illustrate my point of view.First, when it comes to the field of transportation, there is no doubt that the technology in automobile has made people's life simpler. With a private car, you can reach the destination in another city just sitting in the vehicle. Alternatively, if you would like to have a trip across the ocean, a plane can carry you there in only a few hours, which is hard to imagine in the ancient times.Second, technology also makes teaching simpler. In the past, teachers have to write what they want to convey to students on the chalkboard, resulting in a great waste of time and the fatigue of teachers. With the advent of iPads in e-learning, paper books become unnecessary, so does the blackboards, it is because all the knowledge and information are stored in the iPads, with a single click, and they would appear right before your eyes at once.Admittedly, to some extent, technology may make people's life more complicated. For example, the cell phone, which used to be simply a tool to deliver messages to your contacts in a distance, now are playing a role more than just a phone in social communications. For instance, folks have to check their Facebooks, Twitters, and Forums accounts every minute, which add too much pressure to them. In addition, games on their phone exert a tremendous fascination on teenagers, leading to a large problem that they got addicted to their phones. Consequently, making their life more complicated and tired. Based on the factors I have mentioned above, a conclusion can be drawn that although technology may make people's life complicated in some cases, the convenience it brings in people's are significant.
llm: In today's world, people are constantly faced with the question of whether technology simplifies their lives or not, leaving them perplexed. While some argue that technology complicates their lives, many others believe it makes their lives easier. Although I acknowledge that technology can add complexity to certain aspects of life, I firmly believe that its benefits far outweigh the drawbacks. In this essay, I will elaborate on my perspective.Firstly, in the realm of transportation, it is undeniable that technological advancements in the automotive industry have made people's lives significantly simpler. With a private vehicle, traveling to another city is as easy as sitting back and enjoying the ride. Furthermore, air travel has reduced the time it takes to travel across oceans to just a few hours, a feat that was unimaginable in ancient times.Secondly, technology has also simplified the teaching process. In the past, teachers would spend a considerable amount of time writing on chalkboards, resulting in wasted time and teacher fatigue. However, with the advent of iPads and e-learning, traditional paper books and blackboards have become obsolete. All the necessary knowledge and information are now stored on these devices, accessible with just a single click, making learning more efficient.Admittedly, technology can complicate people's lives to some extent. For instance, cell phones, which were initially used solely for communication, now play a more complex role in social interactions. People feel pressured to constantly check their social media accounts, such as Facebook, Twitter, and forums, adding unnecessary stress to their lives. Moreover, mobile games can be highly addictive, particularly among teenagers, leading to phone addiction and a more complicated life.In conclusion, based on the factors mentioned above, it can be inferred that although technology may add complexity to certain aspects of life, the convenience and simplicity it brings to people's lives are substantial. Overall, the benefits of technology outweigh its drawbacks, making life easier and more convenient for individuals.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Television, newspapers, magazines and other media pay to much attention to the personal lives of famous people such as public figures and celebrities. Use specific reasons and details to explain your opinion.
human: Some people think that mass media should only focus on news and current affairs. Others believe that television, newspapers and magazines should keep us entertained and therefore they should pay attention to famous people lives as well. This issue is a controversial one, but in my opinion a closer examination reveals that mass media deal too much with superficial things for different reasons. One reason is that television and newspapers focus on famous peoples' lives in order to increase their audience or readership. Gutter press and Tabloid TV are more and more replacing quality papers or documentaries programs. Thanks to the Internet, we can go online and have access to information from all over the world and therefore mass media don't need any more to keep informed people but their goal is to have enough readers or TV audience. Another reason is that we live in a society where the most important thing is appearance and gossip. Nowadays, unscrupulous paparazzi constantly follow celebrities just to take a photo while they are eating or training. Newspapers often receive accusations of checkbook journalism; this means that magazines pay people a lot of money for stories or photos. Additionally, there are Reality TV, television programs in which people are put into artificial environments and situations, for example like "Big Brother".To sum up, it is clear that television, magazines and newspapers pay too much attention of peoples' private lives for all the reasons mentioned above, namely to increase audience or readership and to give exciting and shocking news to a society which feed upon gutter press and Tabloid TV.
llm: The role of mass media in reporting on celebrity lives is a contentious issue. While some argue that media outlets should focus solely on news and current events, others believe that entertainment, including coverage of famous individuals' lives, is also essential. In my opinion, a closer examination of the issue reveals that mass media often prioritize superficial content over substance, and this is due to several factors.One key reason is that media outlets, such as television stations and newspapers, emphasize celebrity news to boost their viewership or readership. The proliferation of tabloid journalism and reality TV has led to a decline in quality reporting, with many outlets opting for sensationalized stories over in-depth coverage of important issues. The internet has democratized access to information, rendering the traditional role of mass media as gatekeepers of information obsolete. Instead, their primary goal has shifted to attracting and maintaining a sizable audience.Another factor contributing to the media's fixation on celebrity lives is the societal obsession with appearance and gossip. The constant pursuit of celebrities by paparazzi, who often go to extreme lengths to capture intrusive photos, exemplifies this phenomenon. Furthermore, newspapers and magazines have been accused of engaging in "checkbook journalism," where they pay hefty sums for exclusive stories or photos, fueling the public's appetite for salacious content. The rise of reality TV shows, such as "Big Brother," which places individuals in artificial situations for the sake of entertainment, also reflects this trend.In conclusion, it is evident that television, magazines, and newspapers devote excessive attention to celebrities' private lives, driven by the desire to increase audience share and cater to a society that thrives on sensationalized content. This prioritization of celebrity news over substantive reporting is a result of the media's shift towards entertainment and the public's insatiable appetite for gossip and spectacle.

question: Which do you prefer: staying in one place or moving in search of another place?
human: Some people may prefer to live in different places at different time because of many reasons such as looking for better job, house, community and so on. I prefer to spend my entire live in one place which is my hometown. In my hometown, I have a lot of friends and good relationships, I love the traffic in here, and the environment is wonderful.I was born and grew up in here, a small town. In here, I have a lot of friends, and we usually spend free time to play sports like soccer, basketball and of course we have a lot of fun. Every people in my town have known each others, and we have good relationships. If anyone needs help, his neighbor will help as much as possible. Nowhere else can give me some people like in here.I want to live here because I love the traffic system in here. We have large streets but few cars, so we can move easily to anywhere. Last week, I went to the city center to meet my friends. The traffic in the city was too crowed. I have to wait for an hour to go to my friend house.I also love the environment in here. I have been gone to some places to travel and stay for a short time, and I realize that the environment in some place isn't clean and fresh like my home town. There were a lot of people so the environment can't be keep clean.In conclusion, I strongly feel that staying in one place is better than moving number of places. Moving some places can give to you a lot of experiences but living in one place like your hometown can make you feel comfortable about the traffic, people and of course the environment.
llm: While many people may prefer to live in different places at various times due to factors such as career advancement, housing, community, and more, I have a strong preference for spending my entire life in one place - my hometown. The reasons for this are numerous, starting with the vast number of friends and good relationships I've cultivated here. I also have a deep affection for the local traffic, which is remarkably manageable, and the environment, which is truly wonderful.Born and raised in this small town, I've developed a strong network of friendships. My friends and I often spend our free time engaging in sports like soccer and basketball, and we always have a great time. One of the standout features of my town is the close-knit community; everyone knows each other, and we maintain excellent relationships. The spirit of neighborliness is alive and well here, with people readily helping each other in times of need. I've yet to find another place that replicates this sense of community and camaraderie.Another significant reason I wish to remain here is my love for the local traffic system. The town is designed with large streets but a minimal number of cars, making movement easy and efficient. This contrasts sharply with my recent experience in the city center, where I had to wait for an hour just to reach my friend's house due to crowded traffic conditions.Additionally, the environment in my hometown is a major draw for me. Through my travels to other places, even if only for short stays, I've come to appreciate the cleanliness and freshness of my hometown's environment. In contrast, other places I've visited, often overcrowded with people, struggle to maintain cleanliness and freshness.In conclusion, I firmly believe that residing in one place, particularly one's hometown, offers a superior quality of life compared to constantly moving between different locations. While moving around can indeed provide a plethora of experiences, living in one's hometown fosters a deep sense of comfort and familiarity with the traffic, the people, and most importantly, the environment. This rootedness and sense of belonging are invaluable to me, making my decision to stay in my hometown a clear and confident choice.

question: Students at universities often have a choice of places to live. They may choose to live in university dormitories, or they may choose to live in apartments in the community. Compare the advantages of living in university housing with the advantages of living in an apartment in the community. Where would you prefer to live? Give reasons for your preference.Ê
human: When it comes to the issue of choosing an accommodation after completion of their high school, most students always get confused between these two options: living in an apartment, or in university dormitories. As far as I am concerned, both choices have their own advantages and disadvantages. On the one hand, living in a dormitory helps students to familiarize themselves with the academic environment of the university. For instance, students can have an opportunity to take part in many kind of extracurricular activities happing around the campus such as attending conversation club, or joining sports club. Students can also have more chance of interaction with their teachers and classmates. In addition, it is easier for students to get help when facing problem such as if students have problem in solving their math question, they can easily ask for help to their roommates, classmates, or teachers. I think living in dormitory is always helpful to students. On the other hand, living off campus prepares students for the real life. For example, students can learn many new things such as how to become responsible, independent, punctual, co-operative compared to living in university dormitories. They are responsible to take care of everything including paying their apartment rent on time, and dealing with the utility bills. In addition, students also have to focus on their study, and try to maintain their grades higher. Furthermore, students also have a chance to know about the community around them. Interacting with the people, and socializing with them prepares students for the life after graduation. From given the evidences, it seems to me that it becomes hard for students to choose between their living options since both living accommodation have its own benefits. If I have to choose, I would definitely choose the second option: living in an apartment. I think that it teaches me everything that I certainly wants to learn in my life because learning all those characteristics would really help me in leading successful life.
llm: The decision on where to live after completing high school is a daunting task for many students, who often find themselves torn between two primary options: residing in an apartment or in university dormitories. In my opinion, both choices come with their unique set of advantages and disadvantages.On one hand, living in a dormitory offers students the opportunity to immerse themselves in the university's academic environment. For example, it provides access to various extracurricular activities on campus, such as conversation clubs and sports teams, which can be incredibly enriching. Additionally, dormitory life facilitates greater interaction with both teachers and classmates, which can be particularly beneficial when facing academic challenges. If a student is struggling with a math problem, they can easily seek help from roommates, classmates, or teachers. Overall, I believe that living in a dormitory is highly beneficial for students.On the other hand, living off campus is a valuable preparation for real life. It teaches students essential life skills such as responsibility, independence, punctuality, and cooperation, which may not be fully developed in a dormitory setting. Students living in apartments must manage their responsibilities, including paying rent on time and handling utility bills, all while maintaining their academic performance. This setting also provides an opportunity for students to engage with their community, interact with people from diverse backgrounds, and develop social skills that are crucial for life after graduation.Given these points, it's clear that both living arrangements have their benefits, making the decision challenging for students. Personally, I would opt for the second option: living in an apartment. I believe it offers a comprehensive learning experience that teaches valuable life characteristics necessary for leading a successful life. These skills, such as responsibility and independence, are essential and will undoubtedly benefit me in the long run.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? In today's world, it is more important to work quickly and risk making mistakes than to work slowly and make sure that everything is correct.
human: Organizations, these days, seek to find people who can work extraordinary fast and carefully. These people play an important role to increase effectiveness of a company. Working fast yet risky has a place near the ideal goal mentioned before. I am totally agrees with the statement for some reasons. Trying to learn skills, working in two places in a week and gaining more tasks are the reasons which take into account as the most important causes of my choice.To begin with, if persons work rapidly, they will have more chance to study. Attending in some classes which try to increase the skills of employees can be considered as an absolutely effective parameter. If people learn how should increase their speed at work by studying, they can stares in their workplace. For example, I have a friend who was working so slowly. He has been threatened by his boss who was going to fire him. My friend went to a course where he learned how should work rapidly and now he is working.Most importantly, people prone to work in two or three firms in a week because the expenses have been increased. If they work just in one organization they cannot earn enough money. This fact pushes them to work faster and faster. For example, because applying to study abroad needs a lot of money, I am working in two organization to gain more salary. The more money, the more chances.Last but not least, people who work slowly can no longer handle more tasks. If you show in your workplace that you are the one who can work more than other even carelessly, your boss will assign you more tasks. If you do them fast too, the first acknowledgement of your boss encourages you to work harder. It turns you to a person who has skill of working without hesitation. Even if we ignore this result, by the same token, you can get higher position and more money.To sum up, I completely approve of the statement which says people should work faster even more risky. Gaining more skills by study, having more than one job, and handling more tasks are the benefits of it which overweighs its disadvantages. I hope people gain this skill because after that they will endorse my choice.
llm: In today's fast-paced work environment, organizations are on the lookout for individuals who can work efficiently and effectively. These individuals play a crucial role in enhancing a company's productivity. Working quickly and carefully is considered an ideal approach, and I strongly agree with this statement for several reasons. My reasons for endorsing this approach include the opportunity to acquire new skills, the necessity of working multiple jobs to make ends meet, and the ability to handle a heavier workload.Firstly, when individuals work rapidly, they have more opportunities to learn and develop their skills. Attending classes or workshops that focus on improving employee skills can be a highly effective way to enhance productivity. By learning how to work efficiently, individuals can excel in their workplace. For instance, a friend of mine who used to work slowly was at risk of being fired by his boss. However, after attending a course that taught him how to work quickly, he was able to turn his performance around and is now a valued employee.Moreover, the increasing cost of living has led many people to work multiple jobs to make ends meet. If they only worked at one organization, they would not be able to earn a sufficient income. This reality forces them to work faster and more efficiently. For example, I am working two jobs to earn a higher salary, which is necessary to fund my plans to study abroad. The more money I earn, the more opportunities I have.Lastly, individuals who work slowly often struggle to handle multiple tasks. On the other hand, those who can work quickly and efficiently are more likely to be assigned additional responsibilities by their bosses. If they complete these tasks efficiently, they are likely to receive recognition and encouragement from their superiors, which motivates them to work even harder. This, in turn, helps them develop the skill of working without hesitation, which is highly valued in the workplace. Furthermore, this approach can lead to career advancement and higher earning potential.In conclusion, I fully endorse the statement that people should work faster, even if it means taking on more risk. The benefits of acquiring new skills, working multiple jobs, and handling a heavier workload outweigh the drawbacks. I hope that more people will develop this skill, as it will ultimately lead to greater productivity and success in their careers.

question: Do you agree or disagree: It is not necessary for university students to attend classes as long as they can pass the exam.
human: Though out the last decade, the load of the university students has been constantly increasing. There are those who consider that university students cannot attend any classes until the students pass the exam. There are those who said that student can attend the university coarse without passing the exam. However, from my perspective, students can acquire university knowledge without the prerequisite of passing exam. The reasons to be illustrated are follows. Firstly, the students are not constantly expert in every part of a subject. For example, I love Physics. But I don't like electronics, because electronics cannot always be seen in the real world. And I have had 0 in physics score when I study the electronics. But I constantly achieve 100 score when I study other part of the physics. And if I cannot attend the classes until I pass the exam of electronics, I could not pass the entire part of physics, and I will fail the exam over and over again. Luckily, in our university, you can attend the classes regardless of the score you reach. And I can study physics without consideration of my electronics. And at last, I took the electronics again and pass the exam.Secondly, if the university take the policy that no one can attend the classes without passing exam, students are highly likely to leave uncultivated. If one fail most of the exam, it means that he or she cannot participate in most of the classes. And the students will have nothing to do in the campus. Then he or she will play online games days and nights. The academic achievement will decline. In the end, this student will become a loser in the world. And all this is due to that the university don't permit them to attend the class. This is not the failure of the university but also the entire education system.Admittedly, the university student may don't reach a high if the university allow student to participate in the class no matter whether they pass the test or not. But the benefit of free to access to the classes eclipse the issue of lower points.All in all, the university should allow the student to participate in the classed without passing the test because not only is every students expert in every part of one subject but also it will reduce the student in the campus who leave uncultivated.
llm: Over the past decade, the burden on university students has been continually increasing. Some people believe that students should not be allowed to attend classes until they have passed the prerequisite exams. Others argue that students can attend university courses without first passing the exams. In my opinion, students can acquire university knowledge without having to pass an exam as a prerequisite. There are several reasons that support this perspective.Firstly, students are not always experts in every aspect of a subject. For instance, I am passionate about physics, but I have never been fond of electronics because it is not always applicable to the real world. As a result, I have struggled with electronics and scored poorly on exams. However, I have consistently achieved high scores in other areas of physics. If I were not allowed to attend classes until I passed the electronics exam, I would have been unable to progress in the physics course and would have likely failed the exam repeatedly. Fortunately, my university allows students to attend classes regardless of their exam scores, enabling me to study physics without being held back by my weaknesses in electronics. Ultimately, I was able to retake the electronics exam and pass it.Secondly, if universities were to adopt a policy that prohibits students from attending classes without first passing the exams, many students would likely become disengaged. If a student fails most of their exams, they would be unable to participate in most classes, leaving them with nothing to do on campus. This could lead to a decline in academic achievement, as students might spend their time playing online games instead of focusing on their studies. Eventually, such a student might become disheartened and struggle to succeed in the world. This outcome would be a failure not only of the university but also of the entire education system.It is true that allowing students to participate in classes without first passing the exams might not lead to the highest academic achievement. However, the benefits of providing students with unrestricted access to classes outweigh the potential drawbacks of lower grades.In conclusion, universities should allow students to participate in classes without first passing the exams. This approach recognizes that students are not always experts in every aspect of a subject and helps to prevent students from becoming disengaged and falling behind in their studies.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? To improve the quality of education, universities should spend more money in salaries for university professors.  Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
human: University education is always an important part of one's life. That's why education in university is discussed all the time. What is the best way to orientate the students? Raising the salaries of professors so? I would say no. The professors are essential, however, the schools are established for students. Money should spend on facilities in school or update resources, which are beneficial to school rather than just instructors. The following are my opinions. To begin with, the school should put more emphasis on students instead of professors. I think the most efficient way to improve the education is to guide the students to learn actively. By renewing some facilities in school so students will spend more time at school doing assignment. A comfortable environment can attract people to stay longer. Thus, students spend more time on school to make a good circulation of learning. That is to say, students have a better environment to working on their assignments so the quality of their assignments will improve. Thus, the competition between peers enhances and forms a circulation. In my school, the classrooms in my university are old and kind of shabby. For me, I prefer spending money in a coffee shop to staying at school to finish my assignment. It's unpleasant to stay at school. However, coffee shops are not always quiet, so my classmates and I often finish our work roughly.Besides, the ultimate purpose is to change, to motivate students to be better. To improve education, spending more money to raise professors' salary is inappropriate. In addition, will the university filter all the professors overall? Some professors don't deserve the money at all, then, what's the point to spend money on them? High-salary instructors don't teach students harder because they earn more money. There won't be any effect if school does so. There was news about raising professors' salary in my country. This event provoked a demonstration composing of students mostly. The proposal of the demonstration was eliminating the raising salaries. As you can see, if the policy of raising salary was supported, the demonstration would not happen. At school, students are priority. Students' tuition is not only for the professors but also for their quality of learning at university. That's the main reason I against providing more money to professors. Students are those who suppose to enjoy the use of their tuition.
llm: University education is a crucial part of one's life, which is why it's always a topic of discussion. The question is, what's the best way to support students? Is raising professors' salaries the answer? I don't think so. While professors are essential, the primary purpose of schools is to serve students. Therefore, funds should be allocated to improve school facilities and update resources, which benefit the students, rather than just the instructors.In my opinion, schools should prioritize students over professors. The most effective way to enhance education is to encourage active learning among students. By renovating school facilities, students will be more inclined to spend time on campus working on assignments. A comfortable environment can foster longer stays, leading to a productive learning cycle. When students have a better environment to work on their assignments, the quality of their work improves, and healthy competition among peers is promoted. Unfortunately, the classrooms at my university are outdated and uninviting, making me prefer to study at a coffee shop instead. However, coffee shops can be distracting, leading to rushed and subpar work.The ultimate goal is to motivate students to improve. Spending more money to raise professors' salaries is not an effective way to achieve this. Moreover, will the university assess all professors to ensure they deserve a salary increase? Some professors may not be worthy of the extra compensation, making it pointless to allocate funds to them. Higher salaries do not necessarily translate to better teaching or more effort from instructors. In fact, there was a proposal in my country to raise professors' salaries, which sparked a student-led protest advocating against the move. The fact that the protest occurred suggests that the policy was not well-supported.At the end of the day, students are the priority at school. Their tuition fees are not only meant to compensate professors but also to ensure they receive a quality education. This is why I believe that providing more funds to professors is not the best use of students' tuition fees. Students should be the ones to benefit from their tuition payments.

question: Pets should be treated like family members. Do you agree or disagree with this statement?
human: Pets have always been essential in our society. Cats and dogs are the most common pets but there are birds, tortoises and fishes as well. Some people think that pets should be treated like family members. However, others argue that they are just animals and aren't able to think like us. The issue is controversial but in my opinion, pets should be treated like human beings for different reasons.First, pets are our friends as well as certain human beings are. Similarly to friends, indeed, they are always with us and they are there if we feel alone. We can talk to them because they listen to us, more than some people will ever do. To illustrate this point, I can write about my own experience. When I was 14 years old, my uncle passed away and I felt like everything was no longer important. Talking to my friends was frustrating because none of them have ever felt that way. Since I was all alone at home for a long time, my dog was near me and it seemed to me that only him could understand my deeply feelings. Clearly, although pets aren't able to speak with us, we can nonetheless count on them.Secondly, pets are useful for a variety of things. For example, nowadays the pet therapy is becoming more popular than before. Researchers have discovered that pets can bring benefits in a huge amount of illnesses. There are dogs who lead blind people around the city and therefore without them they could not go around all alone. In addition, pets are important for depressed people as well because their presence make them feel better. Moreover, there are dogs who are educated in order to find out criminals or to use their sense of smell to find drugs. To sum up, I am strongly convinced that pets deserve to be treated like family members because of all the reasons mentioned above, namely they are our friends and they can be useful in many situations.
llm: The importance of pets in our society cannot be overstated. While cats and dogs are the most popular pets, many people also keep birds, tortoises, and fish as companions. There is an ongoing debate about how pets should be treated, with some arguing that they should be considered part of the family, while others view them as simply animals that lack the capacity for human-like thought. In my opinion, pets deserve to be treated with the same respect and care as human beings, and for good reason.First and foremost, pets serve as loyal friends, providing companionship and emotional support in much the same way that human friends do. They are always there for us, offering a listening ear when we need it, and often proving to be more attentive than some people. I can speak to this from personal experience. When I was 14, I lost my uncle and felt lost and alone. Talking to my friends didn't help, as none of them could understand my grief. But my dog was there for me, and somehow, he seemed to sense my deep emotional pain. Although pets can't speak, they have a unique ability to understand and comfort us in times of need.Furthermore, pets have a multitude of practical uses. Pet therapy, for example, is becoming increasingly popular, with research showing that pets can have a positive impact on a range of illnesses. Trained dogs assist blind individuals, enabling them to navigate the world independently. Pets also play a vital role in supporting people with depression, as their presence can help alleviate symptoms. Additionally, dogs are trained to aid in law enforcement, using their keen sense of smell to detect criminals or narcotics.In conclusion, I firmly believe that pets warrant treatment as family members, given their role as loyal friends and their numerous practical applications. Their capacity to provide comfort, support, and assistance in various situations makes them invaluable companions, and it is only right that we treat them with the respect, care, and kindness they deserve.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? In today's world, it is more important to work quickly and risk making mistakes than to work slowly and make sure that everything is correct. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
human: This current world we situate ourselves in is rather unpredictable, even one sudden invention could bring down all the notions we used bear in mind. Most of us has endeavored to keep up with the pace of the development of today's world in fast pace. I personally believe that even when fast pace may be the wise move to correspond with today's world. However, it might not be the most beneficial move to our society.Primarily, even when the world operates in fast pace, it still requires accuracy. Even simple issues in our daily life like homework require accuracy. If we rush through the work by taking risk of making mistakes, we are actually making zero effort going through our study roughly only for the purpose of fill in before the deadline. In short, it only fulfills the work itself which is rather worthless. It is our capability of work that we should improve rather than holding the belief in completing it. Certainly it may take time to keep up with the others if w need to review our work multiple times, but with consistent work soon enough we'll be able to bring up our speed in completion of work.Secondly, other than the importance of accuracy, the world also seeks efficiency, which concludes both minimum time completion and also criterion of quality. Even when we managed to keep up with the pace by neglecting the details of a project and only aim for a general frame of the project, this will not be something satisfy for the company and clients. We soon will be out of the picture even when we kept up with the pace since when the problem reveals itself we'll have to go back and fix the mistakes we have made. This might be even more costly and time consuming than a neat completion of work at the start. Besides, when looking at this problem within a broader image. Some work cannot tolerate any mistakes at all, for instance, in official missions like the work done by NASA, a tiny mistake can be catastrophic. A miscalculation of the orbit in launching rocket may lead to a failure of the whole project which might worth trillions of dollars. In such circumstances, even when the scientists want to finish off quickly, but they couldn't miss even a single part of the mission since it may trigger loads of problems.To sum up, even when we need to catch up with the pace of the world, it is necessary for us to be extraordinarily cautious since rough work is intolerable when we want to stay competitive.
llm: The world we live in today is inherently unpredictable, and a single groundbreaking invention can upend all our existing notions. To keep up with the rapid pace of modern development, most of us strive to move at an equally fast pace. While I believe that adapting to this fast pace is a wise decision to stay relevant in today's world, I also think it may not be the most beneficial approach for our society as a whole.First and foremost, even in a fast-paced world, accuracy remains a crucial element. This is evident even in simple, everyday tasks like homework, which require precision to be done correctly. Rushing through work by taking the risk of making mistakes is essentially pointless, as it only serves to complete the task on time without actually putting in any genuine effort or learning. What we should focus on improving is our capability to produce quality work, rather than just aiming to complete tasks quickly. Although it may take longer to review our work multiple times to ensure accuracy, consistent effort will eventually allow us to increase our work speed without compromising on quality.Secondly, aside from accuracy, the world also values efficiency, which encompasses both completing tasks in minimal time and meeting high-quality standards. Even if we manage to keep up with the pace by overlooking project details and only focusing on the general framework, this approach will not satisfy companies and clients in the long run. Eventually, we will be left behind despite keeping up with the pace, because when problems arise, we will have to go back and correct the mistakes made, which can be more costly and time-consuming than doing the work neatly from the start.Moreover, looking at this issue from a broader perspective, some types of work cannot tolerate any mistakes whatsoever. For instance, in official missions like those conducted by NASA, a tiny mistake can have catastrophic consequences. A miscalculation in launching a rocket's orbit can lead to the failure of an entire project worth trillions of dollars. In such high-stakes scenarios, even the desire to finish quickly cannot compromise the meticulous attention to every detail of the mission, as overlooking any part can trigger a multitude of problems.In conclusion, while keeping up with the world's pace is necessary, it is equally important for us to be extraordinarily cautious and meticulous. Rough or sloppy work is intolerable if we aim to remain competitive, emphasizing the need for a balanced approach that combines speed with accuracy and quality.

question: Some people prefer to live in a small town. Others prefer to live in a big city. Which place would you prefer to live in? Use specific reasons and details to support your answer.
human: Continuous technological and economical development in modern world created great differences between cities, a difference that is clearly visible in the size of various cities. From cities with more that 20 million people to small towns inhabited by only hundreds of people. This diversities in cities allowed for more difference in people's preferences for where to live. For me, I prefer to live in bigger cities than in small ones, this personal attitude is the result of many factors.First of all, I find the excitement of big cities to be attractive, living in a dynamic environment can turn into a very rich experience that sharpens one's personality and open one's eyes on the real world. Life in big cities cities gives one new challenges every day, let it be deciding which restaurant to go to or deciding which company to work for. For me, this lifestyles is very attractive and is considered a huge advantage of big cities compared with the constant, slow paced life styles of small towns.Another thing that put big cities in front of small towns is the facilitates and services it contains which support and improve the quality of its inhabitants' lives, hospitals, advanced medical facilities can satisfy one's need of medical safety. Cultural events such as exhibitions and theatre plays can enrich one's and widen his horizons, things which aren't offered by small towns.Furthermore, it's undeniable that the economic power of a country is driven by it's big cities and the majority of wealth and finance is centered and controlled in big cities. With this kind of power big cities offer more opportunities for one's career advancements and a more chances of higher income that small towns does, and higher income can be the basis of a happier, healthier life.Finally, although I prefer to live in a big city, I can not help but assure that this is a matter of personal taste, to be clear, I would love to spend some days in countryside to recharge my soul and relieve myself from daily stress.
llm: The continuous advancements in technology and economy in the modern world have created significant disparities between cities, which is evident in the vast size differences between them. These cities range from metropolises with over 20 million inhabitants to small towns with only a few hundred residents. This diversity in urban settings has led to a wider range of preferences for people's living choices. Personally, I prefer residing in larger cities over smaller ones, and this inclination stems from various factors.Firstly, I find the vibrancy of big cities appealing, as living in a dynamic environment can lead to a rich and transformative experience that refines one's personality and broadens their perspective on the world. Life in big cities presents new challenges daily, whether it's deciding on a restaurant to dine at or choosing a company to work for. I find this lifestyle highly attractive and consider it a significant advantage of big cities compared to the slow-paced and monotonous lifestyle of small towns.Another aspect that gives big cities an edge over small towns is the array of facilities and services they offer, which enhance and support the quality of life for their inhabitants. Hospitals and advanced medical facilities provide a sense of medical security, while cultural events like exhibitions and theater plays enrich one's life and expand their horizons - opportunities that are often lacking in small towns.Moreover, it's undeniable that a country's economic power is largely driven by its big cities, where the majority of wealth and finance is concentrated and controlled. This economic clout enables big cities to offer more opportunities for career advancement and higher income prospects compared to small towns, and a higher income can be the foundation of a happier, healthier life.Lastly, while I prefer living in a big city, I acknowledge that this is a matter of personal preference. I must admit that I would love to spend some time in the countryside to rejuvenate and relieve myself from the stresses of daily life.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? It is more important for the government to spend money on new buildings than to preserve historic or traditional buildings and homes.
human: The housing shortage is drawing more and more attention nowadays. And the cost of accommodation keeps growing these years. The necessity of governmental financial aid is extremely important. What government should take into consideration at the first place should not be historic and traditional building preservation but new building construction.Building more accommodating constructions meets people's basic need. People cannot live a harmonious life if citizens do not have a decent place to live in. If the price of housing grows continuously, a comfortable place to live in will be a luxury to the middle class and the low class. Then, ordinary people, especially the younger generation, will fall into a certain pattern - work, pay bills for housing, work; and I am sure that it will increase people's dissatisfaction of the government. Because when they are working, the fair of losing their accommodation always lingers, which will limit their efficiency. And government should spend money on people to rescue them from this, because only a government of the people, by the people, for the people will finally last; people's cohesiveness will be promoted.Otherwise, another vital reason why new building construction deserves more governmental investment lies in the fact that it requires far more resource compare to old building preservation. Build a new building has following prerequisites, land that has been sold by the government via formal procedures, a reliable construction company and tremendous amount of labor. Except these, hundreds of problems would occur during the construction. Thus, only government can cope with it by utilizing its enormous resource like dollars and effectiveness. Generally, personally speaking, I believe new building construction hold the right to gain more money from government.
llm: The issue of housing scarcity has become increasingly prominent in recent years, with the cost of accommodation continually rising. In light of this, the need for government financial assistance is paramount. When allocating resources, the government's primary consideration should be the construction of new buildings, rather than the preservation of historic and traditional ones.Building more accommodations is essential to meeting people's basic needs. Without a decent place to live, citizens cannot lead a harmonious life. The continuous growth in housing prices threatens to make comfortable living a luxury exclusive to the wealthy, leaving the middle and lower classes struggling. This, in turn, may force ordinary people, particularly the younger generation, into a cycle of working solely to pay housing bills, leading to increased dissatisfaction with the government. The perpetual fear of losing their accommodation will also hinder their productivity. It is the government's responsibility to invest in its people and rescue them from this predicament, as a government that truly represents its citizens is the one that will endure, fostering a sense of community and cohesion.Furthermore, new building construction warrants greater governmental investment due to its requirement for vast resources compared to the preservation of old buildings. Constructing a new building involves several prerequisites, including land sold through formal government procedures, a reliable construction company, and a significant amount of labor. Hundreds of challenges will inevitably arise during the construction process, making it a task that only the government, with its substantial resources and effectiveness, can adequately manage.In conclusion, I firmly believe that new building construction has a rightful claim to more government funding. This investment is crucial not only for addressing the immediate housing needs but also for ensuring the long-term stability and satisfaction of the population, which are foundational to a thriving and cohesive society.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Most experiences in our lives that seemed difficult at the time become valuable lessons for the future. Use reasons and specific examples to support our answer.
human: I agree with the statement that our life seems tough at the time but those difficult experiences of life become important lessons for the future. My opinion based on the reasons that Every tough experience makes us more skilled, improves our decision making and makes us more compatible for life.The best example of it is how babies learn about basics survival habits during their childhood. Every day comes with new challenges for them like walking, eating, etc., but those challenges of their initial life teach them important survival lessons which help them for whole life. For example, when they tried to learn walking, they stumble and hurt themselves many times. But they slowly tune their technique and learned to walk.All inventions and experiments are based on many unfortunate observations. No known scientist has success in first attempt. Scientists try and test many specimens before they get they want. It was said that Thomas Edison tested around 10000 bulbs before inventing Light bulb. So, all the initial experiments would be difficult and frustrating for him but he searched for more options and learnt new findings with each experiment even when he was failing in his attempts and finally found break through.Our difficult experiences also make us robust and strong unknowingly. We might be facing a toughest time of life at the time, but when we think back about those moments later in life, we feel more confident about our decisions and about ourselves. When I moved to college hostel after school, first few days were very unsettling for me because first time I was away from parent and staying with people I had not known. I had felt very fragile and emotionally distracted, but then slowly I started adjusting with roommates and built connection with them. I also became more casual and social with others, this experience increased my communication skill and social speaking skills. Therefore, to conclude my opinion on this statement, I want to mentioned that every experience in life whether it is good or bad always gives us something to learn and keep for life. Good experiences give us good memories and bad ones teach us lessons for life.
llm: I wholeheartedly concur with the notion that life's challenges are a crucial part of our growth, a viewpoint substantiated by the fact that every difficult experience serves as a catalyst for skill-building, enhanced decision-making, and increased adaptability. The process of learning from adversity is exemplified in the way infants acquire fundamental survival skills during their formative years. As they navigate the challenges of daily life, such as walking and eating, they are, in effect, learning invaluable lessons that will benefit them throughout their lives. For instance, the process of learning to walk involves numerous stumbles and setbacks, but with each attempt, they refine their technique until they ultimately master the skill.Similarly, the foundation of innovation and experimentation is rooted in a multitude of trials and errors. It is rare for a scientist to achieve success on their inaugural attempt. Instead, they typically undergo a series of tests and experiments, refining their approach with each iteration. The oft-cited example of Thomas Edison, who reportedly tested over 10,000 light bulbs before inventing the successful model, illustrates this point. Although his initial experiments were likely fraught with difficulty and frustration, Edison persisted, leveraging each failure as an opportunity to discover new findings and eventually break through to a groundbreaking invention.Furthermore, our experiences, particularly the challenging ones, have a profound impact on our personal growth, fortifying our resolve and emotional resilience. When reflecting on past difficulties, we often find that they have instilled in us a deeper sense of confidence and self-assurance. A personal anecdote that comes to mind is my transition to college hostel life after school. The initial days were overwhelming, given that it was my first time away from my parents and living among unfamiliar faces. I felt vulnerable and emotionally disoriented, but as time passed, I began to adapt to my new surroundings, forging connections with my roommates and expanding my social circle. This experience significantly enhanced my communication and social skills, demonstrating the transformative power of adversity.In conclusion, my stance on this statement is that every life experience, be it positive or negative, offers a valuable lesson or takeaway. While positive experiences provide us with cherished memories, negative ones equip us with essential life lessons. This dichotomy underscores the importance of embracing all experiences, regardless of their nature, as each contributes uniquely to our personal and skill development, ultimately enriching our lives in profound ways.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Drivers have to pay a fee for driving in busy city streets when there is a great amount of traffic.
human: Started in the late eighteenth century, the industrialization and urbanization witnessed the explosion in number of automobiles. The very fuel that they rely on, oil, has now become the dominant pollution of cities' environment. While critics castigating about the exorbitant use of oil and other insisting to charged drivers with extra fee during the rush hours for their selfish conducts, I hold the contention that no additional payment should be charged on them. The reasons are the followings. Capitalism enfranchised people's right to own properties, and consequently, their rights to use them. Driving cars during the rush hours might is bound to polluting cities's environment, but laws protect drivers to do so, and accordingly, charging them extra fee might seems to be out of the jurisdiction. From another point of view, traffic jam is a natural phenomenon that nobody is able to shun or ban; so it is out of drivers' control. Why drivers should pay a fine only for driving their own cars in a particular time? Wars are notorious, but you can't blame the soldiers who are justing fight for their countries.Buying a car spends hundreds of thousand; paying for all sorts of fee takes another several-these are all ready too much for most of the families to bear. Charging drivers one more fee makes no sense and is ridiculous. Majority of the families buy cars simply for a safer and easier conveyance, and charging them too much fee adds a lot to their burden and is actually jeopardizing their rights.Rather than passively forcing drivers to pay another fee, government should instead, be more active on advocating the use of more efficient and environmental-friendly energy or planning out more reasonable and convenient layout that allow people to reach their destinations with less oil. Sometimes traffic jam occur only due to the malfunction of a traffic light, or unreasonable organization of roadways. In these cases, the one who should be charged for a fine is the city planner, not drivers. Simply put, charging drivers fees regardless of the causes of the problems could be ridiculous and even unlawful. In conclusion, "rush hours" are usually not the direct consequence of drivers. Instead, the real causes of traffic jam may fall on various of grounds, and therefore, charging drivers for another fee for this could be unreasonable and irrational.
llm: The industrialization and urbanization that began in the late 18th century led to a significant increase in the number of automobiles on the road. However, the fuel that powers these vehicles, oil, has become a major contributor to pollution in urban environments. While some critics argue that drivers should be charged an extra fee for driving during rush hour due to the pollution and congestion they cause, I disagree. The principles of capitalism grant individuals the right to own property, including cars, and to use them as they see fit. Although driving during rush hour may contribute to pollution, laws permit it, and therefore, imposing an additional fee on drivers may be seen as beyond the jurisdiction of regulatory authorities. Moreover, traffic congestion is an inevitable phenomenon that cannot be entirely avoided or banned, and thus, it is not solely within drivers' control. It is unfair to penalize drivers solely for operating their vehicles during a specific time. Similarly, soldiers fighting for their countries in wars should not be blamed for the conflict itself.The cost of purchasing and maintaining a car is already prohibitively expensive for many families, with hundreds of thousands spent on the initial purchase and subsequent fees. Imposing an additional fee on drivers would be unreasonable and excessive. Most families acquire cars for safer and more convenient transportation, and excessive fees would add to their financial burden and potentially infringe upon their rights.Rather than simply imposing another fee on drivers, the government should take a more proactive approach by promoting the use of more efficient and environmentally friendly energy sources or redesigning urban layouts to facilitate easier, less polluting travel. Often, traffic congestion arises from factors such as malfunctioning traffic lights or poorly planned roadways, situations in which the city planner, not the driver, should be held accountable. Charging drivers fees without considering the root causes of the problem can be seen as irrational and potentially unlawful.In conclusion, rush hour congestion is often not a direct result of drivers' actions. The true causes of traffic jams can be attributed to various factors, and therefore, charging drivers an additional fee for this purpose can be deemed unreasonable and unjustified.

question: Agree or disagree: one of the best ways that parents can help their teenage children prepare for adult life is to encourage them to take a part-time job.
human: Nowadays, the difference between school and society is bigger and bigger. If students want to get used to the society quickly, it is better for parents to encourage them to take part-time jobs. There are some reasons can support my view.First, there are a few opportunities for students to know how to live adult life in the university. Because most people they contact with are also students. However, when students do part-time jobs, they can work with many kinds of people, and most of whom are adults. So, they can teach students many things about adult life. My friend Lisa, who is doing part-time job now, tells me that it is fabulous to take it. Through part-time job, she makes friends with different kinds of people and they let her know the different aspects of adult life. For example, Lisa thought in adult life, work is the core; but after she knows these friends, she changes her mind that the true core for the adult life is responsibility but not work. Hence, thanks to the information her new friends has provided; now she is more confidence about her future adult life. Second, parents always tell students that the adult life is much tenser than school life. However, because we do not experience it, it is very difficult for us to really know how tense the adult life can be. Therefore, we need part-time job to teach us how hard the real adult life can be. Actually, some questionnaires indicate that if students have taken part-time jobs, they will make the best use of their time to prepare their future and more importantly; they will not expect too much for their future than students who have not taken the part-time job. Therefore, the part-time job can make people understand future life better.Third, some parents are afraid that the part-time job will effect student' study. Actually, most students will do the part-time job in their holiday, so it will not effect on their study. Compared with playing computers every day, doing part-time jobs is the best choice for students to spend their holiday.In conclusion, taking the part-time job can let students experience the real adult life and know more about it. Therefore, parents should encourage students to take the part-time job.
llm: The gap between school life and societal expectations is growing wider, making it essential for students to adapt quickly to the real world. To achieve this, parents should encourage their children to take on part-time jobs. There are several reasons that support this viewpoint.Firstly, universities often lack opportunities for students to learn about adult life, as they primarily interact with fellow students. In contrast, part-time jobs provide a platform for students to work with diverse groups of people, mostly adults, who can impart valuable lessons about adult life. For instance, my friend Lisa, who currently holds a part-time job, finds it incredibly beneficial. Through her job, she has made friends from various walks of life, gaining insight into different aspects of adult life. Initially, Lisa believed that work was the core of adult life, but after interacting with her friends, she realized that responsibility is the true foundation of adult life. Thanks to the information shared by her new friends, Lisa is now more confident about her future.Secondly, parents often warn students that adult life is far more demanding than school life. However, without experiencing it firsthand, it's challenging for students to fully comprehend the intensity of adult life. Part-time jobs can bridge this gap, teaching students about the realities of adult life. In fact, some surveys suggest that students who have held part-time jobs are better equipped to manage their time, prepare for their future, and have more realistic expectations compared to those who haven't had similar experiences. Consequently, part-time jobs can provide a deeper understanding of what to expect in the future.Thirdly, some parents worry that part-time jobs might negatively impact their child's studies. Nevertheless, most students undertake part-time jobs during their holidays, which doesn't interfere with their academic schedule. Compared to spending holidays playing video games or using computers, taking on a part-time job is a more productive and beneficial way for students to spend their break.In conclusion, engaging in part-time jobs allows students to experience and understand the realities of adult life. Therefore, parents should support and encourage their children to take on part-time jobs, as it prepares them for the challenges and responsibilities of adulthood.

question: Some students prefer to study alone. Others prefer to study with a group of students. Which do you prefer? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
human: Study achievements depend on a range of various factors, one of which is pattern of work you tend to choose while studying. In particular, we may prefer to work either within a team of other students or alone. As for me, I favor the latter because of the following reasons.To begin with, type of temper is one of the reasons that make me to choose individual work instead of team one. Being by nature introvert, I have to spend much time and efforts on adjusting to surroundings and especially new people. Once, when I was working on presentation with strangers, I sat aside and so prepared more than half of work myself instead of making attempts to get acquainted with unknown people. Therefore, my productivity boosts when style of work is appropriate with my type of temper.Furthermore/moreover, working alone allows me to avoid spending time and efforts on many things that are an integral part of teamwork. In other words, I must not divide tasks and duties between team members, share responsibility and benefits, and spend time on teambuilding. These advantages are especially important in situations of shortage of time. About a year ago I was lucky to become a participant of student brainstorming game. To my rivals' surprise, being the only member of my own "team" I gained a victory.In conclusion, from my point of view, type of temper and advantages of individual work are the most persuasive arguments in favor of studying alone.
llm: The level of achievement in one's studies is influenced by a multitude of factors, with the pattern of work being a significant one. When it comes to studying, individuals often prefer either collaborative work within a team or solo effort. Personally, I lean towards the latter for several compelling reasons.Firstly, my temperament plays a crucial role in this preference. As a natural introvert, I require considerable time and effort to adjust to new environments and people. This was evident when I once had to work on a presentation with unfamiliar individuals; instead of attempting to get acquainted with them, I opted to work independently, completing more than half of the task on my own. This experience showed me that my productivity increases substantially when my work style aligns with my temperament.Moreover, working alone enables me to bypass the time and effort invested in aspects inherent to teamwork, such as delegating tasks, sharing responsibilities and benefits, and engaging in team-building activities. These benefits are particularly noteworthy in situations where time is scarce. For instance, I participated in a student brainstorming competition about a year ago, and to the surprise of my competitors, I emerged victorious as a solo participant.In conclusion, from my perspective, both my temperament and the advantages of individual work serve as the most convincing arguments in favor of studying alone. This method not only enhances my productivity but also allows for a more efficient use of time, leading to better academic outcomes.

question: Some people prefer to work for themselves or own a business. Others prefer to work for an employer. Would you rather be self-employed, work for someone else, or own a business? Use specific reasons to explain your choice.
human: Most people want to work for an employer, because they want to feel secure about their salary, or feel comfortable about other problems of having own job such as paying tax, worrying about selling, etc. Despite these problems, personally, I would prefer to have my own job. My arguments are listed as follows. First, time is the more valuable thing, which I have in my life. By having my own business, I can manage my own time. I could work whenever I want, or I do not need to give reasons to my boss for a delay. I can arrange time to travel when I would like. In addition, I can work long hours for earning more money. Totally, the most important reason for me to be self-employed is the sense of free. Moreover, earning money is the fundamental reason that why people work. The amount of money is always the most important criterion for everyone to choose a job. If I work for other people, I have to give my ideas to employers cheaply. Therefore, I never have been rich in my life, because my salary is not dramatically changed. In spite of many problems of having own business, I can earn more money based on my creativity and personal ideas. To sum up, in spite of the fact that many people are not eager to work for themselves, I would like to run my own business to control my own time, and to earn more money based on my noble ideas.
llm: While many individuals prefer to work for an employer due to the perceived security and comfort it provides, such as a stable salary and fewer worries about taxes, sales, and other entrepreneurial challenges, I personally would prefer to be my own boss. My reasons for this preference are as follows.First and foremost, time is the most valuable resource I have, and having my own business allows me to manage it effectively. As my own boss, I have the freedom to work at my own pace, take time off when I please, and travel without needing to justify my schedule to anyone. I can also put in extra hours to increase my earnings, giving me a sense of autonomy and flexibility. For me, the ability to be self-employed is synonymous with freedom.Additionally, earning a good income is a fundamental motivator for most people when choosing a career path. The amount of money one earns is often the top consideration. When working for someone else, I feel that my ideas and skills are undervalued and undercompensated. As a result, my salary has never increased significantly, limiting my financial growth. In contrast, having my own business enables me to capitalize on my creativity and innovative ideas, allowing me to earn more money and achieve financial stability.In conclusion, despite the fact that many people are hesitant to venture out on their own, I am drawn to the idea of running my own business, which would grant me control over my time and the potential to earn a higher income based on my unique ideas and hard work.

question: Should a city try to preserve its old, historic buildings or destroy them and replace them with modern buildings? use specific reasons and examples to support your opinion.
human: It is important for any city to replace old buildings with new ones, but these revolutions should not include historic buildings. The historic buildings show the history of our ancestors. In addition, they can develop tourism industries by attracting tourists. Historic buildings answer many questions, which are mysterious about our previous ancestors; thereby no one can determine the price of the historic buildings. They show the history of nations and previous generations who lived in the city. They show the lifestyle of people who lived in thousands of years ago. They show us how they survive, or how they defend themselves etc. By investigating about their structures, we can understand how much they knew about the architecture of building. In the other hand, historic buildings are important treasures, which provide an area to learn valuable lessons. Another advantage of historic buildings is their capabilities to attract more tourists to the city. It is interesting for most people to know about the way people live in thousands years ago. Therefore, It is a valuable opportunities for any city having historic buildings to show them to new visitors. Historic building can develop other industries such as restaurants or other food industries and handicrafts shops and so on. These are reasons that why we should preserve historic buildings in the city. They can benefit us financially by developing other industries. Moreover, they are the symbols of our nations, which can show the historical culture of our previous ancestors.
llm: It is crucial for cities to undergo urban renewal by replacing outdated buildings with new ones, but this process should exclude historic buildings. These structures hold significant cultural and historical value, serving as a window into the past and providing insight into the lives of our ancestors. They attract tourists, foster the development of tourism industries, and offer a unique opportunity for visitors to learn about the history and culture of a city.Historic buildings are invaluable resources that provide answers to questions about our collective past, shedding light on the mysteries of previous generations. They showcase the architectural knowledge, lifestyle, and survival strategies of people who lived thousands of years ago. By examining their structures, we can gain a deeper understanding of the architectural expertise of our ancestors. Moreover, historic buildings are treasured repositories of knowledge, offering valuable lessons about the past and its cultural significance.One of the significant advantages of preserving historic buildings is their ability to draw tourists, thereby boosting local economies. Many people are fascinated by the prospect of learning about ancient civilizations and ways of life. This presents a valuable opportunity for cities with historic buildings to showcase their heritage to new visitors. The presence of historic buildings can also stimulate the growth of related industries, such as restaurants, food establishments, handicraft shops, and other cultural venues.In conclusion, preserving historic buildings is essential for several reasons. Not only do they offer financial benefits by fostering the development of tourism and related industries, but they also serve as symbols of national heritage, embodying the historical culture and traditions of our ancestors. It is our responsibility to protect and conserve these invaluable assets for future generations, ensuring that the historical and cultural significance of our cities remains intact.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Parents are the best teachers. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
human: Learning is a thing that we do in all of our lives. Getting the best lessons, besides our abilities to self-study, depends on our teachers a lot. There are people who believe that no one else is better than our parents in terms of teachers. I whole-heartedly agree with this opinion because of these following reasons.Firstly, parents are our teachers from the very early time in our life. As we were born, parents taught us from the very little things such as how to smile, how to walk to the ordinary routines such as eating. Moreover, when we grow bigger, they teach us many fairy tales and several important ethic lessons that affect us till the end of our lives.Secondly, at school we study bigger things about sciences and languages, but after school we learn from our parents. In my opinion, we spend most of our time at home with our families than it at school. I think when we leave school, maybe we will forget parts of the lessons we learn at school if we do not experience them in life, but I strongly believe we will never forget what our parents have taught us because we use it every day. For example, I believe I will never forget what my parents told me about how to be grateful to other people who help me.Thirdly, I totally believe parents love their sons or daughters unconditionally. Therefore, even when we grow older, get married and then have our own families with spouses and children, parents always keep watching us and help us to realize which is right and which is wrong in life. For instance, my older brother has got married and lived independently for two years but when he faces difficulties in his work or his life, he comes back to meet our parents and ask for advice.To conclude, I strongly believe that parents are our best teachers.
llm: Learning is a lifelong process, and receiving the best education, in addition to our ability to self-study, heavily relies on our teachers. Many people argue that parents are the most effective teachers, and I completely agree with this viewpoint for the following reasons.First and foremost, parents are our initial teachers from a very early age. From birth, they instruct us in fundamental skills such as smiling, walking, and basic routines like eating. As we grow older, they share numerous fairy tales and essential ethical lessons that have a lasting impact on our lives.Secondly, while we learn more complex subjects like science and language at school, our parents continue to educate us outside of the classroom. In my opinion, we spend a significant amount of time at home with our families, surpassing the time spent at school. Although we may forget certain school lessons if we don't apply them in real-life situations, I firmly believe that the lessons our parents teach us will stay with us forever, as we utilize them daily. For instance, the importance of gratitude towards those who help us, as taught by my parents, is a lesson I will never forget.Thirdly, I strongly believe that parents' unconditional love for their children enables them to provide guidance and support throughout our lives. Even as we mature, get married, and start our own families, our parents remain a constant source of wisdom, helping us distinguish right from wrong. My older brother, who has been living independently for two years, still seeks advice from our parents when faced with challenges in his career or personal life.In conclusion, I firmly believe that parents are indeed our best teachers, providing us with invaluable lessons and guidance that shape us into the individuals we become.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Workers would be much happier if they are doing different types of tasks during their workday than doing the same task.
human: In my family, the argument topic between my father and mother always involves my father's job. Five years ago, he quitted his 20 years job as an architectural engineer, and became a landscape painter. Every time I asked him why, he will say, seriously," I am done, doing this same work for 20 years and I really want to try some different, that is all." While there are innumerous people will deem it ridiculous and argue doing the same task is the meaning of job, but from my perspective, I am on the side of my father.Most of workers have adapted to do same task. It allows us to achieve more. As a authoritative dentist in my province, my mother has worked for 25 years. Gandhi devoted his whole life to fight against British-ruled government and inspire movements for civil rights in India, finally he became the father of the nation. These examples make it obvious that great achievement needs someone keen on one task for long time. While when it comes to "happier", different type of jobs can be responsible factor.Doing different tasks makes employees and employers much happier. Workers, who work for an ordinary company or industry, will be sick of same tasks day by day. Although they can be familiar with their job, changing of job is what serve to their happier. Changing the type of work will be fresh and elicit their potential to adapt a new environment, which, according to psychology theories, makes workers relaxed and happier. To set another example, consider every workers have ability to do several kinds of work, employers will be satisfied by the generating benefits. They both will be happy because the change of job, not the same task day by day.Different types of tasks during workday brings more challenges, making life colorful. Just like a song, if I did not have challenge, life would be blue. As an engineering researcher, I will surely be disappointed for failure, and exited for new challenges.
