New challenges from different tasks amounts far more than more works, it also means through dealing with it, I will obtain more knowledge and experience. As the saying of a Chinese writer, the color of life is rooted not in Japanese cherry blossom or Canadian maple leaf, but rather there always exists new things and challenge. After all, doing same task day and night just server to increase our psychological burden, connecting with different types of job is capable give us more colors to our life.To sum up, I admire my father's choice, while the same task give us opportunities to be an expert, like my mom, I still hold the firm view that different types of tasks endow more colors to our life.
llm: In my family, the most debated topic between my parents is my father's career change. Five years ago, he left his 20-year job as an architectural engineer to become a landscape painter. Whenever I ask him why, he responds seriously, "I'm done doing the same work for 20 years, and I really want to try something different, that's all." While many people might think this decision is ridiculous, arguing that doing the same task is the essence of a job, I side with my father.Most workers adapt to doing the same tasks, which allows them to achieve more. For instance, my mother, a renowned dentist in our province, has worked for 25 years. Similarly, Gandhi dedicated his life to fighting against the British-ruled government and inspiring civil rights movements in India, eventually becoming the father of the nation. These examples illustrate that great achievements often require someone to focus on one task for a long time. However, when it comes to happiness, having different types of jobs can be a contributing factor.Doing different tasks can make employees and employers much happier. Workers who do the same tasks day in and day out can become bored and unhappy. Although they may be familiar with their job, changing tasks can bring freshness and elicit their potential to adapt to a new environment, which, according to psychological theories, makes workers more relaxed and happier. Furthermore, if workers have the ability to do various kinds of work, employers can benefit from the generated benefits, making both parties happy due to the change in tasks.Having different types of tasks during the workday brings more challenges, making life more colorful. Just like a song, without challenges, life would be dull. As an engineering researcher, I would be disappointed by failure, but excited by new challenges. New challenges from different tasks provide more opportunities to gain knowledge and experience. As a Chinese writer once said, the color of life comes not from material things, but from the existence of new challenges and experiences. In the end, doing the same task day and night only serves to increase our psychological burden, while connecting with different types of jobs can add more colors to our life.In conclusion, I admire my father's choice. While doing the same task can provide opportunities to become an expert, like my mother, I firmly believe that different types of tasks add more colors to our life.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the statement, in order to succed in doing a new job, the ability to adapt oneself in a new environment is more important than excellent knowledge of this job.
human: With the rapid development of economy, the controversial of good worker's requirement is always in a limelight. A large number of people will say the ability to adapt oneself to a new environment is necessary, because it is the basic communication skill for a new worker. From my perspective, there is only one thing would be beneficial to company, and there is only one way to be an outstanding worker, that is possessing excellent knowledge of this job. That's why I believe that the excellent knowledge of this job will be more significant.Admittedly, the ability to adapt oneself to the new environment has been proven to be part of job. This ability is helpful in communicating with other workmates, cooperating with other workers needs this ability, too. But working alone is a longer-term job than communicating, that is, the ability of adapting oneself to a new environment may be necessary for a fresh worker, but the excellent knowledge of this job will be benefit till one leave. The company will benefit from every worker of excellent knowledge. The core and most profitable technology of an IT company is invented by a worker with excellent computer knowledge, not a worker with outstanding communicating skill. The high reputation and popularity of a company is earned by some brilliant workers in public relation department with excellent skill to propagate this company. So the company will earn more money and reputation from these workers with excellent knowledge. Employees will obtain reward from hard-work pursuing excellent knowledge. Through our whole study life, undergraduate and graduate, we keep learning with the purpose of exerting these knowledge and experience on our job, just like an old Chinese scholar said, the essence of study is utilizing it. After we get a job, the destination of we keep accumulating and collecting knowledge is rooted not in fawn on our manager with the ability to adapt this kind of business culture, but in making us excellent and totally master this job. Finally, we will be rewarded with pride. That's why we can obtain reward from out excellent knowledge.To sum up, I would have to say that although we can use the ability of adapting oneself in a new environment, the excellent knowledge will be of more importance. Because it can not only benefit our employers, but also ourselves will be rewarded.
llm: The rapid growth of the economy has brought the debate about the essential qualities of a good worker into the spotlight. Many people argue that the ability to adapt to a new environment is crucial, as it is a fundamental communication skill for new employees. However, from my perspective, there is only one factor that truly benefits a company and sets a worker apart: possessing in-depth knowledge of their job. I firmly believe that excellent job knowledge is the most significant attribute.Admittedly, adapting to a new environment is an important aspect of any job, as it facilitates communication and cooperation with colleagues. Nevertheless, I would argue that working independently and mastering one's craft is a more long-term and valuable skill. While adapting to a new environment may be necessary for new employees, excellent job knowledge will continue to benefit them throughout their career.Companies greatly benefit from employees with excellent job knowledge. The most innovative and profitable technologies are often developed by workers with in-depth expertise, rather than those with exceptional communication skills. Similarly, a company's reputation and popularity are often built by skilled workers in public relations who effectively promote the company. As a result, companies can earn more revenue and recognition from employees with excellent knowledge.Employees who pursue excellent job knowledge are also likely to be rewarded for their hard work. Throughout our academic careers, from undergraduate to graduate studies, we strive to acquire knowledge and experience that we can apply to our jobs. As an old Chinese scholar once said, "The essence of study is to utilize it." After securing a job, our continued pursuit of knowledge is driven not by a desire to impress our managers or adapt to the company culture, but by a desire to master our craft and become exceptional in our field. Ultimately, this dedication to excellence will earn us a sense of pride and recognition.In conclusion, while adapting to a new environment is a valuable skill, I firmly believe that excellent job knowledge is more important. Not only does it benefit our employers, but it also brings personal rewards and recognition. By prioritizing the development of our job knowledge, we can set ourselves up for long-term success and make a meaningful contribution to our companies.

question: Some people say that computers have made life easier and more convenient. Other people say that computers have made life more complex and stressful. What is your opinion? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
human: Computers have revolutionized our lifestyle during last century. However, some people especially young ones use computers extremely and this excessive usage lead to increase stress among them, but computers have brought many advantages to our lives. From my point of view, computers have an important and inevitable role in economic, business, and other part of societies. In addition, they make the way of living easier by doing our routine duties. Admittedly, by using computers in many industries human's role has been reduced. Nowadays, computer can control and perform some routine activities in industries, which were early done by human. Many industries use computers to command to robots in order to do many regular tasks, which were carried out by human early. For example, many processes of production of cars are carrying out by robots, which are controlled by computers. In addition, car companies use computers to simulate and analyze car accident by computers. Despite many advantages, by coming computers many jobs has been vanished. A large number of industries fire many forces because of doing their works by new technologies and computers. Computers have an important role in social and personal life. Computers have opened up a network connection among people. This technology makes easier for people to send and receive personal message. Teenagers and adolescents spend free time in front of computers. Moreover, People can use computers to extract their essential information easily. By contrast, excessive use of computers has brought many difficulties. The results show that teenagers who are addicted to computer games show more violent and stressful behaviors. People who have type by computers may suffer from such disease related to knees. By considering all reasons, advantages of computers outweigh disadvantages. People benefit more from coming computers into their lives. In addition, computers can do most difficult tasks which leads to make life easier.
llm: The advent of computers in the last century has revolutionized our way of life. While some individuals, particularly the younger generation, tend to overuse computers, leading to increased stress levels, the benefits of computers to our lives are undeniable. In my opinion, computers play a vital and indispensable role in the economic, business, and social spheres of our society. They have also simplified our daily lives by automating routine tasks.It is acknowledged that the integration of computers in various industries has diminished the role of humans. Currently, computers can oversee and execute tasks that were previously performed by humans. Many industries utilize computers to control robots, which undertake tasks that were once carried out by humans. For instance, the production of cars is largely automated, with computers controlling robots that perform various tasks. Furthermore, car manufacturers use computers to simulate and analyze car accidents. Despite the numerous advantages, the advent of computers has led to job losses. The adoption of new technologies and computers has resulted in significant layoffs across various industries.Computers have a profound impact on both social and personal life. They have facilitated global connectivity among people, enabling easy communication through personal messages. Teenagers and adolescents often spend their free time using computers. Moreover, computers provide effortless access to essential information. However, excessive computer use has its drawbacks. Research indicates that teenagers addicted to computer games exhibit more violent and stressful behavior. Prolonged computer use can also lead to health issues, such as knee-related problems.Considering all aspects, the benefits of computers outweigh the drawbacks. The introduction of computers has greatly benefited people's lives, making difficult tasks more manageable and simplifying daily life. Overall, computers have had a profoundly positive impact on our lives, and their continued use is likely to bring about further improvements and conveniences.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement?Children should begin learning a foreign language as soon as they start school. Use specific reasons and examples to support your position.
human: Learning a foreign language is necessary for children to strengthen their ability to learn. Whether children should start learning a foreign language as they start school or not might be a controversial issue. It seems to me that students should start learning that as they start school. Learning that not only help them to improve their minds and memories, but can extend their visions about the other countries. First, the ability of Learning in the childhood period is more powerful than other periods of life. Thereby students in the beginning of their education can learn faster and easier in compare to a young one to understand a foreign language. They can easily understand the language structure and memorize the vocabularies. It is out of of the questioned that the persistence of learning a knowledge in the childhood is more than other period of lives. By considering this and being aware of that students have not any responsibility and other difficulty in comparison with a young man, we can infer that why this time is the best time to learn any language.In addition, Learning a foreign language helps students tremendously to comprehend what happens in the around World. They would be able to understand other cultures and costumes. Moreover, It can give them a sense of power to communicate better with peers in other parts of the World. Having knowledge about other countries and their languages lead to extend the child's vision. Therefore, they would be able to develop their personalities and sense of reliance. Overall, it is easy to distinguish between a child having two languages and a child having just his native language while comparing their ability to communicate, understanding other studies, etc, to find that why children should start learning a foreign language in the beginning of the education.
llm: Acquiring a foreign language is essential for children to enhance their learning capabilities. The debate about whether children should begin learning a foreign language at the onset of their schooling is a contentious issue. However, I firmly believe that students should initiate foreign language learning as soon as they start school. This not only improves their cognitive abilities and memory but also broadens their understanding of other cultures and countries.Firstly, the capacity for learning during childhood is more pronounced than at any other stage of life. Consequently, students at the beginning of their educational journey can absorb and learn a foreign language more quickly and effortlessly compared to older learners. They can easily grasp the language structure and vocabulary, and the retention of knowledge acquired during childhood is notably higher than at other life stages. Considering the lack of responsibilities and distractions that older individuals face, it becomes evident that childhood is the optimal time for language acquisition.Moreover, learning a foreign language greatly enhances students' comprehension of global events and cultures. It enables them to understand and appreciate the customs and traditions of other countries, fostering a sense of empowerment to communicate more effectively with peers worldwide. Possessing knowledge of foreign languages and cultures expands a child's perspective, contributing to the development of their personality and self-reliance.In conclusion, the difference between a child who speaks two languages and one who only speaks their native language is palpable, particularly in terms of communication skills, academic understanding, and overall development. This disparity underscores the importance of introducing foreign language learning at the outset of a child's education, highlighting the numerous benefits that accrue from this early exposure.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Boys and girls should attend separate schools. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
human: Women or men almost need each other in full of life even in school. Although some experts believe that common schools for both female and male lead to diminish their efficiency in education, others view it as a helpful way to recognize the opposite gender. In my opinion, boys and girls should study together in the sense that they have a chance to know each other and learn how to behave with an opposite sex. School is a small society for students, which prepares them for the future life. By attending to the same school, students can learn how to view the opposite gender in classes as a friend or a classmate. In addition, a boy would know how to speak with a girl in every situation and vice versa. They would know how to ask her in order to cooperate with his study, how communicate with girls in a group, etc. Admittedly, when they study together and help each other, they exercise the the real life as they age. By contrast, some experts believe that attending both girls and boys in a same school cause many disadvantages for them. By doing this, outdoors relationships may expand and it may accompany with sexual relationship and as result, their thoughts deviate from the studies. Moreover, attending in the school having boys and girls might be beneficial for both to increase their motivation to study better. Boys and girls will try to show their capabilities and abilities in the class, therefore they will study increasingly. Indeed, Boys do not like to seem weak in front of girls and vice versa. As a result, the productivity of the class will be increased. In a word, attending boys and girls in a same school would bring many advantages. Taking part in the study groups would increase student's motivation to study more. In addition, they would be able to know the opposite gender, which help them to be prepared for the adult life where they almost will live or work together.
llm: In today's society, women and men need each other, even from a young age, including in school. While some experts argue that co-educational schools can hinder academic performance, others see it as a beneficial way to foster understanding and recognition between the sexes. In my opinion, boys and girls should study together, as it provides them with the opportunity to get to know each other and learn how to interact with the opposite sex.School is a microcosm of society, preparing students for future life. By attending the same school, students can learn to view members of the opposite sex as friends and classmates. Moreover, boys will learn how to communicate effectively with girls in various situations, and vice versa. They will develop essential social skills, such as cooperation, teamwork, and effective communication. As they study together and support each other, they will gain valuable experience that will serve them well as they mature. On the other hand, some experts believe that attending a co-educational school can have drawbacks. They argue that it may lead to distractions, outdoor relationships, and potentially even romantic or sexual relationships, which can divert attention away from academic pursuits.However, attending a school with both boys and girls can also have numerous benefits. It can motivate students to perform better academically, as they will strive to demonstrate their capabilities and abilities in class. Boys and girls will try to outdo each other, which will increase the overall productivity of the class. In conclusion, attending a co-educational school can bring numerous advantages. Participating in study groups will boost students' motivation to study, and they will gain valuable experience interacting with the opposite sex, preparing them for adult life, where they will likely work and live together.

question: Some people believe that success in life comes from taking risks or chances. Others believe that success results from careful planning. In your opinion, what does success come from? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
human: "The biggest risk is not taking any risk." The ones who have a big dream, they need to be brave and dare to live new situations. It is not guaranteed that you are going to achieve your dream if you had planned carefully as the same way when you take risks, but it is more frustrating if you had made plans and then it went wrong. Therefore, it is essential to take chances and believe this is going to work out. Assuming new opportunities is indispensable to have diverse experiences. In fact, life may not be easy; it will have various challenges especially when you take risks, but in the end, it can be surprisingly wonderful. For instance, some people abandon their job, family and friends and go to other country without knowing what the future holds for them. In the beginning, it can be tough to fit in this new place and find any opportunity, but after fighting against the obstacles blocking the way to get what is desired; it is possible to conquer what they are craving as well as start to build a new life in this other country. In fact, many people are afraid to take risks and fail. It is possible to get frustrate along the way, but it is vital to never give up on your dream. To illustrate, Walt Disney, whose career is famous, had a challenging life. One of the difficulties was some of his histories, such as Mickey Mouse and Three Little Pigs, were turned down. He heard lots of "no", furthermore one editor fired him alleging that he had no imagination, after all what he had gone through, he never stop chasing his dreams. To conclude, in this competitive world you have to be fearless and face all new situations. Even though sometimes you consider backing down and stay in the same routine that you are used to, it is necessary to have courage to take risks, be different and pursue your dream to have a successful life.
llm: The phrase "the biggest risk is not taking any risk" encapsulates the essence of pursuing one's dreams. For those with grand aspirations, bravery and the willingness to embrace new experiences are paramount. While meticulous planning does not guarantee success, and taking risks may lead to unforeseen outcomes, the act of taking chances and believing in one's vision is crucial. It is through assuming new opportunities and accumulating diverse experiences that life's true richness is discovered.Undoubtedly, life is replete with challenges, especially when one ventures into the unknown. However, the outcomes can be profoundly rewarding. Consider individuals who leave behind the familiarity of their jobs, families, and friends to embark on a journey to a foreign land, unaware of what the future holds. Initially, adapting to this new environment and uncovering opportunities can be daunting. Yet, after persevering through the obstacles that stand in the way of achieving their desires, it becomes possible to not only attain their goals but also to lay the foundations of a new life in this unfamiliar territory.Fear of failure and the reluctance to take risks are common hurdles that many face. While frustration is a possible companion on this journey, it is imperative to remain steadfast in the pursuit of one's dreams. The illustrious career of Walt Disney serves as a compelling example. Despite facing numerous rejections, including those of his iconic creations like Mickey Mouse and the Three Little Pigs, and even being fired with the damning criticism that he lacked imagination, Disney never relinquished his aspirations. His determination in the face of adversity is a testament to the rewards of unwavering dedication.In conclusion, thriving in this competitive world demands fearlessness and an openness to new situations. Even when the comfort of routine beckons, it is indispensable to muster the courage to take risks, differentiate oneself, and chase one's dreams. This audacity is the cornerstone of a successful and fulfilling life, where the act of embracing challenges and pursuing one's passions, despite the risks, leads to personal growth, unexpected opportunities, and the realization of one's deepest aspirations.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? People should sometimes do things that they do not enjoy doing. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
human: People should sometimes do things, even though they don't enjoy it. This is basic part of the lives. There may be small or big things, but at last people should accept them, because most of them is about responsibilities. Moreover, sometimes by doing things helps the people learn about live. In this essay, the reasons for why I agree that people should sometimes do things that they do not enjoy doing will be explored. Firstly, most people's lives are filled with tasks that they don't enjoy doing.In personal live, we have some responsibilities towards to other people, there is nobody who likes all of these responsibilities. For instance, housework is very difficult for me, although my husband helps me some of them, but it is my responsibility. I really don't like any of them, however I should do. Secondly,professional lives are filled with tasks that is neccessary parts of the jobs. Nobody likes attending boring conferences, or working a person who isn't well in with anyone. I'm a research asistant at a university, and as any of the univesity in ours we have a professor who isn't good at human relationships, most of the asistans don't enjoy to talk with him about any situation, although we have to ask about his field. Thirdly, doing something which an individual doesn't enjoy can led to enjoyment. People sometimes can attend any activities by insisting on any of their friends although they don't really want. For example, one of our friends tell my husband and me about a dance course which we both don't like. After insisting on some of our friends, we attended, and got really enjoyable time, we continued the course about six months although most of our friends left the course after a month.Nobody has a life with a lot of fun; there are sometimes unpleasant and boring parts which is not liked by anyone, but most of them are about responsibilities which is the part of individual's live.
llm: It is essential for people to occasionally engage in activities they do not enjoy, as this is an inherent part of life. These tasks may be small or significant, but ultimately, people must accept them, as they often revolve around responsibilities. Furthermore, undertaking unpleasant tasks can help individuals learn and grow. This essay will explore the reasons why I agree that people should sometimes do things they do not enjoy.Firstly, most people's lives are filled with tasks they do not enjoy. In their personal lives, individuals have responsibilities towards others, and it is rare to find someone who enjoys all of these responsibilities. For instance, I find household chores to be particularly challenging, despite my husband's help. Although I do not enjoy these tasks, I recognize that they are my responsibility and must be completed.Secondly, professional lives are also filled with necessary tasks that may not be enjoyable. Few people enjoy attending boring conferences or working with colleagues they do not get along with. As a research assistant at a university, I have experienced this firsthand. Our university has a professor who struggles with interpersonal relationships, and most assistants do not enjoy discussing their work with him. Nevertheless, we must still interact with him and seek his expertise.Thirdly, engaging in activities one does not enjoy can surprisingly lead to enjoyment. Sometimes, people may be persuaded by friends to participate in an activity they would not normally consider. For example, a friend encouraged my husband and me to join a dance course, which we were initially hesitant about. However, after some persuasion, we decided to attend, and to our surprise, we had a really enjoyable time. We continued with the course for six months, even after most of our friends had dropped out after a month.In conclusion, nobody's life is filled with constant fun and enjoyment. There are inevitably unpleasant and boring parts that nobody likes, but most of these are related to responsibilities that are an integral part of an individual's life.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? It is more important for the government to spend money on new buildings than to preserve historic or traditional buildings and homesÊ
human: The city where I was born used to be of a great antique beauty, which was surrounded with by lots of ancient style buildings. Unfortunately, the unstoppable trend of urbanization makes me only appreciate parts of those classic buildings in the pictures or in museums. In order to prevent the disappearance of the historic buildings, some citizens suggest the government to spend money on historic buildings. As far as I am concerned, we should do our parts to do what ever it takes to protect old buildings, letting next generations still have a chance to look at them. Here are some reasons and examples to illustrate my viewpoint. Historic buildings have intrinsic values, because they are significant symbols of a city. Old buildings are reminders of a city's culture and complexity. By seeing historic buildings -- whether related to something famous or recognizably dramatic, people are able to witness the aesthetic and cultural history of an area. For example, when somebody mentions Beijing, China's capital city, you will immediately have Capital Palace come to appear in your mind, because it is the most remarkable sign of the city, and also it is the inevitable history of Beijing, even the entire China. Depending on the study of Capital Palace, researchers have a comprehensive understanding of the history and the culture. Furthermore, historic buildings make our lives more colorful, provide places for citizens to relax bodies and minds. The city is occupied with an abundance of modern houses and and high buildings which make it crowded, and no rooms for people to relax themselves. However, the warmth of the materials, the heart pine, marble, or the old brick, all those old buildings features call back of our inner peace. Lying under the roof of a historic building or sitting on the desk fill with history are both easy ways to forget life's little annoyance and feel peaceful. Meanwhile, historic buildings can be a source of maintenance fees. There are many historic buildings, such as Beijing Place, Shanghai Artist Museum, they are all able to support themselves financially by charging tens of thousands of tourists. Our governments will be happy with those efficient consequences, and a majority of cities also can imitate this economical cycle. Overall, I believe that the city which I enjoy the most is a combination of history and modernity. However, the preservation of old buildings is a one-way street. There is no chance to renovate to save a history site once it's gone. This reality brings us to light the importance of locating and saving old buildings of historic significance. Therefore, government should spend money on preservation of old buildings.
llm: The city of my birth, once renowned for its exquisite antique beauty, was characterized by numerous ancient structures that surrounded it. Sadly, the relentless tide of urbanization has relegated my appreciation of these classic buildings to mere photographs and museum exhibits. To prevent the erosion of our historic heritage, some citizens propose that the government allocate funds to preserve these edifices. In my opinion, it is our collective responsibility to take all necessary measures to safeguard these structures, ensuring that future generations can still marvel at them. The following reasons and examples serve to illustrate my perspective.Historic buildings possess inherent value, as they are potent symbols of a city's identity. These structures serve as testaments to a city's rich cultural tapestry and complexity. By witnessing historic buildings, whether they are associated with famous events or exhibit dramatic architecture, individuals can gain insight into the aesthetic and cultural history of an area. For instance, the mere mention of Beijing, China's capital city, instantly conjures images of the Forbidden City, an iconic landmark that embodies the city's, and indeed the nation's, history. The study of the Forbidden City has provided researchers with a comprehensive understanding of China's history and culture.Moreover, historic buildings add a touch of vibrancy to our lives, offering citizens tranquil oases to unwind and rejuvenate. Modern cities, with their plethora of high-rises and crowded streets, often leave little room for relaxation. In contrast, the warmth and character of historic buildings, with their heart pine, marble, or old brick facades, evoke a sense of inner peace. Whether lounging beneath the roof of a historic building or sitting at a desk steeped in history, one can easily forget life's minor annoyances and bask in serenity.Furthermore, historic buildings can generate significant revenue through tourism. Iconic structures like the Forbidden City and the Shanghai Art Museum attract tens of thousands of visitors, thereby supporting themselves financially. This self-sustaining model can be emulated by other cities, yielding efficient economic outcomes that would delight governments. In conclusion, my ideal city is one that harmoniously blends history and modernity. However, the preservation of old buildings is a one-way process; once a historic site is lost, it can never be recreated. This sobering reality underscores the importance of identifying and preserving historic buildings. Consequently, I firmly believe that governments should invest in the preservation of these structures, thereby ensuring their legacy for generations to come.

question: Some young adults want independence from their parents as soon as possible. Other young adults prefer to live with their families for a longer time. Which of the solutions do you think is better? Use specific reasons and examples to support your opinion.
human: As young people gets older they tend to seek more freedom and want to live on their own. But, the issue of what is the right age for young adults to leave their parents and start living on their own is a contentious one. Personally, I believe that young adults should live with their parents for a longer period of time.Living on your own is a huge financial commitment. At younger age people are less likely to get a high paying job, so It can be a difficult task to pay for rent, food, utilities and other expenses to sustain yourself. So, I believe that living with parents is a wise choice for adults until they get a head start to their professional career with a reasonable income.Another advantage of living with parents for a longer period of time is the enhanced emotional attachment with them. Parents have valuable advice to their children as they go through the changes in their adult life. Living together develops the environment of discussing adult's physiological and psychological changes face to face with their parents. Young adults will feel reluctant to discuss such problems with their parents if they move out and live on their own, and thus missing the valuable input of their parents.While some critics may argue that, young adults living with parents will not be free to do what they want. However, I believe that most young adults are inclined to take unprecedented advantages of the freedom they have. It is good thing if living with parents does not give freedom for young people to party all night, smoke or do drugs. In a nutshell, I believe that young adults should only consider living on their own only after they are sure they could sustain on their own. It is unwise to trade the opportunity of living with parents for a longer period of time for some late night parties or drugs. Thus, to cope with the physiological and psychological changes of adult life, to make financial life a less struggle and to prevent oneself digress from their destined path, it is important for young adults to live with their parents for a longer period of time.
llm: As young people mature, they often seek greater independence and desire to live on their own. However, the question of when it's appropriate for young adults to leave their parents' home and start living independently is a topic of debate. In my opinion, I think it's beneficial for young adults to live with their parents for an extended period.Living on one's own requires significant financial responsibility. At a younger age, individuals are less likely to secure high-paying jobs, making it challenging to cover expenses such as rent, food, utilities, and other necessities. Therefore, I believe that living with parents is a prudent decision for young adults until they establish a stable career with a reasonable income.Another advantage of living with parents for a longer period is the strengthened emotional bond between them. Parents offer valuable guidance and advice as their children navigate the challenges of adulthood. Living together fosters an environment where young adults can openly discuss their physiological and psychological changes with their parents. If they move out and live on their own, they may feel hesitant to discuss such issues, thereby missing out on their parents' valuable insights.Some critics may argue that living with parents restricts young adults' freedom. Nevertheless, I believe that many young adults are prone to taking unnecessary risks with the freedom they have. It's actually beneficial if living with parents limits their freedom to engage in destructive behaviors like partying all night, smoking, or using drugs.In essence, I believe that young adults should only consider living on their own when they're confident in their ability to sustain themselves financially. It's unwise to sacrifice the opportunity to live with parents for a longer period in exchange for fleeting experiences like late-night parties or substance use. To navigate the challenges of adulthood, manage financial struggles, and stay focused on their goals, it's essential for young adults to live with their parents for an extended period.

question: Nowadays the way many people interact with each other has changed because of technology. In what ways has technology affected the types of relationships people make? Has this become a positive or negative development.
human: Nowadays, the Earth has become like a small village. In the course of the last hundred years, the way majority of people communicate with each other has been altered significantly because of technology. But there are vast amount of disputes whether it is positive or negative. From my point of view, this development was a very positive one in spite of its some drawbacks.To begin with, nowadays, to keep in touch with loved ones in faraway places has become easy than ever. Technology revolutionized the way we communicate and in present, it is almost possible to do everything without tete-a-tete. By means of some software such as Skype, MSN, Whatsapp we can get in touch with everybody whenever we want. For example, in earlier times, people didn't leave for faraway places, because they could easily get lost. This is also one salient prove that the development of technology was a very positive.Further, by means of some communication tools, it has become very easy to make new friends. According to statistics, 40% of people met even their life partners via Internet. In this sense, Internet is a basic tool to keep in touch with old and make new friends.However, the other side of the coin is that, by communicating via Internet or phone, we cannot express our ideas and feelings fully, because during such conversations, some of our words can make a completely different sense. As a result, the rate of divorces is increasing day by day. By way of conclusion, I once again restate my position that the development of technology impacted on the means of communication among people very positively by making it easier and more comfortable.
llm: The world has shrunk to the size of a small village in recent times. Over the past century, technological advancements have drastically changed the way people communicate, sparking a heated debate about whether this shift is beneficial or detrimental. From my perspective, I firmly believe that this development has been overwhelmingly positive, despite some notable drawbacks.First and foremost, technology has made it easier than ever to stay in touch with loved ones who live far away. The communication revolution has made it possible to accomplish almost everything without face-to-face interaction. With the help of software like Skype, MSN, and Whatsapp, we can connect with anyone, anytime. For instance, in the past, people were hesitant to travel to distant places due to the risk of getting lost. This highlights the significant positive impact of technological development.Moreover, communication tools have simplified the process of making new friends. Statistics show that 40% of people have met their life partners online, demonstrating the internet's role as a fundamental tool for maintaining old relationships and forging new ones.On the other hand, there is a downside to relying on internet or phone communication, as it can limit our ability to fully express our thoughts and emotions. Misinterpretations can occur when our words are taken out of context, leading to an increase in divorce rates.In conclusion, I reiterate my stance that the development of technology has had a profoundly positive impact on the way people communicate, making it more convenient and accessible. Despite some drawbacks, the benefits of technological advancements in communication far outweigh the costs.

question: With the increasing use and development of new technology, many machines are now able to do the work which people used to perform. What are the advantages and disadvantages of this trend?
human: The issue of whether using of machine are bring many advantages to society is of great concern to many people. In my opinion, although using machines have many benefits, we cannot ignore its negative effects.It is undoubted that machines can bring many benefits. For one thing, machines are more effective than human. Not like human, machines do not need rest, which means they can work as long as employers want and consistently produce high quality products without any mistakes. For another, using machines can save company's money. Because machines never ask for salary, over-time pay or pension, so employers do not need to spend money on employee's welfare. The company only needs some technicians to make sure machines are working on the right track or replace some part when machines are not working. However, the disadvantages of machines that bring to us should not be neglected by people. To start with, because of extensive of using machines, many people loss their job. Especially in large population countries, high unemployment rate may cause crime and social instability. Apart from this, using of machines are also pose serious pollution and energy dissipation. For example, nowadays people prefer to use dish-washing machine to wash dishes and plates rather than hand washing. But they did not know that compared with hand washing dish-washing machine consume at least 2 times water and electricity to wash these tableware. As you can imagine, if thousands of families use dish-washing machines, how many water and how much electricity will be wasted!In conclusion, although we cannot deny machines are play a vital role in people living and working, problems posed by machines should draws more attentions as well.
llm: The debate about whether the use of machines brings numerous advantages to society is a pressing concern for many individuals. In my opinion, while utilizing machines has several benefits, it is crucial that we do not overlook their negative consequences.Undoubtedly, machines offer many advantages. Firstly, machines are more efficient than humans, as they do not require rest, enabling them to work continuously and produce high-quality products without errors. Additionally, the use of machines can help companies save money, as they do not demand salaries, overtime pay, or pensions, thereby reducing employers' expenditure on employee welfare. The only requirement is for some technicians to ensure machines are functioning correctly and replace parts when necessary.However, the drawbacks of machines should not be disregarded. Primarily, the widespread use of machines has led to significant job losses, particularly in countries with large populations, where high unemployment rates can lead to crime and social instability. Furthermore, machine usage poses serious environmental concerns, including pollution and energy wastage. For instance, the use of dishwashing machines, which consume at least twice the amount of water and electricity as hand washing, can result in substantial waste if thousands of households rely on them.In conclusion, although machines play a vital role in our daily lives and work, the problems they pose should also receive due attention. It is essential to strike a balance between the benefits and drawbacks of machine usage to ensure that their use is sustainable and responsible.

question: In the last 20 years there have been significant developments in the field of information technology (IT), for example, the World Wide Web and communication by email. However, future developments in IT are likely to have more negative effects than positive. To what extent do you agree with this view?
human: Decade after decade, every day, scientists discover magnificent devices in the field of IT, such as interactive boards, multicore computers and laptops, tablets, which have an incredible resolution and also mobile phones, which have the power of a computer. World Wide Web and communication via email are some of the positive sides of information technology, however, there are some negative aspects.Firstly, connecting people by email is easy and fast. In addition, World Wide Web offers humanity to access to information, which they want to know for less than 10 seconds. These are two of the benefits, why IT is useful.Besides, nowadays technology is entering into our society really quick and scientists develop robots, which help people cope with their problems or just invent coffee machines, engines with integrated computers and etc. For example, before centeries, there were not washing machines, which clean your clothes, while a person do another job.Secondly, there are some drawbacks about this issue. Scientists believe that one day people will face their developments, for instance robots, and they will not succeed to control them. All this inventions will try to take control of the Earth.In conclusion, I agree that IT discoveries are likely to have more disadvantages than benefits and people should know how to use their developments properly.
llm: Over the years, scientists have been continually discovering remarkable devices in the field of information technology, such as interactive boards, multicore computers, laptops, tablets with incredible resolution, and mobile phones that possess the power of a computer. While the World Wide Web and communication via email are some of the positive aspects of information technology, there are also some negative consequences to consider.On the one hand, the benefits of IT are numerous. For instance, connecting people through email is both easy and fast. Moreover, the World Wide Web provides humanity with rapid access to information, allowing individuals to find what they need to know in under 10 seconds. These are just a couple of the advantages that make IT so useful.Furthermore, technology is rapidly integrating into our society, with scientists developing innovations like robots that assist people in solving their problems, as well as inventing coffee machines, engines with integrated computers, and more. For example, before centuries, there were no washing machines that could clean clothes while a person worked on another task, showcasing how IT has improved daily life.On the other hand, there are drawbacks to this technological advancement. Some scientists fear that one day, people will face challenges in controlling their own developments, such as robots, which could potentially try to dominate the Earth. This raises concerns about the long-term implications of IT discoveries.In conclusion, while acknowledging the benefits, I agree that IT discoveries may have more disadvantages than advantages. Therefore, it is crucial for people to understand how to properly utilize these technological developments to avoid potential negative outcomes.

question: Many people believe that media coverage of celebrities is having a negative effect on children. To what extent do you agree or disagree with this opinion?
human: Today, celebrities appear to become a spotlight of the mass media. Almost half of the news coverage on television and the Internet is devoted to the celebrity gossip. Not surprisingly, many people are worried that this attention to the famous people has an impact on them, especially on their children. This essay will compare both negative and positive consequences of this effect on infants.Fame is a great responsibility for public people as their admirers are very sensitive to any acts of their idols. Celebrity scandals and gossips can quickly reach the public which perceive it very negatively. This means that celebrities who received attention for overuse of drugs or alcohol are likely to get public disgrace. Therefore, children may see that this behavior is inexcusable.On the other hand, too much news coverage to famous people seems to have a negative influence on the choice of children of their future professions. As recent surveys showed, inspired by the fame and wealth, children now prefer more to become an actor/actress or a sports star than it was in the past. Many schools for preparation of so-called stars and various advertisements about famous people may mislead with the fact that this profession is highly required and easy reachable. This may confuse children who should not choose their future job because of the influence of the mass media, but from the basis of their own interests.In conclusion, parents should be more worried about their children's attitudes to the 'cult of celebrity'. They should teach their children how to distinguish shortcoming stars from truly talented ones and to put right priorities in life.
llm: The modern era has catapulted celebrities into the spotlight, with nearly half of all news coverage on television and the internet focusing on celebrity gossip. This has raised concerns among many, particularly parents, about the potential impact of this attention on their children. This essay aims to explore both the positive and negative effects of celebrity culture on young minds.Being in the public eye is a significant responsibility, as fans are highly sensitive to their idols' actions. Celebrity scandals and gossip spread rapidly, often being perceived negatively by the public. For instance, celebrities involved in drug or alcohol abuse scandals are likely to face public disapproval, which can serve as a lesson to children that such behavior is unacceptable.On the other hand, excessive media coverage of celebrities seems to have a detrimental influence on children's career aspirations. Recent surveys indicate that, inspired by the glamour and wealth associated with fame, many children now aspire to become actors, actresses, or sports stars, more so than in the past. The plethora of schools aimed at grooming future stars and advertisements featuring famous individuals may mislead children into believing that these professions are not only highly sought after but also easily attainable. This could confuse children, leading them to choose careers based on media influence rather than their own interests and aptitudes.In conclusion, it is imperative for parents to be vigilant about their children's perception of celebrity culture. They should guide their children in distinguishing between celebrities who are truly talented and those who are merely famous for their shortcomings. Moreover, parents should help their children prioritize their values and aspirations, ensuring that they make life choices based on their own potential and interests, rather than the glamour and allure of celebrity lifestyles.

question: Some people argue that the technology such as mobile phone (cell phone) destroys social interaction. Do you agree or disagree?
human: Recently, there has been a social concern in regards to whether mobile phones have a negative effect in our social communication. Indeed, mobile phones have been widely used for people of all ages, bringing convenience and entertainment into our life. However, as far as I am concerned, I strongly agree with the view that this great invention causes many social problems.In the first place, spending too much time on phones may exert adverse effects on social life. In the first place, as people increasingly tend to focus and relay on phones, they may lose their interest on daily activities like meeting with their friends so that distraction may be developed during study or social activities. Moreover, continuous use of mobile phone may damage both eyesight and physical posture of the children.Furthermore, there are many types of games available in the phone and many of them are very aggressive in nature such as "Iron man". In those games, children are rewarded for being more violent, and this violence is repeated again and again. For instance, many games involve children helping their character to kill or shoot, which many lead to increased aggressive feelings, thoughts and behaviours. Therefore, the hardship of communication may be developed.However, other people may perceive this issue from different viewpoint. With rapid development of the internet, people are able to enjoy quick electronic communication via internet. For instance, as lots of chatting apps available online such as "Weichat", people tend to send instant messages free of charge by using their phones rather than face to face communication. Therefore, mobile phones have shortened the distance of communication.After having considered all the problems that I have discussed above, we can finally draw a conclusion that although mobile phones brings convenience of communication, they also contribute to some social problems.
llm: In recent years, the impact of mobile phones on social communication has become a topic of concern. While mobile phones have become an indispensable part of daily life, offering convenience and entertainment to people of all ages, I firmly believe that they also give rise to numerous social issues.Firstly, excessive phone use can have detrimental effects on social interactions. As individuals become increasingly reliant on their phones, they may lose interest in everyday activities, such as meeting friends, leading to distractions during studies or social events. Prolonged mobile phone use can also harm children's eyesight and physical posture.Moreover, many mobile games, like "Iron Man", promote aggressive behavior, rewarding children for violence and repetition. These games often involve killing or shooting, which can foster aggressive feelings, thoughts, and behaviors, ultimately hindering effective communication.On the other hand, some people argue that mobile phones have bridged the communication gap. With the rapid development of the internet, instant messaging apps like "Weichat" enable users to send free messages, reducing the need for face-to-face interaction. This has, in effect, shortened the distance between individuals.After weighing the pros and cons, it can be concluded that while mobile phones offer convenient communication, they also contribute to social problems. Ultimately, it is crucial to strike a balance between the benefits and drawbacks of mobile phone use to maintain healthy social interactions.

question: Modern forms of communication such as email and messaging have reduced the amount of time people spend seeing their friends. This has had a negative effect on their social lives. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
human: Undoubtedly, the movement of modern forms of communication has changed better, which help people to interact to others, such as email and messaging without limitation time. I totally agree that using of these soft devices have cut much of time people need to see with their relatives. However, it is had some demerits on their social lives.Mentioned to societies life style, they constantly use these kinds of electronic letter for making fellowship or just continuing theirs what they already had. Obviousness, there are other ways like social media that they could to use it for meeting theirs buddies such as Twitter and Facebook, also make the communication become feasible and limitless of time.Another perspective, using of these facilities has influenced netizens to keep themselves becoming unsociable. It caused they were swept away by virtual atmosphere, so they do not do much social live interactions with others. The consequence of this case made some people become geek, as too much of using email and messaging, without direct contacts. However, people have had own minded to keep connection with their friends as a good relationship, meet them and talk by face to face directly.In conclusion, I admittedly and strongly agree that the merits of email and messaging have reduced amount of ours time to communicate to. Besides, we need to make sure for the real gathering with our colleague.
llm: The advent of modern communication forms has undoubtedly revolutionized the way people interact with each other, anytime and without time constraints. Email and messaging services are prime examples of such advancements. I completely agree that these tools have significantly reduced the time people need to spend with their relatives to stay in touch. However, their extensive use also has some drawbacks on social lives.In today's society, people frequently rely on these electronic means to form and maintain connections. Clearly, other platforms like social media, including Twitter and Facebook, offer additional avenues for meeting friends and making communication both feasible and limitless in terms of time.From another perspective, the use of these digital facilities has led to a trend where individuals become less sociable. Being engulfed in the virtual world, they tend to avoid direct social interactions with others. This has resulted in some individuals becoming overly reliant on digital communication, lacking face-to-face interactions due to excessive use of email and messaging. Nonetheless, many people maintain the importance of personal connections, recognizing the value in meeting friends and engaging in direct conversations to foster good relationships.In conclusion, I strongly agree that the benefits of email and messaging have reduced the time required for communication. Nonetheless, it's crucial to ensure we balance this with real, in-person gatherings with colleagues and friends to maintain a healthy and well-rounded social life.

question: Some people think that a sense of competition in children should be encouraged. Other believe that children who are taught to co-operate rather than compete become more useful adults.
human: It is undeniable that children have an innocent mind, and they requires a proper guidance at a specific time to make them understand the value of life. Some people think that it is better to make them competitive, while other believes to make them co-operative. Both these factors have their own values, and have been discussed in detail below:Competitive children are more likely to be confident enough to handle the situations independently. This factor initially arises from the school, where teacher encourages student to feel more competitive through the grading system, and this is the place where children are trying to get on the top by scoring the highest marks. This factor will lead them to be successful in their lives ahead, but will also restrict them in many ways. For example, MNCs are mainly focusing on a team work, and a person with the competitive mind would be having a difficulty in managing the situation with the team.However, those who wants to create a sense of co-operation in their children is a symbol that they want to make them sensible enough in their lives ahead. Although, they will not be having a pace and an eager to get on the top as the competitors do, but they shall have an art of managing different situations of life with the help of a team.In my opinion, though competitive children will be far more clever and faster than the co-operative child in an initial level, but it will not help them to be on the success path for the long run; while on the contrary, co-operative child will have a potential of structuring and implementing new and innovative ideas with the help of a team.To conclude, I would say that people should create a sense of co-operation in their children to make them feel more accomplished in life.
llm: It is unmistakable that children possess an innocent and impressionable mind, and they require proper guidance at a critical juncture to help them grasp the value of life. There is an ongoing debate about whether it is more beneficial to foster competitiveness or cooperation in children. Both approaches have their own merits, which are discussed in detail below.On one hand, competitive children tend to develop the confidence to handle situations independently. This trait is often nurtured in school, where teachers encourage students to strive for academic excellence through grading systems, prompting children to strive for the top spot by achieving the highest marks. While this competitive drive can lead to success in the long run, it can also impose limitations. For instance, multinational corporations (MNCs) emphasize teamwork, and individuals with a competitive mindset may struggle to adapt to collaborative environments.On the other hand, parents who aim to instill a sense of cooperation in their children demonstrate a desire to equip them with the skills to navigate life's challenges effectively. Although cooperative children may not exhibit the same level of competitiveness or eagerness to succeed as their competitive counterparts, they possess the ability to manage diverse situations with the support of a team.In my opinion, while competitive children may exhibit greater cleverness and speed in the initial stages, this advantage may not translate to long-term success. In contrast, cooperative children have the potential to develop and implement innovative ideas with the help of a team, ultimately leading to greater accomplishments. Therefore, I firmly believe that parents should foster a sense of cooperation in their children, enabling them to feel more fulfilled and accomplished in life.

question: Nowadays the way many people interact with each other has changed because of technology. In what ways has technology affected the types of relationships people make? Has this become a positive or negative development?
human: Nowadays, the variety of communication systems used widely. As technology develops, it has negative influences in many respects. However, I strongly agree with that the technology has large positive effects on relationships between people. The main advantage is that technology has enabled people stay in contact with each other more closely. While public use the Internet or smart phone to share information to each other at different positions. Instead of using letters, technology advanced not only gives us more spare time but also convenient and efficient. More, even if family members who are in different countries, they also can use the Internet to connect each others, especially though the images or videos, they can feel close. Furthermore, technology is also essential for students, live in remote districts, shared the valuable natural resources with friends. Another issue is that in the ever-accelerated updating of science and technology, technology provides opportunities for people to establish the social network. In the past, people might have had pen friends in other countries, but now, thanks to the social networking websites, people can easily to find someone who has similar interests. Also, they can connect with friends who have been out of touch for a long time by using the Internet. In this way, technology is beneficial to humanity develops positive relationships. In conclusion, I agree with that the technology has more optimal effects on people's interaction, because it helps ordinary people to make new friends and to maintain relationships.
llm: In today's world, a wide variety of communication systems are used extensively. As technology advances, it has numerous negative consequences in many areas. Nevertheless, I firmly believe that technology has a significant positive impact on relationships between individuals.The primary advantage of technology is that it enables people to stay in close contact with one another, regardless of their geographical location. Through the use of the internet and smartphones, people can share information and stay connected with ease. This advancement not only saves time but also provides a convenient and efficient means of communication. For instance, family members living in different countries can use the internet to stay in touch, and even feel close through the exchange of images and videos.Furthermore, technology is essential for students living in remote areas, as it allows them to share valuable resources with friends and access information that may not be available locally. Additionally, the rapid evolution of science and technology provides opportunities for people to establish social networks. In the past, people may have had pen friends in other countries, but now, thanks to social networking websites, individuals can easily connect with like-minded people. They can also reconnect with old friends who have been out of touch for a long time, fostering the development of positive relationships.In conclusion, I agree that technology has a profoundly positive effect on people's interactions, as it facilitates the formation of new friendships and the maintenance of existing relationships. Overall, technology plays a vital role in helping ordinary people connect with one another and nurture their relationships.

question: When a country develops its technology, the traditional skills and ways of life die out. It is pointless to try and keep them alive. To what extent do you agree or disagree with this opinion?
human: With the development of technology, whether or not it is still necessary to protect the traditional skills and lifestyles leads to a drastic controversy which is becoming a public concern, especially considering the significant impact taken by technology. As far as I am concerned, the importance of traditions should be valued and paid attention to.Traditional skills and lifestyles play important role in modern society, in terms of healthcare, environmental protection and cultural inherit. Although technology takes convenience to humankind, it also contributes to unhealthy behaviors of life, like sedentary lifestyle. Instead, traditional ways of life is a great complimentary for modern life and highlight the importance of work life balance. Meanwhile, due to the fact that traditional skills rely little on fossil energy, it is more environmentally-friendly, which should be promoted to reduce the threat of climate change. Furthermore those tradition-related things convey traditional culture and values. These are important foundation of modern civilization. Protection of tradition can provide the possibility to better understand ancient culture and utilize them to tackle modern problems.Some people who hold different viewpoints may advocate that protecting traditions consume too much financial budget compared with the incoming it takes. In spite of the fact this kind of business bring limited contribution to government finance, it should be emphasized that the expense is trivial compared with the potential value of traditions. Therefore the government authorities and education institutes should work closely together to promote the traditional skills and ways of life, so as to make people to realize the value of them.All in all, protection of tradition is not only important for the entire society currently, but also contributes to the next generation.
llm: The advent of technology has sparked a heated debate about the relevance of preserving traditional skills and lifestyles, with many arguing that they are no longer necessary in today's modern world. However, I firmly believe that the importance of traditions should be valued and recognized. Traditional skills and lifestyles continue to play a vital role in contemporary society, particularly in the areas of healthcare, environmental conservation, and cultural heritage. While technology has brought numerous conveniences, it has also contributed to unhealthy habits, such as sedentary lifestyles. In contrast, traditional ways of life offer a valuable complement to modern living, emphasizing the significance of work-life balance. Moreover, traditional skills, which rely minimally on fossil fuels, are more environmentally friendly and should be promoted to mitigate the threat of climate change. These tradition-related practices also convey cultural values and traditions, which are essential foundations of modern civilization. By protecting traditions, we can gain a deeper understanding of ancient cultures and utilize them to address modern challenges.Some may argue that preserving traditions is a costly endeavor, with limited financial returns. Nevertheless, I believe that the expenses incurred are negligible compared to the potential value of traditions. Therefore, government authorities and educational institutions should collaborate to promote traditional skills and ways of life, raising awareness about their importance among the general public.In conclusion, preserving traditions is not only crucial for our current society but also has a profound impact on future generations. It is essential that we recognize the significance of traditional skills and lifestyles and work together to protect and promote them, ensuring their continued relevance and importance in our modern world.

question: Some people think that a sense of competition in children should be encouraged. Others believe that children who are taught to be co-operate rather than compete become more useful adults. Discuss both views and give your own opinion.
human: In present educational system there are variety of competitions in academic area and athletic area for children to attend, which could stimulating the will of children to learn and to achieve the best of them, and also be able to teach them teamwork skill. However, some people think it is better to make children be competitive than cooperative, both the values have its arguments.A strong competition sense helps children having urge to learn or to practice for being the best among peers, and this factor is initially arises from the schools and parents, to encourage children to get the highest scores through the grading system. Even though a competitive child is usually more motivated to pursue a goal or to face difficulties independently, but it is also risky that children are becoming too competitive to cooperating with others. Being competitive leads them to success, but could also restrict them in many ways. For example, it might be hard for a competitive person to deal or manage in a team work project.On the other hand, cooperation is also an essential quality for children, no matter in school activities or in communities. Having a good cooperating spirit helps kids to communicate and get along with others, which gives them more possibility to solve problems or to achieve a goal easily by working as a team. After all, in society, there is hardly anyone who could has big achievement by oneself. For example, famous singers or movie stars, despite of their talent to make them successful, there are always a team to manage works or deal with things.In my point of view, though competitive child would have more motivation and perspective that leads them to success, but it would not help them much once they enter to society or company which required more about skill of team work. To sum up, I would say that schools and adults should put a sense of cooperation in children to make them becoming a useful adult whether in society or community.
llm: In today's educational system, numerous competitions are available for children in both academic and athletic fields, which can stimulate their desire to learn and strive for excellence. These competitions also provide opportunities for children to develop teamwork skills. However, there is a debate about whether it is more beneficial for children to be competitive or cooperative, with valid arguments on both sides.On one hand, a strong competitive spirit can motivate children to learn and practice, driven by the desire to outperform their peers. This competitiveness is often encouraged by schools and parents through grading systems, which can foster a sense of achievement and independence. Competitive children tend to be more motivated to pursue goals and overcome challenges on their own. Nevertheless, an overemphasis on competitiveness can lead to difficulties in cooperating with others, which is essential in many areas of life, such as team projects.On the other hand, cooperation is a vital quality for children to develop, whether in school activities or community engagements. A cooperative spirit enables kids to communicate effectively, build relationships, and work together towards common goals. In real-world scenarios, achieving significant success rarely happens in isolation; even highly talented individuals, such as famous singers or movie stars, rely on teams to manage and facilitate their work. This underscores the importance of teamwork in achieving goals and solving problems.From my perspective, while competitiveness can drive motivation and success, it may not provide the necessary skills for thriving in society or the workplace, where teamwork is highly valued. In conclusion, I believe that schools and adults should prioritize instilling a sense of cooperation in children, as this will better prepare them to become valuable and effective members of society and their communities.

question: Some people think that advertising give more harms than good to our society. Other refute this. Discuss both views and give your opinion
human: On these days, with the assistance of advertisement, people easily purchase the best products with detailed information and instruction for their requirement. Although some people claim that the advantages of advertising are outweigh the advantages, I believe that advertisement bring more benefits than harms to our lives.On the one hand, it is clear that most advertisements so exaggerate the quality of their products that they often ignore some negative effects of what they sell. In addition to this, all of things are advertised as the best ones result in the confusing for users in picking out the most suitable goods. For example, some kinds of shampoo, namely Sunsilk, Clear, Dove are publicized as magic items to recreate injured hair with the number of other benefits. However, the fact is that not all customers are satisfied with what they bought under the introduction from advertisement. On the other hand, it is undeniable fact that advertising market gives lots of working opportunities from producers, writers to models and cameramen for all of people as long as their qualification adapt to the demands. Moreover, advertisement enables to support users in getting accustomed to enterprises and know thoroughly items sold from these producers. Take Coca cola for an example, this drinking firm is well-known as one of companies invested a major part of their money in advertising. No wonder why this drinking title becomes more and more familiar with customers around the world. Last but not least, online advertisement is one of the easiest approaches due to their potential gains such as cheaper cost, convenience and easily observing.To sum up, everything has its own gains and losses and advertisement is not an exception. From my point of view, advertising will be better if producers and advertisers are more honest in producing advertisements to give people the general view on one product.
llm: In today's world, advertising plays a significant role in helping people make informed purchasing decisions. With the aid of advertisements, consumers can easily access detailed information and instructions about products that meet their needs. While some argue that the drawbacks of advertising outweigh its benefits, I firmly believe that advertising brings more advantages than disadvantages to our lives.On one hand, it is evident that many advertisements exaggerate the quality of their products, often overlooking potential negative consequences. Furthermore, the plethora of advertisements claiming to offer the best products can confuse consumers when trying to choose the most suitable option. For instance, certain shampoos like Sunsilk, Clear, and Dove are marketed as miracle products that can restore damaged hair, along with numerous other benefits. However, the reality is that not all customers are satisfied with their purchases, which were influenced by advertisements.On the other hand, it is an undeniable fact that the advertising industry provides numerous job opportunities for people with diverse skills, including producers, writers, models, and cameramen. Additionally, advertising enables consumers to become familiar with companies and their products, allowing them to make informed decisions. Take Coca Cola, for example, a company that has invested heavily in advertising, resulting in widespread recognition and popularity among customers globally. Moreover, online advertising has become one of the most convenient and cost-effective approaches, offering benefits such as lower costs, convenience, and easy monitoring.In conclusion, like everything else, advertising has its pros and cons. From my perspective, advertising would be more effective if producers and advertisers were more honest and transparent in their advertisements, providing consumers with a comprehensive view of a product. This would ultimately lead to more informed decision-making and a better overall experience for consumers.
