question: Some modern artists receive huge sums of money for the things they create, while other struggle to survive. Government should take steps to resolve this unfair situation. To what extend do you agree or disagree?
human: The amount of money people earning sometimes is unfair. In a field of art, modern artist may receive high salary for their masterpiece creation while labors should be break their bone for years to get similar amount of money. Although some people view that government should be take a responsibility for this unfair situation, critics against such view. I agree that in this occasion the government is not granted to hand in.Proficiency brings perfectness in terms of art work. It is true while the modern artists who implement their creative thinking onto high value creation are paid with immense sum by the art collector. Also, the high sum which modern artists receive is related to the quality instead of the quantity and their rare talent. For example, a 15 centimeter Buddha temple made by hand is granted times in comparison with factory production. On the other hand, modern artists also devote themselves find a unique concept in which ordinary people cannot do, such making impossible become possible. Pieter Padang, Minion creator, has brilliant idea to alter part of song lyric "I swear" become "underwear" when the Minion sing in Despicable Me. He granted huge sums for such idea.Striking contrast, labor working in the merchandise factory receive coin of dollar even they make a hundred of 15 cm Buddha temples a day. In any case, a musician playing "I swear" several times receives different earnings that Padang got because the musician re-plays the song without any creation. Moreover, government cannot equalize the price of creation of modern artist because there is no certain parameter to value it, art value is about taste.Having said that the huge sums of modern artists receives related to their struggle in the field of art, while the term of struggle might different with other field of job. I agree that government cannot take steps to make the salary between modern artists and other job similar because art price is about taste.
llm: The disparity in earnings between individuals can be perceived as unfair. In the artistic field, modern artists may receive substantial salaries for their creative masterpieces, whereas laborers may have to toil for years to earn a similar amount. Although some argue that the government should address this imbalance, critics counter that the government should not intervene. I concur that the government should not attempt to rectify this situation.Proficiency and perfection in artwork are often rewarded with high compensation. Modern artists who bring their innovative ideas to life are paid handsomely by art collectors. The significant sums they receive are a reflection of the quality and rarity of their work, rather than the quantity produced. For instance, a handmade 15-centimeter Buddha temple is valued far more than a mass-produced equivalent. Moreover, modern artists dedicate themselves to finding unique concepts that ordinary people cannot replicate, making the impossible possible. A notable example is Pieter Padang, the creator of Minions, who cleverly altered song lyrics to create a humorous effect, earning him a substantial amount for his idea.In stark contrast, laborers working in merchandise factories earn relatively low wages, even if they produce hundreds of 15-centimeter Buddha temples daily. Similarly, a musician who repeatedly plays a song like "I swear" earns differently than Padang, as they are re-performing rather than creating. The government cannot equalize the value of modern art because it is subjective and dependent on personal taste, making it challenging to establish a standard parameter for evaluation.As mentioned earlier, the substantial earnings of modern artists are a result of their struggles and dedication to their craft, with the term "struggle" potentially differing from one field to another. I agree that the government should not attempt to equalize salaries between modern artists and other professions, as the value of art is inherently tied to personal taste.

question: People tend to work longer hours nowadays. Working long hours has a negative effect on themselves, their families and the society, so working hours should be restricted. Do you agree or disagree?
human: Working longer hours is becoming prevalent in these days. There is a saying in my native village, "Health is Wealth". I believe many of people including me are not really considering the importance of health. The need for increased working hours might be because of enhanced competitive environment and desire to acquire much money and promotion. However, people working for extended hours have been found having adverse effects on their health and personal life. In my opinion, a balance between personal and professional life should be created by restricting maximum number of working hours. First of all, many of us would agree to the fact that people; who prefer working longer hours, do not find time to focus on their health. By working too long, they often become tired, lazy and reluctant to carry out physical exercise in order to remain fit and healthy and eventually loose health and become sick. Moreover, they become extensively addicted to their work and become workaholic type persons. The repercussion are so severe that their families and friends remain deprived off their attention and in the end they end up losing balance between their family and personal life.Secondly, these workaholic people do not spend time for the contribution of society by actively participating in any social campaign. As they usually remain busy in their office so they do not find leisure time for such social activities. For instance, I would take my boss's example; he has been working for extended hours in office for many years. Recently, his health and personal life was drastically affected as he broke up with his wife and his family life has totally been in chaos and cries. He started regretting afterwards and now trying to manage his work but it seems to be too late for him.To conclude this, I would strongly emphasis and recommend, Government must include the clause of maximum number of working hours in its Labor Law and enforce to all companies for ensuring their employees do not spend extended hours in companies. This will help in uplift of society, and bring the lost equilibrium between personal and professional life of each individual person.
llm: In today's fast-paced world, working long hours has become the norm. A wise saying from my hometown resonates with me: "Health is Wealth." Unfortunately, I believe many people, including myself, often overlook the significance of health. The pressure to work longer hours may stem from the increasingly competitive environment and the desire for financial gain and career advancement. However, research has shown that extended working hours can have detrimental effects on both physical and mental health, as well as personal relationships.In my opinion, striking a balance between personal and professional life is crucial, and this can be achieved by imposing a maximum number of working hours. Firstly, it's undeniable that individuals who work excessively long hours often neglect their health. Prolonged work periods can lead to fatigue, laziness, and a lack of motivation to engage in physical exercise, ultimately resulting in poor health and increased susceptibility to illness. Moreover, these individuals can become overly consumed by their work, adopting a "workaholic" lifestyle that isolates them from their loved ones. The consequences are severe, causing an imbalance in their family and personal life, leaving their relationships with family and friends to suffer.Secondly, those who are consumed by their work often don't contribute to societal well-being by participating in social activities. Their hectic schedules leave little to no time for leisure or community engagement. For instance, my boss, who has spent years working extended hours, recently experienced a drastic decline in his health and personal life. His relationship with his wife ended, and his family life is now in disarray. Only after reaching a breaking point did he attempt to reassess his priorities, but for him, it may be too late.In conclusion, I strongly advocate for the government to incorporate a clause in the Labor Law that enforces companies to adhere to a maximum number of working hours for their employees. This policy would uplift society as a whole and help individuals reclaim the balance between their personal and professional lives. By prioritizing health and well-being, we can work towards a more harmonious and sustainable future.

question: A successful person is one who has earned a lot of money. To what extend do you agree or disagree?
human: It's such a common definition of a successful person is one who has earned a lot of money, especially in nowadays society. Each individual visualize success differently. Still, my term of a successful man is one who has certain achievements in life rather than the one with a high income.Money is undeniably pivotal, but ways of earning it is also various. A person's great prosperity does not state that he has gained it ethically by himself. Nevertheless, a man can only achieve his accomplishment through hard-working, dedication and passion. Whether it is a personal or a social achievement, that man is laudable.More importantly, the more beneficial for the society his achievement is, the more successful he is considered. For instance, Thomas Edison is undeniably considered as one of the greatest inventors in the 20th century since his invention's productivity is countless useful for mankind. On the other hand, the fact of knowing a man's utilization of his money remains in the dark. Therefore, judging a person by his income is difficult, especially in the success aspect.In conclusion, using only money as a scale to measure a man's success is impossible despite the fact that it is the essential in basic needs. Yet, it is the common scene that a man can be publicly considered successful when his achievements, which can only accomplished by passion, dedication and ethics, are helpful not only for himself.
llm: In today's society, it's common to define a successful person as someone who has amassed a significant amount of wealth. However, each individual has their own unique vision of success. Personally, I believe that a successful person is one who has achieved notable accomplishments in life, rather than simply earning a high income.While money is undoubtedly important, the means of earning it can vary greatly. A person's prosperity does not necessarily indicate that they have earned it honestly or through their own efforts. Nevertheless, true achievement can only be attained through hard work, dedication, and passion. Whether it's a personal or social achievement, a person who has worked tirelessly to accomplish their goals is worthy of admiration.What's more, the greater the benefit of their achievement to society, the more successful they are considered. For example, Thomas Edison is widely regarded as one of the greatest inventors of the 20th century, thanks to the countless useful applications of his inventions. On the other hand, the way a person uses their wealth is often private, making it difficult to judge their success solely based on their income.In conclusion, using wealth as the sole measure of a person's success is insufficient, despite its importance in meeting basic needs. Instead, a person is often considered successful when their achievements, which can only be accomplished through passion, dedication, and ethics, are beneficial not only to themselves, but also to society as a whole. This is the true mark of a successful individual, and one that goes beyond mere financial wealth.

question: Question: Today, the high sales of popular consumer goods reflect the power of advertising and not the real needs of the society in which there are sold. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
human: Nowdays, people's choice of consumption is heavily affected by various of advertising on television, street, magazine etc. This argument may be true that people will be swayed by the advertising and buy things they do not need it for their life. For example, in most asian countries, advertisement company usually hire popular singers or actors to advertise the products to boosts the sales, and some people, especially adolescent may buy things from their favourite singer advertised to support their idol instead of to fill their needs.In addition, products usually look more gorgeous and with good quality in advertisement, people are more likely to buy goods impulsively without a second thought. A good advertisement can convince people to believe that it is what they want, even though it is not the real needs of the society. And there are always people purchase particular products swayed by advertising which makes it a trend to follow for other people who is unnecessarily need it.However, buying habit is a very personal things for individuals, the advertisement is not the only cause for people to buy, sometimes it depends on one's needs and ability of consumption. It is unlikely to buy things impulsively for adults who have concern of arranging disposable income. Most of them have to allocate the money if they doing other purchase. On the other hand, children and adolescents who is not economic independence is more possible to buy things impulsively without considering whether they need it or not, since they do not have financial pressure from life and ability to define what is necessary.In my opinion, I think buying habit is people's choice to make, not entirely affected by advertisements. But for children or adolescents who is not mentally develop, it might be hard for them not to swayed by advertising. So it is important that government needs to impose rules on particularly advertisement company (for example, toys company) to avoid youngster have bias thought on what they really need.
llm: In today's world, people's consumption choices are significantly influenced by the numerous advertisements they are exposed to through various media, including television, streets, and magazines. It can be argued that these advertisements have the power to sway individuals into purchasing items they do not necessarily need. For instance, in many Asian countries, advertisement companies often enlist popular singers or actors to promote products, which can lead to fans, especially adolescents, buying these products as a way to support their idols rather than to fulfill a genuine need.Moreover, products are often portrayed as more attractive and of higher quality in advertisements, which can prompt impulsive buying decisions without much thought. Effective advertising can convince people that they want a particular product, even if it doesn't align with their actual needs or the needs of society. This, in turn, can create a trend where people purchase products influenced by advertising, even if they don't genuinely need them.However, buying habits are highly personal and not solely determined by advertising. Individuals' needs and consumption capabilities play a significant role. It's less likely for adults, who are mindful of budgeting their disposable income, to make impulsive purchases. They often have to allocate their money carefully among different expenses. On the other hand, children and adolescents, who are not economically independent, are more likely to make impulsive purchases without considering their actual needs, largely because they are not yet under financial pressures and lack the maturity to discern what is necessary.In my view, buying habits are a matter of personal choice, not entirely dictated by advertisements. Nonetheless, for children and adolescents whose judgment is still developing, it can be challenging to resist the influence of advertising. Therefore, it's crucial for governments to regulate advertisement companies, especially those targeting youngsters, such as toy companies, to prevent biased perceptions of what they truly need. This regulatory approach can help mitigate the undue influence of advertising on vulnerable populations.

question: Some people think that by paying taxes they made enough contribution to their society. TO what extent do you agree or disagree?
human: Paying taxes is the obligation of citizens in almost every country. Some people believe that they have made enough contribution to the country by doing that. Personally, I tend to disagree with this view.To start with, all people who are able to work should pay tax to the government, as it is the most important source of government's revenue, which is mainly used to serve all citizens. For example, a large proportion of the tax is spent on national defence and in maintaining social stability, so that every one can work and live in a peaceful environment. The tax is also used to pay the salaries of workers working in public service sectors, such as teachers and police officers. Although these workers do not produce profit directly, what they do is for the well-being of the whole society.However, I would argue that citizens have other important responsibilities to fulfil apart from paying tax. As we know, there are impoverished or disabled people in every society, needing help and support from others. It is true that the government can provide some fund to ease their difficulties, but such financial help is usually far from enough. In such case, aids from more capable or wealthier citizens are particularly crucial, which are a great complement to government support. Another responsibility all citizens should take is to maintain social stability together with the police force. There are criminals in every society, and the number of policemen the government can hire is limited. So it is quite necessary for the local residents to take actions and ensure the safety of the communities, by doing things like reporting suspicious activities to the police department.In conclusion, it is a significant obligation of citizens to pay tax to the government. Other than that, they have other critical obligations to take, in order to make our society function in an ordered way.
llm: The obligation to pay taxes is a universal responsibility of citizens in nearly every country. However, some individuals believe that paying taxes is sufficient contribution to their nation. I personally disagree with this perspective.Firstly, it is essential that all capable working individuals contribute to the government through taxation, as it is the primary source of government revenue. This revenue is utilized to provide services to all citizens, with a significant portion allocated to national defense and maintaining social stability. This enables everyone to work and live in a peaceful environment. Additionally, tax revenue is used to pay the salaries of public service workers, such as teachers and police officers, who may not generate direct profit but contribute significantly to the well-being of society. Nevertheless, I argue that citizens have additional crucial responsibilities beyond paying taxes. Every society has impoverished or disabled individuals who require assistance and support from others. Although the government provides some financial aid, it is often insufficient. In such cases, aid from more capable citizens is vital and serves as a valuable complement to government support. Furthermore, citizens should collaborate with the police force to maintain social stability. With a limited number of police officers, it is necessary for local residents to take action and ensure community safety by reporting suspicious activities to the authorities.In conclusion, paying taxes is a significant obligation of citizens. However, it is not the only responsibility they must undertake. Citizens have other critical duties to fulfill in order to maintain a functioning and orderly society.

question: School should teach children the academic subje cts which have a close relationship with their future careers, so other subjects like music and sports are not important. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
human: People have many different views about what subjects should be taught in school. Although I accept that students have to study many subjects in school, I disagree with the idea that unimportant subjects such as music and sports should be got rid of the program.Many people believe that students only need to study academic subjects like mathematics, physics because these subject are necessary for students' future. This is understandable when labor market now has high competition; students have to meet requirements regard of qualification. In addition, the unemployment rate is always high, so their parents want children to study these subjects which can help students have a job. Although those above reasons are acceptable, I would argue that there are many things much more important than having a job. Firstly, studying music, art or sports is also very important to students. This enables students to develop their potentials through discovering the natural world around them. Secondly, to get a job in labor market, not only do students require hard skills but also soft skills such as teamwork, presentation. For instance, through taking part in a sport, students can understand team spirit and learn lessons about teamwork skills. Therefore, these subjects might fulfil the students' ability. Finally, children's future do not depend heavily on the academic subjects they study in school, it is the result of their efforts and capacity.In conclusion, although the academic subjects play a primary role in nurturing children, it seem to me that the effects of learning music, sports are profound.
llm: There is ongoing debate about the subjects that should be included in school curricula. While I acknowledge the importance of studying a wide range of subjects, I disagree with the notion that supposedly non-essential subjects like music and sports should be eliminated from the program.Many individuals believe that students should focus solely on academic subjects such as mathematics and physics, as these are deemed crucial for their future prospects. This perspective is understandable, given the highly competitive job market and the need for students to meet specific qualification requirements. Furthermore, the consistently high unemployment rate leads many parents to encourage their children to pursue subjects that will increase their chances of securing employment.However, I would argue that there are aspects of education that are equally, if not more, important than job preparation. Firstly, studying music, art, or sports is vital for students, as it allows them to explore their potential and discover the world around them. Secondly, to succeed in the job market, students need to possess not only technical skills but also soft skills, such as teamwork and presentation abilities. For example, participating in sports can teach students about teamwork, collaboration, and camaraderie. Therefore, these subjects can play a significant role in fostering students' abilities. Finally, a child's future is not solely dependent on the academic subjects they study in school; rather, it is the result of their hard work, dedication, and innate capacity.In conclusion, while academic subjects undoubtedly play a vital role in nurturing children, I firmly believe that the impact of learning music and sports is profound and should not be underestimated. These subjects offer a unique set of benefits that can complement academic learning and contribute to the well-rounded development of students.

question: Some people believe that information available in the internet will end the era of newspapers and magazines. Do you agree or disagree? Give your own opinion and examples.
human: Digital media has been extremely popular among people around the globe. With this advancement, newspapers and magazines are struggling to justify their existence. Some believe that traditional paper media will come to an end very soon due to the increased usage of internet based media. But many other still thinks they are going to stay. I agree to the argument that newspapers and magazines will be history with the time. I will establish my view by analysing how internet presents the information about the current affair so fast and the accessibility to the historical news.A very important responsibility of media is to publish information about the current affairs as quickly as possible specially when there is a crisis. This helps readers to get updated and act accordingly. For example, when the aircraft MH 370 went missing, everyone wanted to know the details about this tragic incident. The friends and families of passengers and crews were impatient to know the truth. In such situations, newspapers and magazines can not respond as fast as digital media. Instead of waiting for next publication, people can get trustworthy information about the current incidents from internet within an hour or two. This explains why digital media will rule over paper and magazines.People often want to access news from past for various reasons like to prepare for research, satisfy interest, etc. For example, one research fellow may want to know how a small village named Oramaki in Japan was suffering after Second World War. It is very difficult to get this sort of information from past in newspapers and magazines as one has to know before where to look at. But internet provides efficient search facility where one can search the topic and get the details. This feature of digital media is not supported by newspapers and magazines.To conclude, the fast responding internet media with vast information will be replacing newspapers and magazines as new and information provider for valid reasons. Though considering the current infrastructure and mindset of people, paper media will continue for another few years.
llm: The rise of digital media has led to a significant decline in the popularity of traditional paper media, such as newspapers and magazines. As a result, many believe that these forms of media will soon become obsolete. I share this view, arguing that the internet's ability to provide rapid access to current affairs and historical news will ultimately lead to the demise of print media.One of the primary responsibilities of media is to disseminate information about current events in a timely manner, particularly during crises. In such situations, digital media outpaces traditional media, providing trustworthy information within hours. For instance, when Malaysia Airlines flight MH370 went missing, people turned to the internet for updates, rather than waiting for the next print publication. This exemplifies the superiority of digital media in terms of speed and accessibility.Moreover, people often require access to past news for research, personal interest, or other purposes. For example, a researcher might want to investigate the aftermath of World War II in a small Japanese village like Oramaki. Finding such specific information in newspapers and magazines can be a daunting task, as one would need to know where to look. In contrast, the internet offers an efficient search function, enabling users to quickly find relevant information. This feature is a significant advantage of digital media over traditional print media.In conclusion, digital media's rapid response time and vast repository of information make it an increasingly popular choice for news consumption. Although traditional media may persist for a few more years due to existing infrastructure and people's habits, ultimately, digital media will supplant newspapers and magazines as the primary source of news and information. The writing is on the wall: with its unparalleled speed and accessibility, digital media is poised to revolutionize the way we consume news and information.

question: When choosing a job, the salary is the most important consideration. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
human: In many societies, choice of a job depends on the size of the salary offered. Nevertheless, while I admit that the salary is very pivotal factor, I claim that there are other equally vital aspects that need to be considered in this regard.To begin with, I agree that in order for people to cover their daily and general needs they need money as well. However, aspects such as: friendly colleagues, environment and work-place condition, sometimes, have even more impact on person's happiness and quality of life. People, for instance, who don't like their co-workers and working condition are considered less satisfied with their jobs, despite of a high salary. In this sense, it is also one very salient proof of the accuracy of my position.Further and even more importantly, most of the satisfaction of a job comes to people from their professional achievements, skills and the position they reach. In other words, career promotion or getting some kind of credit from the administration of a company or organization are, likely, more enjoyable achievements than getting a high salary. For example, people, who work in monotonous jobs, where no achievements or a new positions can be reached feel themselves more dissatisfied, even though they have a very good salaries.In conclusion, I disagree with the idea that salary outweighs any other motivators, as there are other even more important aspects such as: friendly co-workers, working conditions and professional achievements.
llm: While salary is often a key consideration when choosing a job, I argue that it is not the only factor that matters. In fact, I believe that other aspects, such as a supportive work environment, positive relationships with colleagues, and opportunities for professional growth, are equally, if not more, important.It is undeniable that a decent salary is necessary to cover daily expenses and maintain a certain standard of living. However, research has shown that factors like workplace culture, colleague relationships, and job satisfaction can have a profound impact on a person's overall happiness and quality of life. For instance, individuals who dislike their coworkers or work in poor conditions often report lower job satisfaction, despite earning a high salary. This serves as evidence to support my claim that salary is not the sole determinant of job satisfaction.Moreover, a sense of fulfillment and satisfaction in one's job often stems from professional achievements, skill development, and career advancement. Receiving recognition or promotions from one's organization can be a more significant source of pride and motivation than a high salary. For example, individuals in mundane jobs with limited opportunities for growth or recognition may feel unfulfilled, even if they earn a good income.In conclusion, I disagree with the notion that salary is the primary motivator for job choice. Instead, I believe that factors like a positive work environment, supportive colleagues, and opportunities for professional growth and recognition are equally, if not more, important considerations.

question: Using a computer every day can have more negative than positive effects on children. Do you agree or disagree?
human: In today's world, computer is an essential part of everyday life. Around the globe, the effect is evident on children also. It is disagreed that computer can affect children in a negative way if they use a computer on a daily basis. This will be proven by analyzing how computer assists children to use vast resources available over internet to study effectively as well as develop some basic skills which help them in future careers.The best thing about internet is the availability of information in the form of text, image or video related to almost everything and through computer children can access internet to gather knowledge on the subjects they are studying or they are interested about. As an example, students preparing for delivering speech on a certain topic can browse through internet to learn each and every minute details of the subject matter. It's hard to get everything at a same place unless children are not familiar with computers. That is how, computer impacts children on a positive note.Nowadays, computers enable people to prepare presentations, draw complex graphs and pictures, document thesis in a simple though efficient way. When children are allowed to play around with computer from a very early age, they get acquainted with the previously mentioned skills and become expert before facing professional world. For instance, students who used to prepare Microsoft PowerPoint presentation for their school projects, get an edge over others at an early stage of their career. From this, it's clear that computer has a positive effect on the children.Following the demonstration of a computer's contribution in children's study and building skills which are to be used in their career afterwards, it is agreed that computer is a boon to children. However, parents should advise and guide their children properly so that they don't get misled.
llm: In today's digital age, computers have become an indispensable part of daily life, and their impact is particularly significant on children. While some may argue that excessive computer use can have negative effects on children, this viewpoint will be challenged by examining the numerous ways in which computers facilitate children's access to vast online resources, enabling them to study effectively and develop essential skills that will benefit their future careers.One of the most significant advantages of the internet is the vast array of information available in various formats, including text, images, and videos, which cover almost every topic imaginable. Through computers, children can easily access this wealth of information to gain knowledge on subjects they are studying or interested in. For instance, students preparing to deliver a speech on a specific topic can browse the internet to learn intricate details about the subject matter, which would be challenging to find in a single physical location without computer access. This highlights the positive impact of computers on children's learning experiences.Moreover, computers have revolutionized the way people prepare presentations, create complex graphs and pictures, and document theses in a straightforward yet efficient manner. When children are introduced to computers at a young age, they become familiar with these skills, ultimately becoming proficient before entering the professional world. For example, students who learn to create Microsoft PowerPoint presentations for school projects gain a competitive edge early in their careers. This demonstrates the positive influence of computers on children's skill development and future career readiness.Given the evidence of computers' contributions to children's academic success and skill-building, which are crucial for their future careers, it is clear that computers are a valuable resource for children. However, it is essential for parents to provide guidance and oversight to ensure that children use computers responsibly and do not get misled by potential drawbacks. By doing so, children can harness the full potential of computers to enhance their educational and professional development.

question: Children who are brought up in families that do not have large amounts of money are better prepared to deal with the problems of adult life than children brought up by wealthy parents. To what extent do you agree or disagree with this opinion?
human: According to some people, child who is brought up in less well-off family is more quick-witted and can tackle with an adult life problems better than who is from affluent ones. However, I completely disagree with this position.To begin with, children from poorer families are prone to have bad habits such as: crime, thievery and thuggery. Moreover, these people will not have an access to a good education. As a result, they can be proselytized into bad isms. For example, most of the terroristic groups try to attract uneducated people, because the person with better education has a wider outlook, which will allow no brainwash. In this sense, people with lower level of education have more proneness to be attracted in such isms.Nevertheless, people who are born in well-off families have access to good education, which will have a positive impact on their later life. Secondly, children from rich families have better skills on how to use money, because they use it a lot of times. Finally, wealthy families can afford better health services and costly medicines, which will be very beneficial for the health of a child. For instance, many good medicines cost vast amounts of money, which cannot be afforded by poorer families.In conclusion, I disagree with the opinion that children who are brought up in less well-of families are, likely, more successful in the future life due to aforementioned reasons.
llm: I strongly disagree with the notion that children raised in less affluent families are more resourceful and better equipped to handle adult life problems compared to those from wealthier backgrounds. To start with, children from disadvantaged families are more likely to develop negative habits such as delinquency, theft, and violence. Additionally, they often lack access to quality education, making them more susceptible to radical ideologies. For instance, many extremist groups target uneducated individuals, as those with better education tend to have a broader perspective, making them less vulnerable to manipulation. Consequently, people with limited education are more prone to being swayed by such ideologies.On the other hand, children from affluent families have access to good education, which has a positive impact on their future. Furthermore, they develop essential skills in managing finances, as they are accustomed to handling money. Lastly, wealthy families can afford superior healthcare services and expensive medications, which greatly benefits a child's health. For example, many effective medicines are costly, and poorer families often cannot afford them.In conclusion, I disagree with the opinion that children raised in less well-off families are more likely to succeed in life due to the aforementioned reasons. The advantages of growing up in a wealthy family, including access to quality education, financial management skills, and better healthcare, provide a stronger foundation for future success.

question: Many of the medical problems that people are experiencing in today's world are due to the fact that we have a very sedentary lifestyle. To what extend do you agree or disagree.
human: It is certainly true that modern people are facing up to a new health problems and ailments than before. Many people claim that it is because of sedentary lifestlyle. However, while I accept that sedentary lifestyle is one of the key factors, I believe that some other factors are having even a greater impact.To begin with, I agree that sedentary lifestyle lead to many serious health problems. The main reason why people are becoming so addicted to sitting at their homes even for the whole day is an advance technology. In earlier times, for instance, even the types of entertainment tools were not in large numbers and all of them required physical presence and as a result they had more outdoor activities. Nowadays people, especially inhabitants of cities, are spending most of their time on sitting in front of TV or other tools.Nevertheless, there are some other causes why people are experiencing serious medical problems. Firstly, the environment of the modern world polluted very significantly from greenhouse gas emissions and other gasses. Many people, for example, are suffering from allergy because of these gasses. Secondly, foods with a low quality such as fast foods, junk foods and any genetically modified ones are influencing to our health very negatively. Finally, life becoming more stressful due to some recent problems such as traffic gam, traffic accidents and others.Given these evidences, it can be seen that people are facing up with many recently appeared illnesses due to aforementioned reasons.
llm: It is undeniable that modern society is grappling with a plethora of new health issues and ailments that were previously unheard of. While many attribute this phenomenon to a sedentary lifestyle, I concur that it is a significant contributing factor, but I also believe that other factors have an even more profound impact.Initially, I acknowledge that a sedentary lifestyle is a precursor to numerous serious health problems. The primary reason for this pervasive sedentarism is the advent of advanced technology. In bygone eras, entertainment options were limited and often required physical presence, resulting in more outdoor activities. In contrast, contemporary city dwellers spend most of their time seated in front of TVs or other devices.However, there are other causal factors contributing to the surge in serious medical problems. Firstly, the modern world's environment is severely polluted by greenhouse gas emissions and other noxious gases, leading to a rise in allergies and other respiratory issues. Secondly, the proliferation of low-quality foods, such as fast food, junk food, and genetically modified products, has a deleterious impact on our health. Lastly, the stresses of modern life, including traffic congestion, accidents, and other urban woes, are taking a significant toll on our well-being.In light of these findings, it is evident that the emergence of new illnesses can be attributed to the aforementioned factors. While a sedentary lifestyle is certainly a contributing factor, it is by no means the sole culprit, and a more nuanced understanding of the interplay between these factors is necessary to combat the rising tide of health problems.

question: Foreign language instruction should begin in kindergarten. Do you agree or disagree?
human: Educational institutions have different systems when it comes to introducing foreign languages to children. Some people believe that foreign language instruction should start in pre-school. However, those who disagree contend that this should be taught in later years. This issue has garnered some attention in the academe as it has an impact on the children's learning. I personally believe that it is important for children to be taught with a secondary language as early as kindergarten.To begin with, children might not be really comfortable with the use of a language other than their native tongue when they are in their kindergarten years. Learning at school must be convenient for them if they speak in a way that they are used to. Moreover, teachers think that foreign language most likely leads to confusion for children who are yet to start learning. Another important thing to consider is that the teacher should be well-trained in the use of this specific language, so quality education will be delivered. Nevertheless, it is undeniable that kids are amazing learners, and the best time to hone them is in their younger years. The introduction of foreign language will be new to them; however, their curiosity will drive them to learn and comprehend. In this way, grasping a new language will be natural to them. In addition, the positive impact of this strategy is beneficial to both learners and teachers. Teachers will not find it difficult to make students learn such new concept in their teenage years. It is certainly clear that the advantages of early introduction of foreign language outweigh its disadvantages.In conclusion, the use of foreign language instruction as early as kindergarten is supported by some people; however, there are those who disagree. I am totally convinced that if this endeavour is properly implemented by schools, this will most likely lead to improvement of learning ability among children.
llm: The introduction of foreign languages to children is a topic of debate among educational institutions, with some advocating for early introduction in pre-school and others suggesting it should be taught in later years. This issue has garnered significant attention in academic circles due to its potential impact on children's learning outcomes. Personally, I firmly believe that teaching children a secondary language as early as kindergarten is essential.Initially, it is understandable that children may feel uncomfortable using a language other than their native tongue during their kindergarten years. Learning should be made convenient and accessible for them, which may involve using language they are familiar with. Additionally, some educators argue that introducing foreign languages too early can lead to confusion, especially if teachers are not adequately trained to deliver quality education in the specific language.However, it is undeniable that children are incredibly adept learners, and their younger years are the optimal time for language acquisition. The introduction of a foreign language may be novel to them, but their natural curiosity will drive them to learn and comprehend. This approach enables children to grasp new languages in a more organic and intuitive way. Furthermore, the benefits of early foreign language introduction are twofold, benefiting both students and teachers. By introducing languages early, teachers will find it easier to build upon this foundation in later years, rather than attempting to introduce complex concepts during adolescence.In conclusion, while there are differing opinions on the matter, I am convinced that the early introduction of foreign language instruction in kindergarten, when properly implemented, will lead to significant improvements in children's learning abilities. The advantages of this approach clearly outweigh the disadvantages, and I firmly support the idea of teaching foreign languages to children from a young age.

question: International tourism has become a huge industry in the world. Some people think that the problems caused by international tourism outweigh benefits. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
human: Along with the advancement of long-distance transportation, international tourism has boomed in the last few decades. Some people believe that this has brought more problems than benefits. I disagree with this view.I admit that tourism can have a negative impact on the natural environment. In order to meet the needs of tourists, local governments are likely to build more facilities and infrastructures around tourist attractions, which may result in the destruction of natural habitats. Tourism also creates more pollution and waste, including growing emission of greenhouse gases, dumped leftovers and overuse of water, power and other kind of energy in luxurious hotels. Based on these grounds, it seems that tourism puts great pressure on ecosystem and local resources, and it should not be encouraged.However, flourishing tourism in a place can be very rewarding in terms of local economy. Holiday makers flocking to other countries are not only bound to spend on tickets of attractions, but also pay for food, accommodation, transportation and entertainment. Both local people and governments can make a large amount of money through these services, and more employment opportunities can be created as well. I also believe the revenue earned form tourism can be used in turn to reduce pollution and protect the environment.Furthermore, the increasing development of tourism is a boon to travelers as well. The provision of direct airlines makes it possible for them to travel conveniently and comfortably. With adequate local facilities and services available, they can spend more of their holidays having fun and relaxing. In addition, both locals and tourists can experience more cultures than ever before, and they can be more open-minded to eliminate preconceptions and deepen mutual understanding among nations.In conclusion, the prosperity of tourism can provide benefits for people on a global scale. Although there are some inevitable problems, they are outweighed by advantages and can be tackled if proper measures are taken.
llm: The rapid growth of international tourism over the past few decades has been fueled by advancements in long-distance transportation. While some argue that this surge in tourism has created more problems than benefits, I firmly disagree. On one hand, it is undeniable that tourism can have detrimental effects on the natural environment. The construction of facilities and infrastructure to cater to tourists can lead to the destruction of natural habitats, while also resulting in increased pollution and waste, including higher emissions of greenhouse gases, litter, and overconsumption of water, power, and energy in luxury hotels. At first glance, these negative impacts on ecosystems and local resources seem to outweigh any potential benefits, suggesting that tourism should be discouraged.However, a thriving tourism industry can have a profoundly positive impact on the local economy. Tourists visiting foreign countries generate significant revenue through their expenditures on attractions, food, accommodations, transportation, and entertainment. This influx of money can be a lucrative source of income for both local residents and governments, while also creating numerous job opportunities. Moreover, I believe that the income derived from tourism can be strategically utilized to mitigate pollution and protect the environment, thus creating a positive feedback loop.Moreover, the expansion of tourism has been highly beneficial for travelers. The availability of direct flights and comprehensive local amenities enables tourists to travel with ease and comfort, allowing them to dedicate more time to leisure and relaxation during their holidays. Additionally, the interchange between locals and tourists facilitates cultural exchange, fostering open-mindedness, dispelling preconceptions, and enhancing mutual understanding among nations.In conclusion, the prosperity of tourism has the potential to yield benefits on a global scale. Although there are undeniable challenges associated with tourism, these are eclipsed by the advantages and can be effectively addressed through the implementation of proper measures.

question: Some children can learn more efficiently by watching TV. Therefore, children should watch TV regularly both in school and at home? do you agree or disagree?
human: Education is undeniably pivotal for an individual. Although, it is agreed that learning by watching TV is more effective to some children, I find it difficult not to oppose against the idea of having students spend more time on TVs. The reason for this is traditional education has its stand for most appropriate method. Thus, physical inactivity should not be encouraged for the aim of bettering youngsters' skills.To begin with, classic teaching methods has been scientifically proven and utilized as the best mode of educate a child. Technology and its advance, to some degrees, have influenced the educational industry positively. Nevertheless, it has not changed the importance of teachers' role in classes. The fact that students nowadays do their homework or researches on computers rather than go to libraries is an illustration for this. Yet, monitors are unable to replace the appearance of educators since their knowledge and adaptability is priceless. Therefore, teacher cannot be switched with some unconscious screens. Secondly, watching television is a very passive action and should not be promoted by increasing periods spent on it. On the other hand, children who have had such activities that interrelate to creativity, cooperation, competition tend to perform significantly better in general terms. For instance, a conducted experiment indicates out-performance in skills like differentiate types of plants or animals of a child that experienced various activities in nature to a child spent most of his time watching documentaries. As a result, such activities can equip a child necessary skill that is useful for his future career.In conclusion, despite the fact that learning by watching TV suits some children, kids should never be encourage to engage in such passive activity. School has been applying traditional teaching procedure since for ages. Additionally, it still performs at its best to equip a child with essential skills.
llm: Education is undeniably crucial for an individual's development, and while some may argue that learning through television is effective for certain children, I strongly disagree with the notion of increasing TV time for students. Traditional education has long been established as the most effective method, and promoting physical inactivity for the sake of improving skills is misguided.Firstly, conventional teaching methods have been scientifically proven to be the best way to educate a child. Although technology has positively impacted the education sector to some extent, it has not diminished the importance of teachers in the classroom. The fact that students now complete homework and research on computers instead of visiting libraries illustrates this point. However, screens cannot replace the invaluable presence of educators, whose knowledge and adaptability are irreplaceable. Therefore, teachers cannot be substituted with inanimate screens.Secondly, watching television is a passive activity that should not be encouraged by increasing screen time. In contrast, children who engage in activities that foster creativity, cooperation, and competition tend to perform significantly better overall. For example, an experiment demonstrated that a child who participated in outdoor activities outperformed a child who spent most of their time watching documentaries in skills such as identifying different types of plants and animals. As a result, such activities can equip a child with essential skills that are valuable for their future career.In conclusion, despite the fact that learning through television may suit some children, kids should not be encouraged to engage in such a passive activity. Schools have successfully applied traditional teaching methods for centuries, and they continue to be the most effective way to equip a child with essential skills.

question: In some countries, with the widespread use of the internet, people are able to work or study from home, instead of having to travel to work or college. Do the advantages of this outweigh the disadvantages? Discuss and state your own opinion.
human: Undoubtedly this is an era of internet which impacts one's personal as well as professional life. The effect is seen more on the developed countries where people choose to work or study from home instead of going to office or university. Some consider this approach to be an advantage while others reject this as a disadvantage. Both the points of views will be discussed in order.On the one hand, the benefit that professionals or students get by connecting from home is enormous. For one, it helps working people to maintain work life balance. The best example is the new mother who can join her work as well as take care of her baby. People also get the desired flexibility in terms of working hours. For students too, studying from home is an attractive option. They save the travelling time to Universities and utilize that time on their studies. In a busy city like Tokyo, students waste a lot of time in travelling. Thus, the advantages that people enjoy by working or studying from home, are obvious.On the other hand, one part of the society, has doubt over the productivity of people who prefers to work or study from home. Many employers argue that once an employee works from isolation, he or she spends a lot of time in communication via phone or email with colleagues. This harms an employee's deliverable. Teachers think that students get affected too as they can not clear their doubts in study topics instantly. Due to this they lag in their studies. These factors affect people who work or study from home.Following both the point of views, the option of working or studying from home is thought to provide more benefits than drawbacks. It is hoped that people will continue to use internet to work or study and improve on the disadvantages into the foreseeable future.
llm: We are undoubtedly living in the age of the internet, which has a profound impact on both our personal and professional lives. This phenomenon is particularly prevalent in developed countries, where many individuals opt to work or study from the comfort of their own homes rather than commuting to offices or universities. While some people view this trend as beneficial, others see it as a disadvantage. This discussion will examine both perspectives in turn.On the one hand, the advantages of working or studying from home are significant. For professionals, it facilitates a better work-life balance. For example, new mothers can easily balance their job responsibilities with childcare duties. Additionally, people enjoy greater flexibility in their working hours. Similarly, for students, studying from home is an attractive option as it saves them time and effort that would be spent commuting to and from universities. In bustling cities like Tokyo, where travel times are notoriously long, this saved time can be productively utilized for studies. The benefits of working or studying from home are thus evident.On the other hand, some members of society express concerns about the productivity of those who prefer to work or study from home. Many employers argue that remote work leads to increased time spent on communication via phone or email with colleagues, potentially harming an employee's productivity. Similarly, teachers worry that students who study from home may struggle to clarify doubts about study topics in real-time, leading to a lag in their academic progress. These factors potentially undermine the effectiveness of working or studying from home.Considering both viewpoints, it appears that the option to work or study from home offers more advantages than disadvantages. It is anticipated that people will continue to leverage the internet for work and study purposes, addressing and improving upon the current drawbacks in the foreseeable future.

question: International tourism has become the biggest industry in the world. Some people think it causes tension between people from different culture. Others think it leads to understanding between countries. To what extend do you agree or disagree?Ê
human: I agree with both opinions that international tourism not only causes tension but also leads to understanding between people from different culture, because most people will be trying to understand each other after they have conflict or debates.There is no doubt that some behaviors of the tourists are not welcome in the local area. Firstly, some people leave the rubbish after visiting the attractions. Therefore, those local residents have to clean the place frequently so that the new batch of tourists will have a tidy and neat environment. Moreover, tourists may offend the local people due to their different culture background. For example, Indians don't eat beef since they worship cows. Thus, if tourists want to respect the tradition, they will not order any beef in the local restaurant. On the other hand, in order to avoid the conflicts between foreigners and locals, people are trying to understand different culture and find solutions. For instance, tourists are given the brochures about the local traditions and customs before they visit the place. Furthermore, the tour guide are willing to help tourists to understand the culture from other countries. Thus, the possibility of the conflicts is reduced because the understanding between both parties.Obviously, people are looking for the solution such as understanding each other while they encounter the conflicts caused by international tourism. Hence, I think international tourism leads to both tension and understanding between people from different culture.
llm: I concur with the dual perspectives on international tourism, acknowledging that it can both create tension and foster understanding between individuals from diverse cultural backgrounds. When conflicts or debates arise, people are often motivated to make an effort to understand each other, thereby bridging the cultural divide.Undoubtedly, certain behaviors exhibited by tourists can be unwelcome in local areas. For instance, some tourists litter after visiting attractions, necessitating frequent cleaning by local residents to maintain a tidy environment for incoming tourists. Additionally, cultural differences can lead to unintentional offenses. For example, in India, where cows are revered, consuming beef is taboo. To show respect for local traditions, tourists should refrain from ordering beef in local restaurants.On the other hand, efforts are being made to mitigate conflicts between foreigners and locals by promoting cross-cultural understanding and finding solutions. For example, tourists are provided with brochures outlining local customs and traditions before their visit. Moreover, tour guides are eager to assist tourists in comprehending foreign cultures, which in turn reduces the likelihood of conflicts. Evidently, when confronted with conflicts stemming from international tourism, people seek solutions that involve mutual understanding. Therefore, I firmly believe that international tourism has the potential to both generate tension and foster understanding among people from diverse cultural backgrounds.

question: Nowadays celebrities are more famous for their glamour and wealth than for their achievements, and this sets a bad example to young people. To what extent do you agree or disagree with this statement?
human: Some people think that celebrities are known for their glamorous lifestyle rather than the work they do. While I agree this will bring negative impacts on the younger generation, this is not necessarily the case for those celebrities who are ambitious in their jobs.It is true that some celebrities tend to show off their images in front of the public. For example, some movie starts enjoy wearing luxury brand clothes and showing their expensive life style in front of the media, thereby gaining the public attention. If they continue to behave in such a way, it will create a misleading image to young people who may think that extraordinary life can be achieved without hard work. Consequently, the attention of young people may become focused on chasing the dream of celebrity status. This is detrimental to study and work ethics and habits. Nevertheless, I believe that other celebrities do set up role models to young people because of their visible accomplishments. Firstly, celebrities such as sports player whose performance and professional skills can be directly seen by their fans. This means that people understand that the great deal of efforts on training is directly linked to their results. Therefore, this kind of self-made celebrity can inspire children to develop their talents through application and perseverance. Secondly, other celebrities such as musician also have achieved great success in their career. Take Michael Jackson as an example, his works are widely spread around the world, and have been extremely welcomed by the younger generation. His songs spread the idea that people should care about each other, which suggests to young people how to become a good member of society. In summary, although some celebrities misguide young people by showing their external wealth and appearance, other celebrities do lead young people in the right direction.
llm: Some individuals believe that celebrities are recognized more for their luxurious lifestyle than for their professional accomplishments. While I concede that this can have negative consequences for the younger generation, I also think that this is not always the case for celebrities who are dedicated to their craft.It is undeniable that some celebrities often prioritize presenting a glamorous image to the public. For instance, certain movie stars revel in wearing high-end designer clothing and showcasing their opulent lifestyle to the media, thereby garnering attention and admiration. If this behavior continues, it may create a distorted perception among young people, leading them to believe that an extraordinary life can be attained without diligent effort. As a result, young people may become fixated on pursuing celebrity status, which can be detrimental to their study habits, work ethics, and overall character development.However, I firmly believe that many celebrities serve as positive role models for young people, thanks to their tangible achievements. Firstly, celebrities like sports athletes, whose performances and skills are directly observable by their fans, demonstrate that hard work and perseverance are essential to achieving success. This can inspire young people to cultivate their talents through dedication and persistence. Secondly, musicians, such as the legendary Michael Jackson, have achieved immense success and have a profound impact on the younger generation. His music, which promotes unity and compassion, offers valuable lessons on how to become a responsible and caring member of society.In conclusion, although some celebrities may mislead young people by showcasing their wealth and material possessions, many others provide a positive influence, guiding young people in the right direction and promoting values such as hard work, perseverance, and social responsibility.

question: Children can effectively learn from watching television. Therefore they should be encouraged to watch TV in both home and school. Agree/Disagree?
human: TV is an immense source of information and pupils can learn and develop various skills by watching it. But I believe that by allowing students to watch TV at both school and house can adversely impact on their overall growth. If children spend too much time in front of TV, it will negatively impact their health and study.It is true that TV is one of the prime source of data and information. There are international and local news channels like BBC, CNBC, Etv Gujarati, Etv Marathi etc to keep individuals updated about latest happenings. By watching TV, children can develop skills in extra-curriculum activities. For example, Cooking programs teach about how to make new dishes and similarly, sports events like cricket, football can teach leadership skills, team building skills, communication skills and many more that can help students in their future jobs.But on other hand, watching TV for a continuously long hours can adversely impact children health. For example, they can get poor eyesight in early ages of childhood, and also develop back pain. Sometimes, students watch restrictive programs not allowed for their ages and this can have major psychological consequences. Many times, students get addictive to their favorite programs like Cartoon channels, or baseball and easily get distracted from study during exam period and this can seriously impact their grades. In conclusion, I believe demerits of watching TV outweigh its merits and thus if students were allowed to freely watch TV without any proper controls by parents or teachers then it would produce more negative effects on children.
llm: While television is a vast source of information and can be a valuable tool for learning and skill development, I firmly believe that unrestricted TV viewing at both home and school can have a detrimental impact on a student's overall growth. Excessive TV watching can have severe consequences on a child's health and academic performance.On the one hand, TV is an excellent source of data and information, with various international and local news channels like BBC, CNBC, Etv Gujarati, and Etv Marathi, which keep viewers informed about current events. Watching TV can also help children develop skills in extracurricular activities, such as cooking programs that teach new recipes, or sports events like cricket and football that promote leadership, teamwork, communication, and other essential skills that can benefit them in their future careers.On the other hand, prolonged TV viewing can have devastating effects on children's health. For instance, it can lead to poor eyesight at a young age, back pain, and other physical problems. Moreover, exposure to age-inappropriate content can have severe psychological consequences. Many students become addicted to their favorite shows, such as cartoons or sports programs, which can distract them from their studies, particularly during exam periods, ultimately affecting their grades.In conclusion, I strongly believe that the drawbacks of TV viewing outweigh its benefits. If students are allowed to watch TV without proper supervision or control from parents or teachers, it can lead to more negative consequences, ultimately hindering their overall development.

question: It has been claimed that workers over 50 are not responsive to rapidly changing ideas in the modern workplace and that for this reason younger workers are to be preferred. To what extent would you support or reject this idea?
human: Throughout human history, the offspring has always proved its stronger adaptability and advancement than its predecessor. This is still true in the industrial society nowadays, where younger workers are preferably employed and promoted rather than over-50 workers. There are three reasons that can explain their unresponsiveness to the modern workplace.First and foremost, old workers are not a patch on the younger ones for their unchanged paradigm. The old were raised in poverty, probably caused by war, look at the world from a negative and pessimistic point of view. The misery is so ingrained in their mind that they refuse to change, or more precisely, to accept the existence of such modernity. For example, most would rather choose to piece together parts of a machine than have it done by a robot for their disbelief of its efficiency and safety compared with human's capability.Secondly, their unresponsiveness can be attributed to their attitude towards life. In other words, that they are aware of their deteriorating health and lack of enthusiasm comes with their taste for monotony and safe ideology. This, by all means, is outweigh by youngsters' adventurousness and bravery. Blatantly seen, success of most companies stems from young people, whose enterprising ideas that catch up with the world is regarded as wind of refreshment.Last but not least, knowledge is worth mentioning as a key factor to help young workers outrank the elderly. Who would the employer choose, an old man with old-fashioned education and a young man who is not only good at fundermentaly subject, but also knows how to program or how to speak foreign languages. Not to undermine old workers, but their lack of authority over such basically required fields in this day and age leads to their incompetence in every modern workplace.All in a nutshell, workers over 50 have proven themselves subordinate to the following generation in all aspects. However, in my point of view, it is still of great importance to remain the harmonious coexistence of both sides for the smooth sailing of the company.
llm: Throughout human history, the younger generation has consistently demonstrated greater adaptability and advancement than their predecessors. This trend persists in today's industrial society, where younger workers are often preferred for employment and promotion over those over 50. There are three key reasons that explain the limited responsiveness of older workers to the modern workplace.Firstly, older workers often cling to outdated paradigms, having been raised in a time of poverty and war, which has instilled in them a negative and pessimistic worldview. This mindset makes them resistant to change and skeptical of modern innovations, such as automation and technology. For instance, many would rather manually assemble machine parts than rely on robotic automation, due to their distrust of its efficiency and safety compared to human capabilities.Secondly, the attitude of older workers towards life also contributes to their limited responsiveness. With a growing awareness of their declining health and decreasing enthusiasm, they tend to prefer routine and safe ideologies. In contrast, younger individuals are often characterized by their adventurousness and bravery, which are essential for driving innovation and success in most companies. The accomplishments of many companies can be attributed to the creative ideas and fresh perspectives of young people, who are able to keep pace with the rapidly changing world.Lastly, knowledge is a crucial factor that gives younger workers an edge over their older counterparts. When faced with the choice between an older worker with outdated education and a younger worker who is not only proficient in fundamental subjects but also skilled in programming, foreign languages, and other modern essentials, the employer is likely to choose the latter. This is not to undermine the value of older workers, but rather to acknowledge that their lack of expertise in these critical areas can lead to incompetence in the modern workplace.In summary, workers over 50 have been outpaced by the younger generation in various aspects. Nevertheless, from my perspective, it is essential to maintain a harmonious coexistence between both age groups to ensure the smooth operation of a company. By valuing and integrating the contributions of all workers, regardless of age, companies can leverage a broader range of skills, experiences, and perspectives to achieve success.

question: The use of machines are increasing day by day which is reducing physical work done by humans. Do you think advantages outweigh the disadvantages
human: Advancements in technology have touched new heights in past few decades. This can be seen no where clearer than in increasing use of machines now a days. These machines reduce the physical work done by humans. Some people think that this is a positive development while others believe it to be disadvantageous for humans.Both sides will be critiqued before a reasoned conclusion is reached.It is felt by many that the usage of machines is harmful for health of humans since machines decrease the work done by people. For example, in many institutions staircases are replaced by lifts now a days. People opt for elevators instead of climbing one or two flight of stairs. It is confirmed in a number of researches that daily usage of elevators in workplaces promotes obesity. So this example clearly shows the linkage between using machines and adverse health effects.On other side of the coin, many people believe that usage of machines makes work easier and less time is consumed for doing similar amount of work. Take the example of use of food processors in kitchens. The work of chopping, blending, grating, kneading has become so easy that people can not imagine their lives without this simple machine at their homes. Thus it is very obvious that using machines makes daily tasks less time consuming and less cumbersome.After analyzing these two points of view, it is believed that using machines is advantageous as machines make work easy and smooth. The negative effects on health can be put on the back seat because there are many other ways to exercise and stay healthy. Therefore, it is hoped that in coming time people will enjoy using more and more machines and will choose alternative ways to stay disease free.
llm: The past few decades have witnessed unprecedented advancements in technology, with the increased use of machines being a notable trend. This shift has sparked a debate about the impact of machines on human life. While some people view the growing reliance on machines as a positive development, others believe it has detrimental effects on human health. This discussion will examine both perspectives before arriving at a reasoned conclusion.On one hand, many individuals argue that the widespread use of machines is detrimental to human health, as it reduces physical activity. For instance, the replacement of staircases with elevators in many institutions has led to a decline in physical exertion. Research has shown that frequent use of elevators in workplaces contributes to obesity. This example illustrates a clear link between machine usage and adverse health consequences.On the other hand, many people believe that machines simplify tasks and reduce the time required to complete them. The use of food processors in kitchens is a prime example. These machines have made tasks such as chopping, blending, and kneading effortless, allowing people to complete their work more efficiently. It is evident that machines make daily tasks less time-consuming and labor-intensive.After evaluating these two perspectives, it appears that the benefits of using machines outweigh the drawbacks. Machines undoubtedly make work easier and more streamlined. While it is true that excessive machine usage can have negative health effects, it is possible to mitigate these effects by engaging in alternative forms of exercise and maintaining a healthy lifestyle. Therefore, it is likely that in the future, people will continue to embrace machine usage and explore alternative ways to stay healthy and disease-free.

question: When a country develops its technology, the traditional skills and ways of life die out. It is pointless to try and keep them alive. To what extend do you agree or disagree with this opinion?
human: These days, most of countries on the world invest for technology. It is evident that technology promotes economy. Many people think that conventional things will not exist and should be eliminated. I totally disagree this opinion.First of all, traditional skills and ways belong to value of culture. They make differences between countries. Every country has unique tradtions which show their creation, intelligence. Consequently, people feel pround of their country, so they keep reserving conventions. For example, ways to build a house in every country are different and they distinguish between countries.In addition, in some cases that traditional way can not replace by a new technology. Lot of people like to use traditional things because if their quality and durability. In paticular, vases are made by hand would be used more. Futhermore, there are plenty of works that using traditional way is unique method. For instance, making cone hats from leaves have to use hand. Not only because there is no machine for the work, but also it looks more beautiful when it is made by hand, so resulting in greater value economy.The last thing is about education. Traditional skills and ways of life will help youngsters study and know more history. Methods which their ancestors used in the past will be displayed again for new generations. After that, they might create somethings that are useful for life.In conclusion, technology has brought many benefits, but traditional skills and ways are always valuable and will last forever.
llm: In today's world, most countries are investing heavily in technology, and it's clear that technology has a positive impact on the economy.
